title: Barwon Health Plumbing Services
description: Barwon Health is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) BANDEST109 for the provision of Plumbing Services at Barwon Health, Geelong.  Barwon Health’s specific requirements in relation to the Goods and/or Services are set out in RFT Part B of this RFT (Specification).In issuing this RFT, Barwon Health seeks to identify a Tenderer: 	able to provide the Goods and/or Services required by Barwon Health in the manner set out in the Specification;	able to demonstrate a commitment and ability to working in collaboration with Barwon Health over the term of any agreed contractual period to continuously seek improvements in value, efficiency and productivity in connection with the provision of the Goods and/or Services; and	prepared to work with Barwon Health to continue to identify opportunities for improvement in the quality and level of service provided to Barwon Health, for the mutual benefit of both Barwon Health and the Tenderer.Barwon Health is committed to improving environmental outcomes through the consideration of environmental factors when determining overall value for money in the procurement of goods and/or services. Consideration of environmental factors is reflected in the requirements of this RFT.

title: Provision for Warehousing & Distribution Services
description: The Department of Transport plans, builds and operates an integrated, sustainable and safe transport system for Australia’s fastest-growing state. Since 1 July 2019, VicRoads and Public Transport Victoria have been part of the Department. As the Victorian Government’s central transport agency, we are accountable for all portfolio funding provided through the State Budget. Our purpose is to deliver simple, connected journeys for people and for freight. Our vision is to meet the aspirations of Victorians for a transport system that is simple, connected, accessible, reliable, safe and supports a productive, growing economy.Additional information about the Department of Transport is available at https://transport.vic.gov.au/The OpportunityThe Department of Transport (Organisation) is seeking responses to this Selective Request for Tender (RFT) for the Provision of Warehousing and Distribution Services.  The details for Provision of Warehousing and Distribution Services are fully outlined in Part A.2 – Specifications.  This Selective RFT for Provision of Warehousing and Distribution Services covers storage, fulfilment and distribution services, collateral destruction services to DoT’s Business Areas and external clients for a period of three years plus two one-year extension options at DoT's discretion.The selective RFT is only open to the notified selective successful respondents as an outcome of the Public Expression of Interest (EOI) released in November 2021.All RFT respondents are to complete clarification questions or requests for information (see clause 2.2. of Part B.2). Addendum 1: DoT 0013 RFT Responses to Clarification Questions (11 March 2021)

title: Inglewood & Districts Health Service - Internal Audit
description: Inglewood & Districts Health Service of 3 Hospital Street, Inglewood VIC 3517, ABN 59 289 296 574, a Public Health Service incorporated pursuant to the provisions of the Health Services Act 1988 as amended is seeking responses to this Request for Quotation for the provision of Internal Audit Services.

title: NGV CONTEMPORARY DESIGN COMPETITION
description: NGV CONTEMPORARY DESIGN COMPETITIONTENDER NOTICE 1. Notice of Procurement Commencement The Expression of Interest (EOI) phase for the NGV Contemporary Design Competition will commence on 2 March 2021.The Registration phase will remain open for Australian Architects, Architectural Companies and Architectural Partnerships until 2pm AEDT on 9 March 2021.2. Participation RequirementsTo participate in the EOI you must have registered or be part of a team that includes someone who has registered. To register for the NGV Contemporary Design Competition before 2pm AEDT on 9 March 2021 refer  https://www.ngv.vic.gov.au/ngv-contemporary-design-competition/3. Access to EOI DocumentationDuring the EOI phase, only those who have registered will be able to access EOI documentation via Ansarada, the online system which Competitors will use to exchange information with Development Victoria and through which they will lodge their Submissions.All Registrants must setup their accounts on Ansarada in order to access the EOI documentation. If you have experienced difficulty in account setup please contact the Competition Advisor CityLab: ngvcontemporary@citylab.com.au4. TimelineThe EOI Part A phase will commence on 2 March 2021 and close on 30 March 2021.The NGV Contemporary design team is anticipated to be announced in Summer 2021/22.5. Additional InformationInformation on the NGV Contemporary Design Competition, including how to register your interest, can be found on the NGV Contemporary Design Competition website: https://www.ngv.vic.gov.au/ngv-contemporary-design-competition/

title: Large Aircraft Tankers (LATS) Mixing & Loading
description: Department of Environment, Land, Water and PlanningRequest for eTenderLarge Aircraft Tankers (LATS) Mixing & LoadingT2001-0063The Department is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) T2001-0063 for the provision of Mixing and Loading services of Fire Retardant for the LAT program. The intention is to have a three-year contract, or contracts, with the option for two x one year extensions.  DELWP will be providing the retardant and foam for the mixing and loading services.Respondents may select to respond to supporting:	All Nominated Operating Base and/or Temporary Operating Bases; or	Nominated Operating Bases: Avalon Airport (primary); or	Temporary Operating Bases: Albury Airport (primary), East Sale and MilduraA Request for Tender (RFT) is available for download from the Victorian Government Tender website located at www.tenders.vic.gov.au (Buying Victoria).All enquiries relating to this tender must be directed to Sharon Dimmock either by phone on 0467 801 636 or email: sharon.dimmock@delwp.vic.gov.au  Submissions must be lodged electronically at www.tenders.vic.gov.au.Tenders close at 2.00pm on Thursday 8 April 2021When arranging lodgement of tenders be aware that DELWP does not issue receiptsFacsimile, e-mail or late tenders will not be accepted.The lowest or any tender will not necessarily be accepted.Find information about DELWP on the Internet at www.delwp.vic.gov.au

title: 10268 - Long term maintenance plant and equipment hire for SprayLine Road Services
description: CN10268 – Long term maintenance plant and equipment hire for SprayLine Road Service.Hire of fully maintained and serviced road maintenance, spray sealing, line marking and minor construction plant and equipment with the associated plant fleet management system for a period of seven years plus two years extension option at the discretion of the Department of Transport (SprayLine Road Services).A compulsory pre-tender briefing will be held commencing at 10:00AM on 17 March 2021 via MS Teams.Tenderers shall request for an invitation to attend the online briefing by sending an email to Mr Jose Leong at jose.leong@roads.vic.gov.au by 5:00pm on 15 March 2021. A senior representative/partner of the Tenderer shall attend for the duration of the briefing. Tenders from a pre-registered (invited) Tenderer who has not attended the briefing, or from a Tenderer who has not registered or attended the briefing, will be considered for acceptance at the discretion of the Department of Transport (SprayLine Road Services).Contact Jose Leong on Jose.Leong@roads.vic.gov.au or mobile no 0409 184 928 for tender document enquiries and more information.Advertisement Date: Wednesday, 3 March 2021Closing Date: Wednesday, 14 April 2021 at 3:30PMDue to COVID-19 restrictions, ALL submissions must be via TendersVic on the closing date.

title: Fixed Wing Services
description: Please find attached the link to the Virtual Tour of Air Ambulance at Essendon Airport.Ambulance Victoria is seeking to engage a Contractor to provide a high quality, professional, responsive, safe and reliable state wide Fixed Wing Patient Transport Service operating 24 hours a day, seven days a week.  The Contractor must maintain a high standard of both safety and patient care and ensure service delivery optimisation through innovation and improving the efficiency and responsiveness of the services.Ambulance Victoria proposes to appoint a Contractor for an initial contract term of ten (10) years with an option to extend for two (2) further years, or a twelve (12) year contract term with no extension option.  The Service Commencement Date of the proposed contract is 1 January 2024.A mandatory Industry Briefing and site inspection i is scheduled for Monday 22 Februay at Essendon Fields.All updates to the RFT process and timelines will be provided on www.tenders.vic.gov.auAll enquiries must be forwarded to:Attention: Sharon Haywardtender.queries@ambulance.vic.gov.au

title: Interest in the Grant of a Wagering and Betting Licence under the Gambling Regulation Act 2003 (Vic)
description: The current 12-year Wagering and Betting Licence (the Licence), issued under the Gambling Regulation Act 2003 (Vic), expires in August 2024.The Department of Justice and Community Safety (department) is now issuing a request calling for expressions of interest (EOI) from suitable gaming operators who wish to be considered to be invited to apply for the post-2024 Licence.The new Licence will authorise the conduct of several gambling activities, including pari-mutuel and fixed odds betting, the only ability to operate an off-course wagering and betting retail network in Victoria, and a betting exchange.Interested parties will need to respond to the EOI request, demonstrating, at a high level, their suitability to operate a wagering and betting business and responding to a number of options being considered by the department in relation to the term and exclusivity of the new Licence. The EOI documents provide full detail about this opportunity and the response requirements. Close of questions and clarifications regarding the EOI Request - 5.00pm AEST, 22 April 2021

title: Community Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Request for Proposal
description: Barwon Health is calling for proposals for a Community Electronic Medical Record solution that will serve as a strategic platform for community services beginning with Mental Health, Drug and Alcohol Services and Community Health Services including community nursing. The identification and selection of a suitable technology product will also lead to the selection of a strategic partner for professional services for delivery and potentially on-going services for management of the solution.Details of the solution sought are contained in attachments referenced in Appendix A

title: RFQ Painting Services
description: Heywood Rural Health seeks a Request for Quotation for the appointment of a suitably qualified and experienced contractor to provide painting services as part of the Health Service’s scheduled 5 year maintenance of its buildings.There are seven designated work areas that will requiring painting over the five year program – five exterior building areas and two interior building areas.Exterior painting services will be provided on a once per financial year basis, with a different section (area) of the Heywood campus targeted every 12 months. Depending upon budget, the exterior painting of the campus’ buildings may be condensed into a shorter period.Interior painting services includes the painting of designated hospital corridors in year one, with the potential for the painting of patient rooms (aged care wings) following the completion of other minor works projects.In addition, the appointed contractor may be requested to undertake smaller, emergent painting services whilst on-site.It is imperative that all prospective Contractors visit the Heywood Campus prior to submitting a tender to avail themselves of the full extent of painting services required to complete HRH’s Program of works.

title: ITS2-00262 Buchan Caves Reserve Site Concept Plan
description: The scope of services are for a Landscape Architect led team to undertake the concept design for the Buchan Caves Reserve that was subject to the fires of summer 2019/2020. This is a partnership project under joint management between Gunaikurnai Land and Waters Aboriginal Corporation (GLAWAC) and Parks Victoria (PV).

title: MID2030 Phase 2 - May 2021 Irrigation Upgrades
description: MID2030 Phase 2 May 2021 Irrigation UpgradesThis tender has been released on Tenderlink with documents available for download from https://portal.tenderlink.com/srw/  or  MID2030 Phase 2 - May 2021 Irrigation Upgrades

title: Supply of Meat and Poultry
description: Western District Health Service (WDHS) invites tenders for the supply, preparation and delivery of meat and poultry products (‘Goods’) to its Hamilton, Penshurst and Coleraine campuses. The initial contract term will be two years with WDHS expecting to appoint one supplier but reserves the right to appoint more than one. WDHS does not intend to appoint more than one supplier to any single product category.

title: Secondary Storage and Ancillary Services
description: WorkSafe requires a supplier to store its current and future physical records in an Approved Public Record Office Storage Supplier (APROSS) certified facility in accordance with PROV (Public Record Office Victoria) standards.WorkSafe is seeking to engage a supplier to provide the services to support its statewide operations, from July 2021. WorkSafe is inviting offers for the delivery of the services for five years, with the option of extension for a further two years in one year increments. (5+1+1)

title: Vehicle Fixed Workshop Services
description: Ambulance Victoria (AV) is seeking to contract with several service providers to provide a panel of vehicle fleet fixed workshops in metropolitan Melbourne.The Service Commencement Date of the proposed contract is 1 June 2021.From the Tendering Process AV proposes to appoint Contractors for an initial contract term of four or five years with an option for further extension by AV for up to two years.  The contract term will be determined by AV after review of responses.Key objectives of the RFT process are that the panel of workshops:	are in suitable geographic proximity to the AV Support Centres listed in the RFT to minimise travel distance/times; and	provide suitable coverage, capability and capacity across the AV metropolitan area of operation.Further details are provided in the RFT documents.

title: South Geelong to Waurn Ponds Duplication Project
description: Rail Projects Victoria (a division of the Major Transport Infrastructure Authority) intends to call for Expressions of Interest (EOIs) for the South Geelong to Waurn Ponds Duplication Project (the Project) in January 2021 via the Tenders VIC website.The Project is the next stage of investment on the Geelong Line that will upgrade infrastructure between South Geelong and Waurn Ponds to enable more frequent and reliable services for passengers.The Project is expected to consist of track duplication and signalling upgrades between South Geelong and Waurn Ponds, upgrades at South Geelong and Marshall stations and grade separations at Surf Coast Highway and Fyans Street.Interested parties must be registered and meet the pre-qualification requirements in order to fully participate in the procurement process. Following the release of the Invitation for EOI, only pre-qualified parties will be provided access to additional supporting EOI documentation via an Electronic Data Room. The purpose of the EOI Phase is for RPV to select Shortlisted Respondents to participate in the Request for Proposal Phase who have the proven experience, capability and capacity to deliver the Project and who are aligned with RPV’s commercial and legal framework for the WPD Project delivery. In their EOI Response, pre-qualified parties will be required to demonstrate relevant experience, their understanding of the project, proposed delivery approach and program, as well as their acceptance of RPV’s terms and conditions.The following indicative dates apply to the procurement process:	Date of release of the pre-qualification document: 4 January 2021	EOI release (via www.tenders.vic.gov.au): Access will be made available to supporting EOI documentation (via Electronic Data Room to pre-qualified parties only) from the date of EOI release.To view the Advance Tender Notice and pre-qualification document, click here.

title: Provision of Internal Audit Services
description: Monash Health is seeking responses from appoint an internal auditor for both Monash Health and Kitaya Holdings Pty Ltd for a period of 5 years.The scope of services includes but not limited to:	Conducting independent assessments, evaluation and practical recommendations relating to:			internal controls over financial, clinical and operational areas;		internal controls over revenue, expenditure, assets and liabilities;		efficiency, effectiveness and economy of significant Board programs;		compliance with regulations, policies, best practice guidelines and contractual arrangements;		compliance with the Standing Directions under the Financial Management Act;		assessment of the adequacy of security of digital platforms; and		review of process improvement activities and projects.			Determine suitability of corrective measures implemented in response to audit findings and recommend closure of audit recommendations to the relevant Audit and Risk Committees	Develop, in consultation with management and the Audit and Risk Committees an annual audit plan for Monash Health and Kitaya Holdings Pty Ltd	Attendance of internal auditors at all Monash Health and Kitaya Holdings Pty Ltd Audit and Risk Committees and audit meetings with senior management	Production of audit reports, annual audit plans, strategic longer term audit plans and status updates for all activities undertaken	Dedicated internal auditor engagement team with access to specialised audit teams as required with appropriate qualifications and expertise, for example, digital security auditors, healthcare expertise etc.	Provision of relevant risk intelligence and trends to Monash Health and Kitaya Holdings Pty Ltd Management and Audit and Risk Committees.

title: TEN-21-0000007 Multidisciplinary Team Meeting Management Solution
description: This is a call for interested parties to provide Monash Health with information and a submission regarding potential software packages capable of supporting the Multidisciplinary Team Meeting Management MDM workflows across the entire organisation.This is a call for interested parties to provide Monash Health with information and a submission regarding potential software packages capable of supporting the MDM workflows across the entire organisation.

title: Roster, Time and Attendance System
description: Melbourne Health has been using Roster on as the organisation’s rostering and time and attendance software for a number of years. This is currently held on premise and is also used to award interpret shifts worked and interfaces back into our payroll system SAP to correctly pay employees.We are engaging the market to determine indicative cost and timeframes which will be used as a benchmark in consideration of changing the current system to a fully supported cloud based system, which is future proofed and able to cater for our complex rostering requirements as well as all our Victorian Public Health EBAs for approx. 12,000 employees.

title: Atherstone Branch Sewer
description: Western Water invites Tenders from Contractors experienced in infrastructure works for the construction of Atherstone Branch SewerSCOPE OF WORKS: Works involve the construction of below assets:Pipe size : Approximately 296 meters of 300 Dia & 386 meters of 375 Dia Sewer mainREGISTRATION: Tender documents can be obtained using Tenders VicENQUIRIES: Tender enquiries should be directed via Tendes Vic forum.SUBMISSIONS: Completed responses must be submitted via Tenders VIcRespondents will receive Successful Submission Receipt timed and dated upon completion.Should assistance be required please contact Tenders Vic Support.CLOSING DATE AND TIME: Tenders close at 2.00 pm AEDT on Friday 12/03/2021 , submissions must be fully received by this time. Western Water is not bound to accept the lowest priced Tender or all or any part of a Tender and reserves the right to conduct the Request for Tender process and select the successful respondent(s) as it sees fit. Western Water staff are unable to respond to verbal enquiries in relation to the proposal. Late, verbal or emailed proposals will not be accepted.

title: Property Valuers Tender
description: InvitationSTL invites proposals from suitably qualified organisations able to manage the following range of services; 1. Act as instructed agent to undertake valuation services 2. May be the primary and sole entity delivering the full range of services  Scope of Services  Current Services fall into 8 broad categories; 	Residential Property Valuation for sale and purchase	Commercial Property Valuation for sale and purchase	Desktop Valuations including retrospective Valuations	Rural Property Valuations including property/stock/equipment and station	Vacant land Valuations	Retirement Village Valuations as required	Any other miscellaneous valuations as required ie – relocatable/mobile homes and cabins	Valuations for the purpose of obtaining insurance on the above property types	Revaluations

title: Wodonga High Level Water Storage (Bears Hill) Repair
description: North East Water intends to remediate the concrete liner of the 16 ML Wodonga High Level Water Storage, located off Donnington Drive in Wodonga. The integrity of the storage currently causes unacceptable water losses due to failed joint seals and increasingly porous concrete panels. North East Water has determined the most effective course of remediation will be the installation of a two part, spray on Polyurea liner. The works will be required to be completed in a limited timeframe during the low water demand winter months.

title: Cleaning Services
description: Barwon Health is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) BH_RFT_2021-1001 for the provision of Cleaning services.The Tender Scope and Pricing is divided into Two parts.	Part 1, the provision of Ad-hoc and specialist project works covering a wide range of Barwon Health Sites (excluding sites identified in Part 2).	Part 2, the provision of planned waste and recycling bin cleaning services located at the University Hospital Geelong and one off-site location.

title: North East Line Level Crossings Upgrade Project
description: The Australian Commonwealth and Victorian governments have invested more than $2 billion in the Regional Rail Revival program (RRVP), which is upgrading every regional passenger rail line in Victoria. The project under this tender is a component of the North East Line Upgrade (NELU) Program under the RRVP which will deliver improvements to the North East Line to enable future operation of VLocity or similar new generation regional trains on the standard gauge line through to Albury.The objectives for the North East Line Upgrade wider program are as follows:	Improve passenger service reliability by upgrading track condition and addressing the main causes of delay;	Improve ride quality and comfort for travellers by reducing bumps experienced during travel;	Upgrade the North East line to a Victorian Class 2 performance standard, bringing it into line with other parts of Victoria’s regional rail network; and	Allow VLocity trains to run to Albury/Wodonga for the first time;Within this wider program, Rail Projects Victoria (RPV) has nominated VicTrack to deliver the protection upgrade to the level crossings at:	Bennetts Road, Lilliput; and	Wilbrahams Road, BalmattumThe Scope under proposed contract CN001760 North East Line Level Crossings Upgrade includes all activities necessary to design, specify, develop, supply, deliver, construct, install, integrate, test, commission and handover the North East Line Upgrade Supporting Infrastructure Level Crossing Upgrades, which comprises the following Works:(a) Upgrade of Wilbrahams Road public level crossing from passive to active, including detection, protection, signalling and associated road works; and(b) Upgrade of Bennetts Road public level crossing from passive to active, including detection, protection, signalling and associated road works. Tenderers are advised that there are a number of mandatory conditions that must be met. Those that are interested in providing a submission should familiarise themselves with these requirements in the first instance along with the conditions of tendering.It should be noted that due to the federal funding, there will be additional accreditation and reporting requirements.ARTC competencies are mandatory for the successful Tenderer. The Tender documents are accessible via the Buying Victoria Website Only, with any RFI’s or Information to be strictly communicated within the Buying For Victoria website.Avetta RegistrationTenderers are advised that pre-qualification through VicTrack's compliance partner, Avetta, is a pre-requisite for the final contract execution.  Costs associated with this registration may be included in the tender submission for any potential supplier not currently pre-qualified.https://victrack.com.au/supplier

title: Supplementary  Tender - Continence Management Products
description: HSV Supplementary Tender on Continence Management Products HPVITS2016-009.001HealthShare Victoria (HSV)Health Purchasing Victoria (‘HPV’) was established by section 129(1) of the Health Services Act 1988 and is a public authority which represents the Crown. HPV’s functions include ‘to supply or facilitate access to the supply of goods and services to public hospitals and other health or related services on best value terms’.HealthShare Victoria (HSV), established in 2021 brings Health Purchasing Victoria’s existing functions and major supply chain assets under single management.Purpose of the Invitation to Supply (ITS)HSV is seeking responses for Continence Management Products for use in Participating Health Services. The envisaged Term of the Agreement is the balance of the two years from the completion of this ITS process to the end date of the contract extension that will be in place being the period from 28 April 2021 to 27 April 20The scope of this ITS covers the supply of Continence Management Products.Submission of tender - HSV Procurement PortalRespondents are required to download this ITS from the HSV Procurement Portal. Prior to downloading the ITS, Respondents are required to formally register their contact details on the website: www.healthsharevic.org.auHSV HelpdeskPlease contact our helpdesk for any assistance, email to: suppliers@hpv.zendesk.com

title: Melbourne Polytechnic Glasshouse Project, Epping Campus
description: Melbourne Polytechnic is seeking EOIs in response to this Invitation for Expressions of Interest from suitably qualified suppliers for the design, supply and installation of an aquaponics and hydroponics glasshouse, classroom and facility to be located at the Melbourne Polytechnic Epping Campus at Cooper Street & Dalton Road, Epping, Victoria.

title: 10240 - Signal Upgrade at the Intersection of Park Street, Wells Street and Palmerston Crescent, South Melbourne
description: 10240 - Signal Upgrade at the Intersection of Park Street, Wells Street and Palmerston Crescent, South MelbournePrequalification Level : STS1Advertisement Closing Date: 17 March 2021For Contract document request please email Mari.Cortese-Milone@roads.vic.gov.au or please call: Mari Cortese-Milone Ph: 9854 2489Due to COVID-19 restrictions, ALL submissions must be via Buying for Victoria (TendersVic) on the closing date.

title: Victorian Public Housing After Hours Phone Service
description: The department is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced contractor to provide an After Hours Phone Service to receive and action maintenance and emergency calls received for public housing throughout Victoria.The Department of Health and Human Services (the department) is responsible for the maintenance of approximately 75,000 units of public housing in the State of Victoria. This housing varies from high-rise towers in inner Melbourne to individual houses in suburban and regional areas.   Public housing tenants are provided with a phone number to call to report any maintenance issues associated with their rental property. During the hours of 7.00pm and 7.00am on weekdays, between 7.00pm Friday and 7.00am Monday, and on public holidays, maintenance phone calls are transferred to an After Hours Phone Service.The AHPS provider enters relevant information associated with the maintenance request into the department’s electronic system for ordering maintenance work and refers any urgent maintenance requests to maintenance contractors for action.

title: EGHS Solar Carparks
description: East Grampians Health Service (EGHS) is responsible for providing health related services to the Grampians Region of Western Victoria.The Victorian Government through the Department of Environment, Land, Water and Planning (DELWP) has provided a grant to East Grampians Health Services (EGHS) to facilitate the delivery of three structures in the Ararat Hospital Visitors Carpark that provide shade and shelter to vehicles and generate electricity through photo voltaic roof panels. The DELWP grant is to deliver the project as an integrated project consisting of extensive PV arrays supplying the hospital with electricity and weather protection to the existing landscaped carpark.

title: Statewide Community Outreach for the Power Saving Bonus
description: The Victorian Government is concerned about the impact of energy prices on consumers, particularly due to:	the COVID-19 pandemic; and	the scale of the impact on the most vulnerable members of the community.Subsequently, a the $250 Power Saving Bonus (PSB) was launched on 1 February 2021, which is designed to assist the most vulnerable energy consumers.Whilst awareness of the $250 PSB program is expected to reach a significant portion of target consumer cohorts through mainstream channels, there is a critical need to provide additional awareness and support for more hard-to-reach consumers.The $250 PSB program subsequently requires tailored community outreach support to ensure that all eligible customers are:	aware of the program;	supported to access it; and	informed of other beneficial energy affordability initiatives.DELWP intends to award multiple contracts for the delivery of the SCO-PSB; all organisations engaged in service delivery will be required to work in consultation with the other contracted organisations to limit overlap in delivery (facilitated by DELWP).The once-off $250 PSB is available to households with recipients that meet the eligibility criteria. To be eligible for the bonus, applicants must:	be a Victorian residential energy consumer (i.e. have a residential electricity account).	receive one of the following concession benefits:			Centrelink Pension Concession Card		JobSeeker, Youth Allowance, Abstudy or Austudy		Department of Veterans Affairs Pensioner Concession Card

title: Customer Communications Management System (CCMS)
description: The purpose of the proposal is to partner with a supplier to realise the Principal’s ongoing business requirements for correspondence production and distribution capabilities, including:	Purchase and installation of a new CCMS solution (any hardware and software)	Warranty and support services for the CCMS solution.	 	Decommissioning of any existing software is not in the scope of this proposal.

title: Mt Buller Rd Spoon Drain Earthworks & Concreting
description: Mt Buller Mt Stirling Alpine Resort Management is requesting for tender to construct approx. 290m of spoon drain to manage stormwater and groundwater along Mt Buller Tourist Road. Please see the attached document for detailed scope of works, specifications and response schedules.

title: Centralised Property Maintenance
description: InvitationSTL invites proposals from suitably qualified organisations able to manage the following range of services;	Maintenance & Repairs and	Property Inspection & Content Management	Cleaning, sales and storage Respondents may be either; 	The primary and sole entity delivering the full range of services, or	An alliance partner with another party or parties proposing a combined solution comprising part of the services

title: BHI Campus Floor Coverings Project
description: BHI invites you to submit a Tender for Floor Coverings Works to commercial and educational buildings required at all campuses. Your Tender should be formulated around the following factors:	Supply and install carpet tiles suitable for high foot traffic school environment. 	Supply and install Vinyl suitable for high foot traffic school environment.	Removal of existing floor coverings.	Works to be completed to a high standard.	Works to be undertaken on a flexible basis in order to minimise disruption to students and educators.	It is expected that works will be undertaken across three (3) phased programs of work with Phase 1 required to be completed by no later than end of April 2021. All works to be completed August 2021.

title: Katunga Water Treatment Plant Upgrade
description: All GVW Contractors who tender for work with a total of 100k or more will be required to have a third party certified safety system  e.g. AS/NZS 4801:2001The following description of works, but not limited to, for this contract are at the Katunga Water Treatment Plant (WTP) and comprise the design, supply, construction, testing and commissioning of works.Brief Scope of works:	That will enable an additional clear water storage comprising 3 x 50 kL ground level storage tanks (manufactured offsite)	High lift pumps to lift water from the new ground storage to the existing elevated tank	Chlorination facilities	New Pump Building and modifications to the existing chlorination	Civil	Mechanical	Electrical, including replacement of the existing switchboards. Electrical is inclusive of electrics for the highlift pump and for the new and existing bore pumps	Associated works as shown on the drawings accompanying this specification.	Project Management, including but limited to:			Preparation and implementation of a Construction Management Plan.		Preparation and implementation of an Environmental Management Plan.		Preparation and implementation of a Quality Management Plan.		Preparation and implementation of a Health and Safety Co-ordination Plan.

title: OHS Assurance Program
description: The provision of a comprehensive OHS Assurance program, which consist of	Delivery of two types of on-site audits and reports in all four regions and metropolitan, regional and rural Victoria;	Site audit Checklist;	Miscellaneous improvement opportunities; and	Oversight of assurance functionality within the Department’s online system.The Department of Education and Training has implemented an OHS Management System (OHSMS) in all Victorian Government schools, based on the key elements of the Australian Standard, AS/NZS 4801 – Occupational Health and Safety Management System. The OHSMS provides a framework for the effective management of OHS risks in schools to actively protect the health, safety and wellbeing of staff, students, contractors and visitors to whom a duty of care is owed under the OHS Act 2004 (the OHS Act), OHS Regulations 2017 and other relevant legislation.The OHS School Audit Program was established in 2011 to achieve the following key objectives:	Test compliance with legal obligations;	Test conformance of work practices in each school with DET OHSMS policies and procedures; andIdentify opportunities for performance improvement to increase the effectiveness of the OHSMS in delivering safe outcomes.  *** Notice 01 *** Please notice that the QandA Bulletin 01 and industry briefing presentation slides have been published and available for you to download. And also, Please utilise the latestest ITS document (Version 02) for your ITS submission as additional questions have been included in the ITS Part D for listed below points, - Commitment to the Supplier Code of Conduct and Mandatory Requirements (B) and (C) - Question (3) at Capability and Resourcing section   *** Notice 02 ***Please be informed that the ITS closure date has been extended to 14:00 AEST on 09 March 2021, and also find the copy of QandA Bulletin 02 at the attachment.  *** Notice 03 ***Please find the copy of QandA Bulletin 03 at the attachment.

title: Provision of Uniforms and Personal Protective Clothing (PPC)
description: EPA Victoria wishes to engage suitably skilled, experienced, qualified and reputable supplier(s) for the supply and delivery of Uniforms and Personal Protective Clothing (PPC).  In issuing this RFT, EPA seeks to identify suppliers who are: (a) able to provide Uniform and PPC required by EPA in the manner as set out in the Part B - Specifications; (b) able to manufacture items to allow EPA to satisfy the State Government's Locally Manufactured Uniforms and Personal Protective Equipment Policy:       "Local" - The goods must be manufactured within Australia or New Zealand;        "Manufactured" - The goods must substantially transformed (for example, a clothing item must be transformed from fabric to garment through the cut, make and trim process); and          “Able to be locally manufactured" - That there exists in Australia or New Zealand a genuine market and manufacturers who are able to manufacturer the goods;  (c) able to maximise the value for money obtained by EPA; (d) able to comply with all mandatory requirements; and (e) comply with EPA Contract Terms and Conditions. EPA Victoria will select a supplier or panel of suppliers registered on the Ethical Supplier Register.  To be on the register, suppliers of textiles, clothing and footwear sector uniforms and personal protective equipment manufactured in Australia must be accredited or in the process of seeking accreditation with Ethical Clothing Australia. Please refer to the Buying for Victoria website for more information. Those currently not on the register are encouraged to apply.   Estimated commencement date of contract is July 2021.  Initial contract term is for (3) years plus two (2) one (1) year extensions.

title: Provision of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
description: To All Tenderers,Upon review of the RFT 2021-034 for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), EPA have removed the Mandatory Requirement 4 from previous RFT documents.The reason for this change is based on market feedback with PPE not considered "clothing", and therefore ECA Accreditation is not a mandatory requirement.EPA would like to re issue the Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), with a closing date of 14 April 2021 2PM AEST (Melbourne Time)For those who have previously submitted, for ease, please indicate to EPA that existing Tender Submission is sufficient to meet EPA's revised Part A, B, C, D, & Pricing schedule requirements by emailing procurement@epa.vic.gov.au with the subject line:"RFT 2021-034 Provision of Personal Protective Equipment - Supplier Name - Previous Tender Submission Aligned"Replacing Supplier Name with your organisations name.Thank you, and we look forward to your Tender SubmissionsRegards,Winsor YuTender Manager--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------To All Suppliers,Thank you for your interest in RFT 2021-034 Provision of Personal Protective Equipment Request For Tender.In preparation for the Tender Close tomorrow at 10 March 2021 2PM AEST, EPA Victoria, requests that you indicate your Intention to provide Tender Submission.Please email procurement@epa.vic.gov.au with the subject line:"RFT 2021-034 Provision of Personal Protective Equipment - Confirmation of Intent to provide Tender Submission" if in the affirmative.Regards,Winsor YuTender ManagerEPA Victoria--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------EPA Victoria wishes to engage suitably skilled, experienced, qualified and reputable supplier(s) for the supply and delivery of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).In issuing this RFT, EPA seeks to identify suppliers who are: (a) able to provide PPE required by EPA in the manner as set out in the Part B - Specifications;(b) able to manufacture items to allow EPA to satisfy the State Government's Locally Manufactured Uniforms and Personal Protective Equipment Policy:    "Local" - The goods must be manufactured within Australia or New Zealand;     "Manufactured" - The goods must substantially transformed (for example, a clothing item must be transformed from fabric to garment through the cut, make and trim process); and     “Able to be locally manufactured" - That there exists in Australia or New Zealand a genuine market and manufacturers who are able to manufacturer the goods;(c) able to maximise the value for money obtained by EPA;(d) able to comply with all mandatory requirements; and(e) comply with EPA Contract Terms and Conditions.EPA Victoria will select a supplier or panel of suppliers registered on the Ethical Supplier Register. To be on the register, suppliers of textiles, clothing and footwear sector uniforms and personal protective equipment manufactured in Australia must be accredited or in the process of seeking accreditation with Ethical Clothing Australia. Please refer to the Buying for Victoria website for more information. Those currently not on the register are encouraged to apply.Estimated commencement date of contract is July 2021.Initial contract term is for (3) years plus two (2) one (1) year extensions.

title: Victorian Public Housing Estates – Contaminated Waste
description: The department is seeking suitably qualified and experienced contractors to provide contaminated waste services (sharps collection and disposal) to high rise public housing estates in Melbourne.The intent of this contract is to ensure that a clean and hygienic environment exists for the people who live on and visit the estates. The Specification is for the provision of site inspections, collection, disposal and reporting of syringes on housing estates and various properties. The estates and properties comprise of town houses, high-rise, single storey flats, walk-up flats and dual occupancy units, which the Department of Health and Human Services has the responsibility to maintain.

title: Victorian Public Housing Estates - Pest Control
description: The department is seeking suitably qualified and experienced contractors to provide pest control services to high rise public housing buildings in Melbourne.The intent of this contract is to effectively manage rats, mice and cockroaches in high-rise public housing buildings in Melbourne, by a fully qualified and experienced pest control operator.  The management of these pests is to occur in the areas of the buildings that are not inhabited by residents.  These areas include plant rooms (that contain machinery and equipment to service the building), rubbish collection areas, communal laundries and clothes drying rooms.

title: Psychological Wellbeing Service
description: The Department of Justice and Community Safety (the Department) values the occupational health and safety of all its employees. A strong evidence base supports that vicarious trauma and burnout have far-reaching implications for staff who case manage offenders and/or are exposed to traumatic material.Corrections Victoria (CV), a business unit of the Department, seeks to procure a Psychological Wellbeing Service for employees in specified roles, with a focus on management and prevention of evidence-based symptomology of vicarious trauma and burnout.A Psychological Wellbeing Service (PWS) is to be delivered state-wide either at the locations of the relevant CV employees via one-hour face-to-face sessions, online or via phone depending on employees preference and COVID-19 restrictions. A contract/s will be awarded to ensure coverage across the state, and the extent of coverage of an offer (for example through establishment of a consortium or due to state-wide organisational presence) will form part of the evaluation; however, Offerers are invited to tender for all or part of the service on a geographic or other appropriate basis.

title: Youngs Creek Loop Walking Track Bridge, Youngs Creek Reservoir ‐ Stairs and Viewing Platform and Little Cabbage Tree Creek ‐ Stairs and Viewing Platform
description: Department of Environment, Land, Water and PlanningRequest for eTenderYoungs Creek Loop Walking Track Bridge, Youngs Creek Reservoir ‐ Stairs and Viewing Platform; and Little Cabbage Tree Creek ‐ Stairs and Viewing PlatformT2001-0087The Department is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) # T2001-0087 for the provision of Services tendered for the construction of walking track bridge at Youngs Creek walking track and the construction of stairs and viewing platforms at Youngs Creek Reservoir and Little Cabbage Tree Creek.RFT documentation is available for download from the Victorian Government Tender website located atwww.tenders.vic.gov.au (Buying Victoria).All enquiries relating to this tender must be directed to Garry Carr either by phone on 0467707632 oremail: garry.carr@delwp.vic.gov.auSubmissions must be lodged electronically at www.tenders.vic.gov.au.Tenders close at 2.00pm local time on Thursday 18 March 2021.When arranging lodgement of tenders be aware that DELWP does not issue receipts.Facsimile, e-mail or late tenders will not be accepted.The lowest or any tender will not necessarily be accepted.Find information about DELWP on the Internet at www.delwp.vic.gov.au

title: Insurance Services
description: State Trustees is seeking an undertaking from an insurance broker that all STL’s clients’ assets are insured solely by virtue of a person having become a client of STL. We are seeking the assistance of an insurance broker to help us with not only our group insurance program but provide knowledge and expertise on those policies outside the program.

title: TEN-21-0000006 Fleet Management  Software
description: Monash Health  is requesting information from potential suppliers  of a fleet management software to manage a fleet of approximately 350 vehicles, including leased and owned vehicles centrally. The software solution should help in improving fleet utilisation and right sizing the fleet to drive down costs while enhancing user experience in using fleet cars.

title: Supply of Tableau Licenses
description: Agency: Victoria Legal Aid (VLA)Companies are provided an opportunity to provide VLA with information on the Supply of Tableau LicensesFor more information please refer to the specification component located in the attached RFI document.Reference No:                    VLA-0045Closing Date &Time:          Friday, 19th March 2021, 2pm Melbourne timeContact Person:                 VLA Procurement and Contracts TeamEmail:                                 ProcurementAndContracts@vla.vic.gov.auCompanies must submit a response to sections 2.3 and 2.4 and any further information. Submissions are to be lodged as detailed in the documentation via the Vic Tenders e-Tenderbox by no later than the specified closing date and time.All questions must be directed to the online Vic Tenders forum. Late, emailed, hard copied or facsimiled submissions will not be accepted.All conditions regarding this RFI process can be found within the attached RFI document.

title: Provision of Small Business Support Toolkits Delivery Partner
description: To support Small to Medium Enterprises (SME's) in Victoria to mitigate the economic and other impacts on their operations from Covid 19, adapt to changes in the business environment and build new capabilities and enable businesses to emerge stronger and resilient for future challenges, Small Business Victoria is establishing the Small Business Support Toolkits program.Small Business Victoria is seeking the services of a supply partner which includes but is not limited to;1. Providing an online business learning management system 2. Facilitatating enhanced workshops (face to face as well as virtual)3. Providing business advisory services (mentoring)4. Providing business adivsory services on the Small Business bus throughout Victoria. 5. Providing & maintaining on-demand video learning content6. Providing administration and reporting of the programRefer to Attachment 1, Invitation to Supply(ITS) for a full scope of works.This procurement is subject to Local Jobs First and Social Procurement Policies.

title: Supply and Delivery of Water and Wastewater Treatment Chemicals
description: All GVW Contractors who tender for Work with a Total of 100k or more will be required to have a third party certified safety system  eg  AS/NZS 4801:2001Goulburn Valley Water (GVW) invites Tenders from suitably qualified Contractors to Supply and Delivery of Water and Wastewater Treatment Chemicals.The works of this contract comprise the periodic supply (including required testing and verification) and delivery of following water and wastewater treatment chemicals:Aluminium Chloralhydrate, Ferric Sulphate, Hydrochloric Acid, Liquid Alum, Liquid Caustic (Sodium Hydroxide),  Soda Ash Dense, Soda Ash Liquid, Sodium Hypochlorite Pales, Sodium Hypochlorite Liquid, Sulphuric Acid, Chlorine Gas 70kg, Chlorine Gas 920kg, Hydrate Lime, HFSA (Hydrofluorosilicic Acid), Citric Acid

title: Provision of Laboratory Services 2021 -2026
description: GVW Contractors who Tender for work with a total of 100K or more will be required to have a third party certified safety system  e.g.  AS/NZS 4801:2001Goulburn Valley Water (GVW) requires the outcome of this service contract to:	Provide laboratory analyses, sampling and services to Goulburn Valley Water effectively and efficiently.	Meet specified performance targets in the form of Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s).	Be cost effective and provide value for money.	Be carried out in a safe, courteous and timely manner.	Encourage a close and professional working relationship with Goulburn Valley Water staff.	Be undertaken in a manner that will ensure services meet best practice and quality standards.	Not adversely affect Goulburn Valley Water customers or third parties, or impact on Corporation assets or systems.	Be responsive to urgent requests from Goulburn Valley Water.	Be undertaken in a manner that will ensure Goulburn Valley Water meets its sampling and reporting obligations as prescribed by the various regulatory bodies.

title: 10190 - Shoulder construction and associated work on Mount Dandenong Tourist Road, Tremont and Sassafras
description: CN10190 - Shoulder construction and associated work on Mount Dandenong Tourist Road, Tremont and SassafrasPre-qualification level requirement: R2 and F5Advertisement Date: Wednesday, 17 February 2021Closing Date: Wednesday, 24 March 2021 at 3:30PMFor contract document request please e-mail to niele.garcia@roads.vic.gov.au or if more information required please call 9854 2426.Due to COVID-19 restrictions, ALL submissions must be via Buying for Victoria (TendersVic) on the closing date.

title: Provision of Telecommunications Services
description: AMES Australia is responsible for delivering social services to clients including a range of humanitarian settlement services for refugees, asylum seeker and migrants. These include on-arrival settlement support, English language and literacy training, vocational education and training and employment services.  AMES Australia is seeking innovative and cost-effective solutions to refresh of its current Internet, fixed Data services and mobile services. Capable telecommunications providers will be invited to provide information about solutions to AMES Australia’s requirements.  Currently AMES Australia uses the following telecommunications services:  1. Network Services (Fixed Data for permanent sites and remote offices)2. Mobile telephony (Mobile networks and devices) Providers must be able to provide complete solutions meeting all published specifications included in the this Request for Proposal.Submissions which do not meet the mandatory criteria will not be considered.

title: Design, Supply and Install PLC Renewal at St Arnaud Water Treatment Plant
description: Tenders are invited for the design, supply and installation of PLC hardware and software integration and associated works for the St Arnaud Water Treatment Plant.The works for this contract include: >    Supply and installation of GE PACSystems Rx3i PLC>    GE Proficy Software integration for water treatment process.>    Associated electrical upgrades and instrumentation for water treatment systems.Please note the successful contractor will be required to produce a COVIDSafe Plan prior to commencing works.

title: Water and Sewer Maintenance Services
description: At South East Water, we support healthy and liveable communities by delivering water, sewerage and recycled water services to 1.87 million people who rely on us every day and every night.Our service area borders more than 270 kilometres of coastline and covers a land area of 3,640 square kilometres from Port Melbourne to Portsea and approximately 30 kilometres east of Pakenham, Victoria.For further information on South East Water please visit www.southeastwater.com.auSouth East Water is seeking to identify capable and qualified Contractors to service our new delivery model for our Water and Sewer Maintenance requirements.The new delivery model will entail the appointment of 2 Principal Contractors for each Service Stream (4 in total), who will be responsible for the 2 Maintenance Services Streams, Water Civil & Sewer Civil + related services, and Mechanical & Electrical + related services.The contract period is anticipated to be for 5 years, with an option for a 5-year renewal.The estimated contract value is approximately $33 mil p.a. for Water and Sewer, and $19 mil p.a. for Mechanical & Electrical.The water and sewage related assets owned by South East Water that are to be maintained under the new delivery model include:	the water supply pipe network, and associated pump stations, storages, pressure reducing stations and monitoring equipment (includes assets relating to drinking water, Class A and Class C recycled water);	the sewerage pipe network, and associated pump stations and monitoring equipment;	sewage treatment plants (also known as recycled water plants);	specialised services

title: Land Management
description: Department of Environment, Land, Water and PlanningRequest for eTenderLand ManagementT2001-0025The Department is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) T2001-0025 for the provision of Land Management, encompassing land management activity and Remotely Piloted Aircraft System (RPAS).Suppliers may choose to provide costs for both Land Management Activity & RPAS, or may select to provide costs for one service only.A Request for Tender (RFT) is available for download from the Victorian Government Tender website located at www.tenders.vic.gov.au (Buying Victoria).All enquiries relating to this tender must be directed to Sharon Dimmock either by phone on 0467 801 636 or email: sharon.dimmock@delwp.vic.gov.au  Submissions must be lodged electronically at www.tenders.vic.gov.au.Tenders close at 2:00pm on Thursday 8 April 2021.When arranging lodgement of tenders be aware that DELWP does not issue receiptsFacsimile, e-mail or late tenders will not be accepted.The lowest or any tender will not necessarily be accepted.Find information about DELWP on the Internet at www.delwp.vic.gov.au

title: State Control Centre Emergency Management Catering
description: Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS) is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) to establish a contract arrangement with a service provider for the supply of meals and catering management services during lunch, dinner and late dinner meal sittings on days when the SCC has been activated. The catering management function includes the preparation of meals, serving meals, clean up, ordering of provisions and kitchen management. The nature of SCC operations requires the Offerers demonstrate the ability to provide services at short notice (6-8 hours), 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. The initial contract term will be for three years, commencing May 2021 and concluding May 2024. An option may be included to extend this for further periods. Please read Part A section 7 around the briefing session being held on Thursday 11 March.

title: Provision of Quality Audit Services on behalf of the Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority
description: The OpportunityThe Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority (VRQA) (the ‘Organisation’) is a statutory authority that regulates the education and training sector in Victoria under the legal framework of the Education and Training Reform Act 2006 (the ETR Act) and Education and Training Reform Regulations 2017.The VRQA is responsible for registering and regulating Registered Training Organisations (RTOs) - organisations in Victoria who wish to offer nationally accredited vocational education and training (VET) to domestic students only and who limit delivery to Victoria and Western Australia other than by correspondence or online.  VRQA is also responsible for ensuring that RTOs meet the national Standards for RTO (Australian Quality Training Framework (AQTF) and the VRQA Guidelines) and other requirements for registration. From about 2023 it will also be required to assess RTO’s compliance with the Child Safe Standards.The VRQA is also responsible for recognising Group Training Organisations (GTOs) in Victoria, after the organisation’s demonstrate compliance with the National Standards for GTOs. A GTO is a labour hire provider that employs apprentices and trainees and arranges suitable 'host' employer opportunities. GTOs must ensure their apprentices and trainees are provided suitable work and training by their host employer.RTOs and GTOs (the ‘providers’) may be registered or recognised for up to 5 years.The VRQA is seeking responses to this Invitation to Supply (ITS) in order to establish a Quality Audit Panel.The successful organisations making submissions (the ‘suppliers’) must have the capacity and capability to manage and conduct quality audits (audits) of organisations applying for registration and RTOs seeking re-registration and extensions to their scope of registration and organisations seeking recognition to be a GTO.  Audits also occur from time-to-time to monitor RTO and GTO compliance and for other lawful purposes.To discharge its regulatory responsibilities, the VRQA is seeking responses to this ITS (CW35409) in order to establish a Panel of Suppliers to conduct Quality Audits.Quality Audits performed under this contract are expected to commence from about May-June 2021 for a period of up to two (2) years, with an option for an additional one (1) year at the sole discretion of the VRQA.

title: Cleaning Services
description: The Mt Buller Mt Stirling Resort Management Board is looking to develop a partnership with Contractors to ensure that cleaning standards are maintained and that appropriate levels of service are delivered throughout the contract term.Cleaning services have been divided into 5 categories: 1. Mt Buller (worksites and public spaces); 2. Mt Stirling ((worksites and public spaces); 3. Accommodation; 4. COVID-19 Deep Clean (Confirmed case). Bidders can bid for more than one service category or all service categories.

title: Landscaping Services - Birches Aged Care
description: Western District Health Service (WDHS) is seeking a contractor to undertake the landscaping requirements of The Birches Aged Care Facility, located in Hamilton, Victoria. The Birches Residential Aged Care, is a 45 bed facility providing residential aged care for people with specials needs and palliative care.The planned works are to significantly improve the function of the external garden areas. This will include upgrades of outdoor activity areas that are based on the key design principles for people with dementia, such as accessibility, socialisation, reminiscence and sensory stimulation. Overall the project will enable enhanced accessibility and support quality activities and therapy programs within these environments that will be of benefit to all residents of the Birches.WDHS engaged Thomson Hay Landscape Architects (THLA) (Wattle Flat, Victoria) to develop the design drawings for this project.

title: Reservoir Floating Cover Replacement
description: South East Water is one of Melbourne’s three state-owned metropolitan water retailers.  We provide water, sewerage, trade waste and recycled water services for residents and businesses in Melbourne’s south east, located in the state of Victoria, Australia.We service more than 1.75 million people including more than 743,000 residential water customers and more than 55,000 non-residential water customers.In a region spanning 3,640 square kilometres, last year we delivered more than 120 billion litres of drinking water, 5.5 billion litres of recycled water and collected more than 100 billion litres of sewage. We are responsible for $4.1 billion of assets and manage more than 25,500 kilometres of pipeline to deliver our services.For further information regarding South East Water please visit www.southeastwater.com.au.South East Water is looking to appoint a suitable qualified contractor to replace the floating cover at Armagh road Basin at Frankston. This includes, supply of material as per the specification, fabrication, delivery to site, installation, testing and waste removal/disposal from the site including  provision of all labour, vehicles, plant and equipment, etc. required to replace the cover.

title: Inventory Construction Panel (Graves and Landscaping)
description: GMCT is seeking a Panel of experienced Civil Contractors to provide Inventory Construction Services, encompassing civil construction, landscaping and other auxiliary services. Each Contractor will be prequalified allowing ease of seeking quotes for individual projects from a small pool of providers.

title: Provision of Evaluation Service for the Trial Hub Pilot Program
description: In 2019, the federal government announced the funding of a new six year Trial Hub initiative at Alfred Health. Trial Hub, will see partnerships formed with outer metropolitan, rural and regional health services, to expand the reach of and participation in clinical trials, providing patients from regional Victoria greater access to potentially life-saving treatments, as close to their homes as possible. Trial Hub will also play a role in monitoring, promoting and expanding trial activity, ultimately boosting opportunities for patients across Victoria to participate in clinical trials of new treatments and other interventions.The objective of this RFT relates to the provision of an impartial consultancy service to develop and undertake an independent evaluation of the pilot Trial Hub. This will include input into an Evaluation Framework at the outset of the Activity and conduct of a midpoint and final evaluation.NB. All communications during the tender period must done via Buying For Victoria Online Forum.

title: Illustrated map(s) for the Port Phillip and Western Port region
description: The Port Phillip and Westernport Catchment Management Authority (PPWCMA) requires a new set of illustrated maps of the Port Phillip and Western Port region.The PPWCMA had an illustrated map created around 10 years ago (provided in brief and Specialisation Documents), and while this illustration is still reasonably accurate, it no longer reflects some important changes to the region, in particular the urban expansion.The PPWCMA values the style of the current map and is seeking a new version that maintains an illustrated style (incorporating the new artist’s individual style) but reflects the region’s current landscape.  The PPWCMA will consider a more contemporary feel for the map and/or a different style if that offers advantages over the current style.Initially the map(s) will be used on a new website for the Port Phillip & Western Port Regional Catchment Strategy. Beyond that, the maps will be used in various ways to promote the PPWCMA and its work.A deviation from the current illustration, which is a single map, is that the PPWCMA is seeking an additional version of the map that shows the region split into nine local areas, plus stand-alone maps/illustrations of those local areas. Final productsMaps of the Port Phillip and Western Port region presented in an illustrated format:	Map of full region	Map showing how region is split into 9 ‘local areas’	Individual maps of the 9 local areas showing more local detail.Maps files to be provided as PDF, JPG and PNG. Responding to this project briefPlease read the project brief attached. Please only use the online forum tool to request additonal information and ask questions (noting that responses will be posted from Monday 15 March).Potential contractors are asked to submit a proposal that responds to this project brief and includes:	Examples of their relevant work	Description of their proposed style of map and rationale for it	A simple concept drawing demonstrating the proposal for the new maps	A quote for the contract including individual costings of key elements of the work.	 Key dates	Sunday 21 March 2021: Tenders due.	Friday 26 March 2021: PPWCMA to review tenders and engage successful tenderer.	Week of 29 March - 1 April: Project inception meeting between PPWCMA and successful tenderer to agree on key elements of the project.	Week of 19-23 April: Draft maps provided to PPWCMA (complete draft of region-wide map, working drafts of selected local area maps).	Week of 26-30 April: PPWCMA to provide feedback; additional discussions and workshopping between PPWCMA and tenderer if required.	Week of 10-14 May: Complete drafts of all maps provided to PPWCMA. PPWCMA will provide feedback in same week.	Week of 17-21 May: Final versions of maps delivered. Project complete. Project budgetThe PPWCMA has up to $10,000 allocated for this project.The price and value-for-money will be one of the factors considered to decide on the successful tenderer.

title: TBC048888 Tanunda CWMS - Caravan Park Pump Station Upgrade
blurb: The Barossa Council (the Council) invites tenders from Tenderers for the provision of the Tanunda CWMS – Caravan Park Pump Station Upgrade (the Services).  The Council will enter into a Contract for Services with the successful Tenderer.Council has elected to upgrade this pump station with a dual redundant side- by-side operating system as follows:	All existing control equipment is to be replaced with new.	The single control cabinet located inside the site building is to be replaced by two separate control cabinets (one for each pump) relocated to the outside wall on the north side of the building.	Both Variable Speed Drives (VSDs) are to be replaced with new, however their location will remain the same.	Two new Automatic Transfer Systems (ATS) and necessary equipment are to be installed, for the automatic changeover from mains power to generator supply. The new ATS enclosures will be located on the external wall adjacent to each pump control cabinet.

title: Project remediate - Finance Roles
blurb: The NSW Government, through the Department of Customer Service, invites responses to this invitation for expressions of interest in relation to the loan origination, servicing, and funding components of its Project Remediate program.
description: The proposed timeframe for the Project currently contemplates appointment of a Loan Originator and Servicer in the second quarter of 2021 with loans being written prior to commencement of the first rectification works in late 2021 or early 2022 and funding by Capital Provider(s) to commence one month after commencement of rectification works.  Repayments for individual loans are expected to occur over a period of approximately 10 years.  On the basis that loans will be written over a period of (approximately) two years, capital provision is expected to span a period of approximately 12 years. The proposed timeframe for the Project currently contemplates appointment of a Loan Originator and Servicer in the second quarter of 2021 with loans being written prior to commencement of the first rectification works in late 2021 or early 2022 and funding by Capital Provider(s) to commence one month after commencement of rectification works.  Repayments for individual loans are expected to occur over a period of approximately 10 years.  On the basis that loans will be written over a period of (approximately) two years, capital provision is expected to span a period of approximately 12 years.

title: Seismic Processing Provider
blurb: Geoscience Australia seeks to contract a Seismic Processing Provider to conduct the reprocessing of legacy onshore seismic data to obtain the newly reprocessed precompetitive geoscience data. The proposed Project is approximately ~2000 line kms (this value may change by +/- 10-15% depending on data availability and quality) comprising about 34 lines from 7 surveys of different vintages. The recording time for the surveys varies from 3s to 4s.
description: The Australian Government has provided $125 million to Geoscience Australia to continue and expand the Exploring for the Future (EFTF) program in phase 2 in Trans-Australia potential corridors, with the program designed to increase investment in minerals, energy and groundwater resources. The EFTF program has been, and will now continue to be, integral to the Australian Government’s vision ‘to have the world’s most advanced, innovative and successful resources sector that delivers sustained prosperity and social development for all Australians’. The program will also be critical in achieving our targets in Strategy 2028. As part of the newly announced extension to the Exploration for The Future (EFTF) program, Geoscience Australia is embarking on various new data acquisition programs. The “Australia’s Future Energy Resources” project will evaluate the prospectivity of selected underexplored sedimentary basins and assess their untapped resource potential of natural gas, oil, and groundwater. One of the identified priority areas is located in the greater NE South Australia/SW Northern Territory region and is partly represented by a stacked sequence of sedimentary basins including the Eromanga, Simpson, Pedirka and Warburton basins.Previous exploration carried out in the 1960s to 1990s confirmed the existence of petroleum systems, however no commercial discoveries were made. During that period several seismic surveys have been acquired by the industry which are now open file. In order to improve the understanding of hydrocarbon prospectivity and to gain a clearer picture of the geological evolution of this region it appears important to revisit the existing seismic data sets. It is anticipated that by applying state-of-the-art reprocessing techniques the currently available vintage seismic data can be dramatically enhanced to provide better imaging of the tectonic architecture and its control on the development of key sedimentary sequences and their relationship with regional unconformities. The aim is to de-risk the region for future exploration activities, and facilitate decision making for both government and industry organisations.The reprocessing of 2D vintage seismic data, as a component of the EFTF program, will produce an improved quality seismic dataset using modern processing techniques, which were unavailable at the time of the original data acquisition and initial processing, will lead to improved imaging of the subsurface, with better resolution of structural features to allow more confident interpretation of shallow structures. The new seismic reprocessed data will be available as pre-competitive information to assist industry to better target areas likely to contain the next major oil, gas and mineral deposits.Geoscience Australia seeks to contract a Seismic Processing Provider to conduct the reprocessing of legacy onshore seismic data to obtain the newly reprocessed precompetitive geoscience data. The proposed Project is approximately ~2000 line kms (this value may change by +/- 10-15% depending on data availability and quality) comprising about 34 lines from 7 surveys of different vintages. The recording time for the surveys varies from 3s to 4s.A map location with proposed line for reprocessing (Appendix 1) and available acquisition parameters are (Appendix 2).Geoscience Australia requires that the data be processed over a period of 18-22 weeks.Acquisition parameters and data quality vary between surveys. Care is needed to select optimal lines/surveys and may need some revision in collaboration with the Service Provider relative to the list supplied in Appendix 2.Geoscience Australia requires the Service Provider to undertake land seismic reprocessing of legacy 2D seismic reflection data listed in the table and provide the optimum processing flow given the acquisition parameters. The expectation is that the data quality will be improved through the application of contemporary processing methods including re-examination of the velocities, informed in turn by the geological framework of the area. QC and testing of the data at appropriate intervals will be required and included in the work program. Geoscience Australia is currently in the process of engaging a Quality control specialist to oversee the processing.We require common routines for 2D land seismic data including but not limited• Post-Stack Time Migration;• Pre-Stack Time Migration (optional alternate workflow where supported by data quality);• Depth ConversionAs per Statement of Requirement, please include a table for the Proposed Dates of Completion for different stages of processing and intermediate products. The Seismic Processing Provider Services Provider will have a demonstrated record of achievement in the planning, management and delivery of seismic data undertaken with the mineral resources or related industries. The Seismic Processing Services Provider will be able to demonstrate prior experience in working collaboratively with a diverse stakeholder base in the exploration and community sectors to deliver successful projects, and scientific and business outcomes.

title: DEW048990 River Murray in South Australia Constraints Measure – Mitigation Designs, Costs and Implementation Schedules
blurb: The River Murray in South Australia Constraints Measures Project aims to remove the operational and physical constraints to the delivery of high flows for the River Murray. High flows are critical for the health of the floodplains, the end of system Lower Lakes, Coorong and Murray Mouth and serve to export salt out of the River Murray.Physical constraints to the delivery of high flows in SA include low lying land and infrastructure that may be impacted by these flows.Physical constraints also include blockages, such as raised roads that prevent water from reaching areas of the floodplain in both high and low flow periods.Planning undertaken by the SA Constraints Measures Project Team in 2019-2021 has quantified, to varying degrees of accuracy, the land and infrastructure impacted by high flows up to 80,000megalitres per day (ML/day) (hereinafter referred to as high flows).This specification describes the services being sought from engineering estimator and design suppliers to establish cost estimates, designs and implementation schedules for capital upgrades to land and infrastructure that will mitigate the impacts of flows up to 80,000　ML/day.By mitigating the impacts of high flows greater opportunities to augment high flows will be facilitated knowing that risk have been adequately managed.

title: Culturally Appropriate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Suicide Prevention, Intervention, Postvention and Aftercare Service
description: The Territory would like to establish a culturally appropriate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander suicide prevention, intervention postvention and aftercare service in the ACT. The need for this service was highlighted in recent community feedback and academic literature.Invitation to the Information Session for the Culturally Appropriate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Suicide Prevention, Intervention, and Aftercare Service.The Territory would like to acknowledge all who have engaged in the journey to establish a culturally appropriate Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander suicide prevention, intervention postvention and aftercare service in the ACT. The need for this service was highlighted in recent community feedback and academic literature.The Territory is pleased to invite you to attend an Information Session as the next step of the journey, which aims to:	outline the background and expectations for commissioning this service; and	invite attendees to provide feedback to create the necessary tender requirements to deliver the service’s desired outcomes.									Event details													Venue:									Yarramundi Cultural Centre, 245 Lady Denman Dr, ACT 2600													Transport:									The centre has ample parking or taxi fares will be reimbursed.													Date:									Friday, 26 March 2021													Time:									10:00 AM to 12:00 PM – Information Session 12:00 PM to 01:00 PM –Light Refreshments													RSVP									Tea, Coffee will be available throughout the event. Please RSVP to Callum Stringer at ACTHMentalHealthPolicy@act.gov.au. Please advise of any dietary requirements in your RSVP.						           The Information Session may be attended online or in person. A maximum of two (2) representative per organisation is requested to attend in person to maintain COVID-Safe measures. Attendance at the Information Session is not mandatory to tender.Please contact Tenders ACT at tenders.act.gov.au if you have any questions.

title: Ground Level Potable Storage Tank – Swan Hill Design and Construct
description: Lower Murray Water (LMW) seeks to build a single Ground Level Treated Water Storage tank in Swan Hill with a minimum volume of 4ML.Tender will be a detailed Design and Construct Tender including Civil, Structural and minor Electrical Work.Contractors will be required to develop detailed designs for their tank with flexibility of tank materials. LMW is seeking value for money and optimum performance from tank materials. LMW’s preference of tank materials is Concrete, Welded Steel, Glass Fused Steel, Steel with Polyethylene Liner or a combination there of, alternatives will be considered.The contract will be delivered as a D&C Contract under AS4300.Scope of works will include:	Construction of a circular Ground Level Potable Water Tank and associated infrastructure.
