title: Pumping of environmental water at Lake Wallawalla 2021
description: The Mallee Catchment Management Authority is seeking suitable supplier(s) with recognised proven skills in the delivery of water for the environment. The project requires delivery of water for the environment from the nearby Lindsay River to Lake Wallawalla to promote environmental, social and indigenous outcomes. Lake Wallawalla is a significant floodplain wetland located adjacent to Lindsay Island in the north-west of Victoria. Rivers, wetlands and their associated anabranches and floodplains are a defining feature of the Mallee region. The health of these waterways and floodplains are fundamental to the region’s environmental, social and economic future. Without natural flooding, the condition of these environments will decline. Provision of water for the environment, such as through this project, helps maintain the condition of sites during periods without natural flow. At the time of releasing this tender water and funding have not been allocated for this environmental water program.  Tenderers shall make themselves aware that upon submission of offer and subsequent notice of preferred tenderer, contracts will not be executed, until such time as water allocation and funding approval is confirmed.

title: Engagement Specialist for the Queensland Resources Industry Development Plan
description: The Department of Resources (Resources) is responsible for implementing the election commitment to develop and deliver a Queensland Resource Industry Development Plan (QRIDP). Resources is proposing that the QRIDP be developed over several phases; the second phase being to co-develop a draft of the QRIDP with stakeholders through an extensive consultation program.Queensland’s resources industry operates within a complex stakeholder network. The industry itself employs over 68,000 people, living and working in communities right across the State. However, in addition to those working within the industry, there are many other groups, industries and individuals who are either directly or indirectly impacted by resource operations–and are therefore equally as invested in influencing the industry’s future.As such, Resources is proposing to engage a contractor to develop and deliver the consultation program required for the second phase. It is highly desirable for this contractor to have knowledge and experience of Queensland’s resources sector to encourage trusting, genuine and informed conversations during the consultation. If the contractor doesn’t have resources sector experience, the program should outline other strategies that address how this knowledge and experience will be sought (e.g. through an industry partnership).The contractor will be required to deliver a program that addresses the following elements (detailed further in ‘Scope’):	Development of a consultation strategy and program	Delivery of the consultation program	Post-consultation report

title: Release of Project Brief as part of pre-tender consultations for first tranche of 90 zero emission buses for Transport Canberra
description: Transport Canberra is continuing pre-tender consultation and market soundings for its first tranche of 90 battery electric buses with the release of an Industry Project Brief and short introductory video. The briefing materials can be viewed here.This market sounding exercise supports the development of the preferred procurement approach for the first tranche of 90 battery electric buses and supporting infrastructure, training and skills development.A formal procurement process is expected to commence in the third quarter of 2021 and will be a separate open market tender process. For those who have already registered, you will soon be invited to complete a short questionnaire with select interviews to take place until mid to late April 2021. There is no need to re-register your interest.Its not too late to get involved. To participate in the market sounding please visit the Transport Canberra website for more information or complete and submit the registration form via the link below. About the project and market soundingsThe ACT Government has committed to an ambitious plan to transition its bus fleet tozero-emissions by 2040. The procurement of a first tranche of 90 battery electric buses kick-starts this transition while learning, upskilling and de-risking the future steps. The Zero-Emission Transition Plan for Transport Canberra can be found here.The market sounding is a genuine opportunity to receive input from all industry sectors to inform the upcoming procurement of our first tranche of 90 zero-emission buses.The market sounding is focussed on engaging a wide range of industry representatives and participants including the bus manufacturing, battery technology, energy generation and distribution, skills and service industries.The market sounding is exploring key delivery concepts and assumptions including market capacity, potential packaging, risk allocation and project specific issues such as technology, timing and scale.Transport Canberra is looking for innovative solutions that respond to the infrastructure, power, training and technology opportunities of a zero-emission fleet, and can deliver on the objectives of a sustainable, compact and efficient city. Buses may be housed and charged in a mixture of either existing depots, off-site locations or at the new Woden bus depot.The market sounding program includes a series of industry forums, interactive discussions and an information sharing platform to allow Transport Canberra to develop procurement documentation that encourages innovation and responds to industry capability. This process will conclude with interviews with relevant stakeholders.Subject to the findings of the market soundings, the procurement process will progress through either the release of a Request for Expression of Interest or direct progression to Request for Proposal depending on which is deemed the most efficient and appropriate for this procurement activity.

title: Provision of Leased Warehousing Brisbane and Townsville
description: Expressions of InterestFor Provision of Leased Warehousing Brisbane and TownsvilleThe Queensland Government has a requirement to lease good quality, warehouse space in Brisbane and Townsville to operate as distribution centres. These warehouses will support the storage of palletised material, picking, packing and the shipment of material.Storage requirements for each locationBrisbane: 20,000 – 25,000 palletsTownsville: 4,500 – 5,500 palletsSpecificationsAt a minimum, the warehouses are to:	accommodate 4 levels of various standard pallet racking and up to 1.6 metres in pallet height		have both ambient and separate climate-controlled storage areas with capacity for a third of the pallets to be climate controlled at 24 degrees Celsius			have associated hardstand, an external awning for all-weather loading, office administration area, car parking and good heavy vehicle road and site access.	Other considerations		Design and construct proposals, soon-to-be-completed, and existing premises which may be suitably refurbished will be considered.			Sites should be in the proximity of arterial roads for heavy vehicles.			Site facilities must have the potential to operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week without limitation.			Site should be free from flooding.	A long-term lease will be offered under the Standard Government Agreement for Lease and Warehouse Lease.What to provideProposals can be submitted for one or both locations.If expressing interest in both locations you must submit each site as a separate proposal.Initial proposals should include address, Real Property Description (RPD), zoning, Gross Lettable Area (GLA), availability, proponent details, site control and other relevant details.Detailed plans and asking rentals should NOT be submitted at this stage.Offer processFollowing an evaluation of all proposals, short listed proponents will then be provided with a full requirement brief for provision of a detailed offer.Forward details via email to:Manager Lease ManagementQueensland Government Accommodation OfficeDepartment of Energy & Public WorksEmail: Leasing.EOI@hpw.qld.gov.auPhone: 07 3008 2851Offers close 5pm Friday 26 March 2021

title: The procurement of Head Consultancy Services (design team) for Mt. Buffalo Chalet Maintenace Management Plan Works
description: The Mount Buffalo Chalet is located on Mount Buffalo, in the Alpine region of north-eastern Victoria, accessed via a sealed road within the Mount Buffalo National Park. The Mount Buffalo Chalet Main Building, constructed in 1912 and extended in the 1920s and 1930s, ranges from 2-3 storeys with a floor area of approximately 6,000m2. It is a s very substantial timber-frame, timber weatherboard-lined building with a corrugated metal roof. It is subject to harsh and exposed alpine conditions including substantial annual snowfall.The Mount Buffalo Chalet is of architectural, historical and social significance to the State of Victoria. The Mount Buffalo Chalet is included on the Victorian Heritage Register (H0901), regulated through the Heritage Act (2017). The extent of registration includes everything located within the identified parcel of land, including multiple buildings and structures, and gardens and landscaping features.The Chalet is of architectural significance as one of the largest alpine resort complexes in Victoria and is of historical significance for its association with the history of leisure in Victoria and the development of the Mount Buffalo National Park. It is of social significance due to its association with a section of the community in their pursuit of recreation and the development of the Mount Buffalo National Park as a year-round alpine resort for a broad cross section of the community.Mt Buffalo Chalet is included on the National Heritage List as part of Australian Alps National Parks and Reserves, regulated through the Environment Protection & Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999 (Cth.).The on-going conservation and management of the Chalet within its harsh alpine location requires an effective, disciplined approach as part of the broader management of the Place.The aim of the project is to provide for a wind and water-tight external building envelope, to arrest deterioration and stabilise the Chalet such that future repair/maintenance to the exterior is reqular, routine and programmed to suit available funding/resources.This project will bring forward essential repairs and maintenance to the balance of the building envelope of the Chalet that would otherwise require up to a ten-year cycle of internal Parks Victoria funding.The project will reconcile best practice or industry-standard conservation techniques with the Alpine, bushfire prone remote location of the Chalet across a range of typical repair and maintenance practices to fabric that comprises the external envelope. The project will support repairs consistent with the conservation policies of the Heritage Action Plan.The project **excludes** any restoration program for the interiors. The project does not include work on essential services such as fire services, which are currently well maintained.=====================================================================================================Revision1_ 4 attachments added on 26/03	Purcell Architecture (see drawings) - EXTERNAL ELEVATIONS CONSERVATION WORKS MARK-UP	Mount Buffalo Chalet, Maintenance Management Plan, External Building Envelope (Purcell, 2020)	Heritage Action Plan (Allom Lovell 2002)	Updated window repair report (Purcell 2020).Revision 2 _ 4 floorplan pdf + Q&A added on 08/04

title: ITS2-00225 Lower Yarra River Maintenance Dredging Program Tender
description: The Principal invites the Tenderer to submit a Tender for the delivery of dredging services under the Lower Yarra River Maintenance Dredging Program including at sites centred around fixed and floating landings, wharfs, floating pontoons, and the main navigational channel. The Services are for two (2) fixed dredging campaigns – the Campaign A Services and the Campaign B Services which each have fixed commencement and completion dates.  The Principal has the sole discretion to award further tranches of the Services, namely the Campaign C Services and Further Services. The Sites relevant to the Campaign C Services and Further Services have not yet been determined and amongst other things will be subject to priorities at the time, the rate of siltation of previous Sites and budget availability.  If directed, the Campaign C Services and Further Services will also have fixed commencement and completion dates.Parks Victoria is seeking responses from experienced operators who can provide dredging expertise that results in efficiencies, innovation and cost benefits over the course of the Contract.Parks Victoria is the waterway manager for the Yarra River (under the Marine Safety Act 2010 (Vic)) and is responsible for ensuring safe navigation. Parks Victoria manages several fixed and floating landings as well as the navigational channel of the lower Yarra River. The gradual accretion of silt and sediment has led to a reduction in channel width and depth for some parts of the river resulting in restricted safe navigational access to facilities.The Victorian Government has provided funding to improve commercial and recreational access along the Lower Yarra River through dredging.  This represents the biggest investment into the Yarra River since the 2006 Commonwealth Games. The funding boost means that the precinct will be maintained as a prominent landmark in Melbourne CBD and acknowledges its contribution to the modern culture and social vibrancy of Melbourne.The aim of the Lower Yarra River Maintenance Dredging Program is to reinstate sufficient water depth at prioritised areas in a manner that minimises disturbance to stakeholders, is consistent with Government guidance and policy and is conducted in a safe and environmentally sustainable manner. Dredging sites are centred around fixed and floating landings as well as the navigational channel.  The Services will entail dredging at an estimated 4-6 dredging sites per year. As a general indication, each dredge campaign will be undertaken over an estimated period of 4-9 months, removing around an estimated volume of 8 000m3 per dredge campaign.  The required pumping distance for disposal ranges between 300-3,500m depending on the dredging site. The project area for the Lower Yarra River Maintenance Dredging Program extends between the Bolte Bridge and Burnley Harbour.The nature of the Services and project constraints suggest the program is suited to small dredging equipment such as a small cutter suction dredger (CSD) or equivalent due to the restricted accessibility to the Sites given low bridge height clearance and the small dredging areas and volumes per dredging site. The dredged material is to be deposited in designated disposal sites in deeper parts of the river.The environmental requirements for dredging must comply with:	the Addendum C - Lower Yarra Maintenance Dredging: Environmental Management and Monitoring Plan (EMMP) developed for the maintenance dredging program;	the Best Practice Environmental Management:  Guidelines for Dredging (BPEMG) (EPA 2001); and	the National Assessment Guidelines for Dredging (NAGD) (Commonwealth of Australia 2009).The dredging services under the Lower Yarra River Maintenance Dredging Program will be carried out in accordance to Addendum A - Services Specification, Addendum B - Lower Yarra Maintenance Dredging Design – Specification and Addendum C - Lower Yarra Maintenance Dredging: EMMP. Close date for all questions is COB 28 April 2021.

title: NHVR RFQ Mobile ANPR Camera Project
description: The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) intends to trial mobile Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) camera technology to facilitate the monitoring and interception of high-risk heavy vehicles, operators and journeys. The NHVR is requesting the respondent propose which mobile ANPR cameras and deployment devices will be best used in the mobile ANPR camera project.The successful respondent will be a well-respected provider of ANPR solutions for enforcement agencies in Australia. The respondent will work with NHVR business SMEs and IT architects to configure and roll out a phased delivery of the requirements and integration of the heavy vehicle sightings data to current NHVR intelligence holdings.The NHVR anticipates the respondents will supply and support the following solutions:Roadside Mobile ANPR CamerasConsists of a portable device that operates using a battery, solar or accompanying generator specially designed to accommodate a camera being fixed to it. The portable device may be deployed or towed into a position at designated safe areas for a short period (typically one to four weeks) for operations, intelligence gathering or site choice validation.Vehicle ANPR CamerasSpecially designed and fitted to vehicles either internally or externally (usually on the dashboard or underneath vehicle lightbars).Drone Mounted ANPR CameraCan be deployed to identify high risk vehicles approaching enforcement sites in remote locations. Camera images can use optical character recognition to identify the vehicle and determine if the vehicle is of interest.Transfer of Camera Captured Data and Images to NHVRThe ANPR solution will potentially determine if the sighted vehicle is a heavy or light vehicle, and if determined to be a heavy vehicle, this information is transmitted in a format to the able to be integrated easily with existing fixed camera network data currently in the NHVR data warehouse.  The NHVR aims to receive the data and images collected from mobile deployed camera locations in a timely manner to increase Heavy Vehicle sightings in the NHVR data warehouse.For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Request For Quote" documents

title: Upgrades to the Mount Isa Drill Core Facility
description: This tender has been re-issued due to technical issues. We thank you for your interest and patience.Please note that  due to the lockdown of the Greater Brisbane area from 5pm, Monday 29 March 2021, we are unable to facilitate the planned site visit. Please note that this site visit has now been postponed to Tuesday, 6 April 2021, 11am. Attendance is mandatory.To accommodate the delay, this tender has also been extended to 19 April 2021.The department owns the John Campbell Miles Drill Core Facility in Mount Isa, which was built in 2010 to house the North West Queensland Drill Core Collection and to provide a facility for industry, academic and government geologists to safely access the collection.The department now requires the following services:		Develop site and building plans and secure Building Certification and submit to Mount Isa City Council 			Build a skillion roofed, fully enclosed shed approx. 26m x 14m x 4 m high with a single bay enclosed to be used as a rock cutting room. External walls, colorbond or similar, internal walls lined and insulated villaboard or similar, ceiling tile grid, roof insulation.  Built to meet wind rating for Mount Isa with concrete floor and suitable footings as per detailed scope of works 			Supply and install a refrigerant ducted air conditioning system, suitable to cool the space (54kW estimated requirement)   			Supply and install solar panel array to achieve net zero power consumption for air con system 			Fit out shed with LED lighting and power outlets as per detailed scope of works   			Fit out rock processing lab with sediment control equipment as per detailed scope of works 			Build a concrete driveway (extension to current hard stand on site) to meet up the southern boundary road, suitable for fully loaded B-Doubles as per site plan 			Supply and Install gates at end of proposed driveway on southern boundary fence line as per site	Please contact Andrea Bell-Booth via email TS_Central@resources.qld.gov.au if you have any queries. Addendum 1 - issued 26 March 2021Addendum 2 - issued 30 March 2021

title: TCCS In-House Senior Project Engineer
description: Through this procurement process, Infrastructure Delivery of Transport Canberra and City Services (TCCS) seeks to procure the services of a Senior Project Engineer or Engineers to manage, on its behalf, the delivery of major capital works projects.

title: DEW048995 Breakout Creek Stage 3 Plant Propagation and Supply
blurb: This procurement is specifically for the propagation and supply of plants, totalling over 215,000 plants from around 77 species, for the Breakout Creek Stage 3 Redevelopment project.The Breakout Creek Stage 3 project will redevelop the section of River Torrens between Tapleys Hill and Seaview Roads, South Australia, from an artificial channel to an ecologically functioning river and wetland system, providing a first class opportunity for the community to connect with nature in an urban setting.
description: This procurement is specifically for the propagation and supply of plants, totalling over 215,000 plants from around 77 species, for the Breakout Creek Stage 3 Redevelopment project.The Breakout Creek Stage 3 project will redevelop the section of River Torrens between Tapleys Hill and Seaview Roads, South Australia, from an artificial channel to an ecologically functioning river and wetland system, providing a first class opportunity for the community to connect with nature in an urban setting.

title: 63420 Alligator Creek Tank Reservoir Refurbishment
description: Mackay Regional Council (Council) seeks tenders from suitably experienced contractors to undertake the works at the Alligator Creek Pump Station Surge Tank in order to extend the lifespan of the asset.

title: GC049008 Patron Seating and Barrier Solution
blurb: The Town of Gawler is seeking Expressions of Interest for the design, supply and installation of a solution for patron seating and barriers for the new refurbished Stadium floor at the Gawler Sport and Community Centre.
description: The Town of Gawler is seeking Expressions of Interest for the design, supply and installation of a solution for patron seating and barriers for the new refurbished Stadium floor at the Gawler Sport and Community Centre.

title: Supply and Delivery of Continence Aids
description: Services:Metro South Hospital and Health Service (MSH) for the Medical Aids Subsidy Scheme (MASS) to Supply and Deliver Continence Aids across the State of QueenslandConsider:	ITO Briefing – provides brief overview and expectations	You must use the ITO format / forms provided	ITO Part 4 – Offer Response Form, is the only acceptable place to register departures from the Scope of Services or the Conditions of Contract for consideration under the Offer	All written Offers must be submitted via QTendersUPDATED - Key Timeframes (in QLD time):	Cut-off for ITO clarification questions:   Wednesday 07 April 2021 – 2.00 p.m.	Cut-off for delivery to MASS for Product Samples: Friday 09 April 2021 - 5.00 p.m.	ITO Closes:      Wednesday 14 April 2021 – 10.00 a.m.	Evaluation process:     14 April 2021 – 30 June 2021For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review all "ITO Documents specifically Part 1 for the terms, conditions, Scope and Specifications and Offer Evaluation; and response forms Part 2 through to and including Part 4 (2 of)".

title: Replace Wireless and Fixed Network Instrastructure
description: The Queensland Parliamentary Services is seeking Proposals for the Replacement of Wireless and Fixed Network Infrastructure in the Parliamentary Precinct located at Corner of George and Alice Streets, Brisbane, and Electorate Offices located throughout Queensland. Depending on requirements these works specifically include:	replacement of hardware;	all necessary investigation; 	licensing; 	management of software;	installation; and 	ongoing maintenance costs for 5 years. It does not include core switching equipment located in Data Centres and Electorate Offices. PLEASE NOTE: A mandatory briefing session will be held. Please contact the listed Contact Officer to arrange a suitable time. For detailed information on the specific works sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".PLEASE NOTE: Due to issues with original Appendix 4 document, only download 'NEW Appendix 4 - General Exemption Certification - Ver2'

title: Winchelsea WRP Treatment Upgrade
description: Barwon Water is seeking to appoint a suitably qualified and experienced Principal Contractor to design and construct baffle curtains, aerator replacement, and inlet/outlet modifications on sewerage lagoons at Winchelsea Water Reclamation Plant.It is a condition of Tender that Tenderers attend a Compulsory Site Inspection commencing 11 AM on 13 April 2021, held at Winchelsea Water Reclamation Plant on 46 Sussex Street, Winchelsea VIC 3241. Details are in the Tender Document, Clause 3.2Tender documents can be downloaded at https://www.buyingfor.vic.gov.auTenders to be lodged to the Barwon Water electronic tender box at https://www.buyingfor.vic.gov.auEnquiries should be made to: Halil Mulayim, on email: halil.mulayim@barwonwater.vic.gov.au

title: W0947 Romsey High Level Tank
description: Western Water is intending to release a request for tender for the Replacement of Romsey High Level Tank located in Romsey, Victoria. The Romsey High Level Tank is supplying potable water to the high-pressure zone in Romsey.  The project scope includes mechanical, civil, structural and electrical works, including:	Detailed design and Construction of a new 400 kL potable water tank, comprised of two compartments for redundancy	DN150 PVC inlet main to tank, approximately 1.0 km, installed along the existing water main	DN225 PVC outlet main from tank, approximately 0.5 km and tie-in into existing water main	DN150 (provisional scope) outlet water main, approximately 1.3 km, from the potable water borehole at the tank site running in parallel to the water mains.	Automated chlorination system, including pump skid, chemical storage tank and associated civil, mechanical and electrical works  	Access road improvements, passing bay and concrete hardstand for chemical supply	Horizontal directional drilling under Ochiltrees Road and connection to the existing rising main at the southern side of the road.	Electrical works, including new el. cabinet and wiring  	Civil and mechanical works, tank pipework, access and instrumentation	Ancillary works necessary to complete and operate the Works.	Testing, commissioning and process-proving of the new infrastructure 	Decommissioning, demolition and removal of all redundant infrastructure (old tank, pipework, electrical and instrumentation)	Full project documentation and Safety-in-design review   Because there is limited space to install the new pipelines in the intended location along the access road, detailed design for the access road have been developed to confirm viability.It will be the Contractor’s responsibility to develop detailed design for the tank. This is aimed to provide flexibility for market response with regards to the tank materials, shape and configuration, in order to obtain best value-for-money. While there is tank design flexibility, the proposed tank design must meet the functionality detailed in the project technical specification and drawings. The tank should preferably be standard size (not custom-made) in order to provide competitive cost.The chemical dosing skid is to be located in a container-type shed with bulk storage locked away and dosing skid sheltered, in line with Western Water’s typical design used elsewhere.The full scope of works will be shown on the detailed design drawings and described in the RFT and the Project Specifications.The contract will be delivered as a D&C Contract under AS4300.Industry briefings will occur one week after tender publishing. Questions during the tender period are encouraged and can be directed via the official tender publication on the Tenders VIC website.

title: School Dental Program Evaluation Services
description: Supplier of Evaluation Services			DHSV on behalf of the Evaluation Governance Group (EGG - comprising representatives from DH, DET and DHSV), seeks a third-party supplier of evaluation services (tenderer) to evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the SDP in delivering its objective. The evaluation will run for 3 years (early 2021 to 2024). The tenderer is to assign a dedicated team to undertake the evaluation activities. The tenderer will work in partnership with DHSV’s Manager for the Centre for Value Based Health Care, Research and Evaluation, key stakeholders, and the SDP implementation team throughout the evaluation process to ensure the tasks are performed in accordance with the deliverables agreed between DHSV and the tenderer.

title: Dog Trap Gully Additional Landscape Construction Services
description: This project is to shape and regrade an existing gully (Dog Trap Gully) and provide additional landscaping works to match into previously completed stages of Hume West Development

title: Resource Development for Licenced Electrical Inspector
description: Department of Environment, Land, Water and PlanningRequest for eTender   Resource Development for Licenced Electrical Inspector T2001-0137The Department is seeking responses to this Request for Tender (RFT) reference no. T2001-0137 from suitable organisations to undertake the development of a full suite of learning and assessment materials to improve the knowledge and skills (including solar and battery) of the electrical workforce, including both licenced and non-licenced inspectors and auditors. Successful completion of the learning and assessment materials must adequately prepare participants to undertake all G Class assessments and on successful completion, apply to ESV for a G Class inspector’s licence. A Request for Tender (RFT) is available for download from the Victorian Government Tender website located at www.tenders.vic.gov.au (Buying Victoria). All enquiries relating to this tender must be directed to Natalie Sacco either by phone on (03) 8508 1887 by email at natalie.sacco@delwp.vic.gov.au Tenders close at 2.00pm on Thursday 15/04/2021 When arranging lodgement of tenders be aware that DELWP does not issue receipts Facsimile, e-mail or late tenders will not be accepted. The lowest or any tender will not necessarily be accepted. Find information about DELWP on the Internet at www.delwp.vic.gov.au

title: Supply & Delivery of 2x Hydro Excavation and Vacuum Trucks

title: TCCS Traffic Signals Project – Traffic Signal Lanterns Supply
description: TCCS are upgrading traffic signal sets around Canberra with the objective of increased reliability and reduced energy consumption of the traffic signal network. TCCS require the purchase of LED Central Light Source (CLS) traffic signal lanterns for installation by others at various intersection upgrades around Canberra. This procurement is for supply of LED CLS traffic signal lanterns from multiple suppliers for installation by others at various signalised intersection upgrades around Canberra.

title: Supply & Installation of Kerbing Works
description: Kerbing works required at the intersection of Cleveland-Redland Bay Road, Redland Bay.  Please download documents for further information.

title: Orchard Hills Fencing Works, NSW
blurb: Fence replacement at Defence Establishment Orchard Hills (DEOH)
description: Scope includes removal and replacement of damaged internal and external Class 2 fencing, vehicle access gates and pedestrian access gates including civil and stormwater works.

title: 70207 Mount Bassett Sewage Pump Station Renewal
description: Council is seeking a qualified Contractor to undertake the construction of a permanent bypass for all future maintenance works at Mount Bassett Sewage Pump Station (SPS) and to restore the SPS to an acceptable standard, so the asset’s minimum original design life is achieved.

title: Mt Macedon New Fire Station
description: Closing date:  2.00 pm Wednesday 21st April 2021Tender Response Forms are to be completed, signed and lodged in PDF Format to be accepted.To be able to download tender documents or upload your submission, you must first ensure your company has registered with Tenders Vic (this should take approx. 5 mins) Tender E- Lodgement;                                                                                                                                                            [To be able to download tender documents or upload your submission, you must first ensure your Company has registered with TendersVIC (this should take approx. 5-mins)Tender E-Lodgement;	Please submit your tender response well before the tender closing time, allowing time to upload or re-upload if required. It is the tenderer’s responsibility to ensure sufficient time is given to upload tender responses.  Commencing document upload two (2) hours prior to the closing time is highly recommended. 	Please check the receipt issued by Tenders VIC carefully to ensure all files have been uploaded. If you have not received a receipt from Tenders VIC, your submission has not been loaded correctly and you must resubmit your tender response prior to the closing date and time.	If the tender lodgement has taken more than 15 minutes to process, we recommend restarting the upload session.	If you are inactive on the ‘Submit Electronic Response’ page for more than 30 minutes you will time out, refresh this page and log in to Tenders VIC again to submit the tender response.What should you do if you experience issues loading your Tender onto TendersVic;	Only alphabetic characters a-z, A-Z, numberals 0-9 and full stops are acceptable file names. The file pathname should be no longer than 90 characters. The total file size of the tender response been uploaded should be no more than 100 MB in a single batch	Internet Explorer Version 10 users, may need to enable Active Scripting on your Internet Options setting to lodge tender responses, refer to the Help file located under ‘Tips’ on the ‘Home’ page.  Otherwise try using an alternative web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox.	If you continue to find any difficulty uploading response then please call Tenders VIC Helpdesk on (03) 9651 1671 / (03) 9651 1672 between 9 am and 5 pm AEST or email on tenders@dtf.vic.gov.au who will be able to log your upload issue (please leave a voicemail message if there is no answer)If the TendersVIC Helpdesk cannot rectify your upload issue, please contact the CFA Tender Administrator on (03) 8822 8039 or at tenders@cfa.vic.gov.au requesting acknowledgement of your upload issue (do not email tender submissions without Administrator approval).  Contact must be made before the closing date and time for your request to be considered.]

title: Provision for Health Provider
description: Council invites submissions from qualified health providers to deliver the following services:(a) Pre-employment health assessments, including drug and alcohol testing;(b) Staff Immunisations;(c) Health Examinations;(d) Functional Capacity Evaluations, Assessment, and Reporting; and(e) Workplace injury / illness medical treatment.

title: Witness Intermediary Scheme for Qualified Communication Specialists Cairns
description: Applications are invited to establish a register of pre-qualified suppliers with suitable qualifications (panel) for the Queensland Intermediary Scheme Pilot Program.The Department of Justice and Attorney-General, in response to recommendations of the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse, is establishing a witness intermediary scheme to assist witnesses in child sexual offence investigations and prosecutions to give their best evidence.Applications are sought from individuals with qualifications in speech pathology, psychology, occupational therapy or social work.The role of the intermediary is to facilitate communication between the witness and police and/or the witness and courts. The role of the intermediary is to:	assess witness communication and describe any specific communication assistance required;	provide practical strategies on how to best communicate with the witness and how to pose a question to get the most reliable evidence;	inform directions hearings, where applicable, to establish court communication guidelines for a vulnerable witness; and	write court reports on an individual’s communication needs.The scheme will operate as a two-year pilot in two locations (Brisbane and Cairns), with anticipated commencement in July 2021. This invitation is for Cairns services only. The scheme applies to any child sexual offence prosecution witness who:	Is under 16 years, or	Is a person with an impairment of the mind, or	Has difficulty communicating.Intermediaries can be engaged from police investigation through to court hearing. They will be required to act in emotionally challenging cases involving child sexual offences and will be exposed to detailed information about child sexual offences.Given the potentially distressing nature of cases requiring an intermediary, potential candidates who have serious reservations about being involved in such cases should consider whether to apply.Intermediaries may be asked to assess, and sometimes attend an interview with, a witness at short notice.  Panel members will be required to be flexible and organised in order to meet these time commitments.  Some evening and weekend work may be required.Further information can be obtained by downloading the material listed in section 3

title: PROVISION OF SEWAGE TANKERING SERVICES
description: Urban Utilities invites interested Suppliers to submit an Offer for the establishment of a Standing Offer Arrangement (‘SOA’) for Sewage Tankering Services in accordance with the terms and conditions set out or referred to in this ITO.Sewage Tankering Services include:• New development waste tanker services for localities not connected to the sewer network;• Collection and inter-site transfer of liquid sludge from, and between, Sewage Treatment Plants (STPs);• Wet work services;• Scheduled general services;• ‘on demand’ 24/7 responsive services.The geographic area in which the Services are to be provided include Brisbane, Ipswich, Somerset, Lockyer Valley and Scenic Rim Local Government Areas (LGAs).Below services are out of scope:• Transport, disposal and beneficial re-use of biosolids; and• Removal and transport of grits and screening.Offerors may submit an Offer for any or all of the Services and with coverage for any or all the LGAs covered by Urban Utilities.For detailed information on the specific of Sewage Tankering Services sought under this tender, please review the Specification documents.

title: Cedar Road and MacArthur Avenue Civil, Electrical and Landscape Construction Contract Northshore Hamilton
description: Economic Development Queensland (EDQ) requires the reconstruction of MacArthur Ave and the construction of Cedar Road, Barcham Street and Karkul Street and future development sites adjacent to the new roads. The roads are required to be constructed by 29 October 2021 to meet a contractual obligation for an adjacent land sale.The Scope to be delivered includes, but is not limited to the supply of material, plant, labour and supervision necessary to carry out the following:	Obtaining any approvals to undertake the works;	Demolition of the existing surface features;	Disposal of all demolished materials to approved facilities;	Location and protection/relocation of existing services;	Construction of UU sewer and water assets and connection to existing sewer and water assets and to service lots;	Construction of stormwater systems including biobasins including connection to existing system and to service lots;	Undertaking earthworks to meet the design levels;	Construction of road pavements and associated road assets;	Streetscape installation including all footpaths;	Electrical works to service lots and provide streetlighting;	Communications works to service lots and provide for future assets;	Sediment and erosion control; and	Obtaining on-maintenance and off-maintenance from Urban Utilities (UU), Energex and Brisbane City council (BCC)The detail of the scope is included in the Project Specification contained in the Part 2 attachments.

title: Flood Information Online
description: RFI No: BCC532771Name of Activity: Flood Information OnlineCouncil is releasing this Request for Information to the market in order to identify suppliers who have the capability to provide Council with a configurable off-the-shelf online portal that provides members of the community with access to critical data relating to historical floods, and provides some indication to property owners of the risk of flooding for a specific identified property.The current application is available through this link: http://floodinformation.brisbane.qld.gov.au/fio/Council is particularly keen to identify suppliers who are able to provide a complete "Software as a Service"offering including application configuration and set-up services, hosting and support, and are capable of scaling their hosting offering to address peak traffic during flooding events.For detailed information on Council's specific requirements, please contact Council's Contact Officer below. An information pack will be provided for your review together with a questionnaire designed to provide Council with the information it is seeking.At this stage Council is reviewing the capacity of the market to provide solutions of this kind. Council makes no commitment to transition to a specific RFx tendering process as a number of options are being considered. Should Council proceed to an RFx process down the track, responding vendors will be advised. Council Contact Officer: Lee.Horton, OS-IS-ICTProjectSourcing@brisbane.qld.gov.auAll questions relating to this RFI must be directed to the Council Contact Officer. Questions posted on QTenders will not be addressed.Date of release to market: 25 March 2021RFI closing date: 14 April 2021

title: Residential and Emergency Care Services Mt Isa
description: ***** THIS TENDER IS TO BE ANSWERED THROUGH NEW PROCURMENT TO PAY SYSTEM - ( P2i (cyjma.qld.gov.au) ******The Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs (the department) provides non-family based care services for children and young people, as part of the continuum of placement and support services in accordance with the legislated standards of care (Child Protection Act 1999, section 122) and the Charter of Rights for a Child in Care (Child Protection Act 1999, section 74 and Schedule 1).The department is seeking to procure non-family based residential care services in Mount Isa for four (4) young people, aged 12 to under 18 years who have been assessed as having high to complex levels of support needs, with the flexibility to occasionally accommodate a child or young person assessed as having extreme needs funded through Individualised Placement and Support (IPS) arrangements.Up to a total of $1,202,456 (excluding GST) per annum is available for this procurement activity. The annual funding equates to up to $3,607,368 (excluding GST) over three (3) years.The successful supplier will enter into a contract from 1 July 2021 to 30 June 2024, with establishment of service delivery to commence as soon as possible by 1 September 2021.To access the details of this Request for Quote, here is the link.***** THIS TENDER IS TO BE ANSWERED THROUGH NEW PROCURMENT TO PAY SYSTEM - ( P2i (cyjma.qld.gov.au) ******

title: CPAC048938 Hancock Stadium Refurbishment
blurb: Port Augusta City Council invites tenders from Tenderers for the provision of Hancock Stadium Refurbishment.The Council will enter into a Contract for Services with the successful Tenderer.On 31 October 2019, council acquired ownership of Hancock Stadium from the Port Augusta Basketball Association.  In conjunction with this transfer, Council entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Flinders Power.  The MOU provisions are based on funding agreement to carry out repair and minor upgrade works.  These works were identified from a previous report addressing compliance with the National Construction Code completed in 2018 by Engineering consultants Tonkin Consulting (Tonkin Report).Supplementary to matters identified in the Tonkin Report, The MOU contains several additional works and conditions specified by Flinders Power including:	external painting of blockwork and other external previously painted surfaces;	installation of signage acknowledging the contribution of Flinders Power;	renaming of the facility to “Flinders Power Furnace” and the appropriate display of this name;	the requirement to retain the building for continued use as an asset for a minimum of 10 years;	completion of on site works by 30 June 2021.Some items raised within the Tonkin Report have been completed under separate requests for quote and have therefore been excluded from works outlined within this tender documentation.  The specification, developed by Studio 9, includes all remaining items that are required to ensure adherence to the National Construction Code and specific requirements of the MOU.Council are now seeking submissions from suitable contractors to project manage and undertake the works in accordance with the abovementioned specification document and drawings.

title: EOI - NSW Vehicle Emissions Offsets Scheme
blurb: The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) for the supply of carbon credits to offset the emissions of NSW light vehicles through a NSW Government vehicle offsetting initiative.The key objective of this EOI is to understand the carbon credit supply market and options available to the NSW Government and shortlist offset suppliers based on their capacity to supply suitable offsets, and their capability to meet the demand created by NSW drivers voluntarily opting to offset their annual vehicle emissions.Please note that your organisation must have an Australian Financial Services Licence.
description: The Department of Planning, Industry and Environment is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) for the supply of carbon credits to offset the emissions of NSW light vehicles through a NSW Government vehicle offsetting initiative.The key objective of this EOI is to understand the carbon credit supply market and options available to the NSW Government and shortlist offset suppliers based on their capacity to supply suitable offsets, and their capability to meet the demand created by NSW drivers voluntarily opting to offset their annual vehicle emissions.Please note that your organisation must have an Australian Financial Services Licence.One of the initiatives of the Net Zero Plan - Stage One: 2020-2030 is an emissions offset program for vehicles in NSW. This will initially be offered as part of the annual light vehicle registration process managed by Service NSW. The intention is to extend to other transaction points including vehicle sale and transfer of registration. It will complement other schemes being developed under the Net Zero Plan including awareness-raising communications and information on vehicle performance and emissions.

blurb: Arts Creative Producer to coordinate a curatorial strategy from planning through to commissioning of multi-disciplinary creative work.
description: Arts Creative Producer to coordinate a curatorial strategy from planning through to commissioning of multi-disciplinary creative work. Role of the Creative Producer is to engage with an array of communities, enhance patient, visitor and staff experience through artwork/s, wayfinding and integrated architectural features, encourage improvement in patient experience and access to care, and reflect on Liverpool’s history and people. Additionally, curatorial rationale and facilitation of up to 3 designs to be applied throughout the project as permanent installations such as enviro-graphic wallpaper designs located in clinical and public areas. title: Emerging issues at the chemicals-waste interface
blurb: The project involves a desktop review of the chemicals-related challenges that are emerging international as countries move to increasingly circular economies. The project will review the relevant governing standards in Australia that cover these emerging issues, and recommend strategic interventions to safeguard against potential future environmental risks
description: The department is seeking an analysis of the chemicals-related challenges that are emerging internationally as countries move to increasingly circular economies. The focus should be on identifying chemicals management challenges that accompany recycling initiatives. For example, these may include: particular products that are difficult to recycle because they contain chemicals of concern; particular recycling practices that increase or avoid distribution of high concern chemicals into the environment (etc).The department is also seeking advice on whether these global issues/trends are likely to become relevant domestically, based on a comparative analysis of the waste initiatives that are being (or will be-) implemented in Australia. This analysis will consider whether the current governing standards in Australia will adequately safeguard against potential emerging issues, and if not, what strategic interventions can be made. Strategic interventions may be regulatory or non-regulatory approaches. The role of government-industry partnerships in addressing these issues should be considered.

title: MAAS Digitisation Storage Solution
blurb: The Powerhouse is one of Australia's oldest and most important cultural institutions. It is Australia's only museum of applied arts and sciences with an exceptional collection of approximately 500,000 objects. The Powerhouse is undertaking significant renewal through the creation of Powerhouse Parramatta, expansion of Powerhouse Castle Hill, the digitisation of Powerhouse Collections, and the renewal of Powerhouse Ultimo. To deliver this major renewal program, the Powerhouse is seeking a data storage solution and system to support our Collection Relocation and Digitisation Project.
description: The Powerhouse is one of Australia’s oldest and most important cultural institutions. title: Research Services to investigate the clinical impact of breast cancer screening for women aged 75 and over in Australia
blurb: The Commonwealth Department of Health is seeking to engage a qualified supplier or suppliers to undertake Australian research in relation to women aged 75 years and over (“75+”), participating in breast cancer screening behaviour, particularly in the BreastScreen Australia program:What are the benefits and harms of screening among those women aged 75+?Why do some women participate in screening when they are over 75?
description: Respondents may tender for some or all of the three research projects described below. Respondents must address each aspect of the research projects that they intend to tender for, and provide a detailed description of their proposal to supply the Requirement, including a draft project plan setting out the potential timing for key steps, and the proposed research methodology.Project 1: Data analysis on breast cancer screening behaviour and outcomes. The Supplier will undertake data analysis on Australian breast cancer screening behaviour and clinical outcomes for women in the 75+ age group Project 2: Qualitative research on screening motivations and behaviourThe Supplier will undertake qualitative research to investigate screening motivations and behaviour for Australian women 75+ who are actively participating in the program, as well as for those not participating in the program Project 3: Research on the participation impact on women aged 75+ of the 2014 expansion of BreastScreen Australia to actively target women aged up to 74 yearsThe Supplier will undertake data analysis on the participation impact on women aged 75+ of the 2014 expansion of BreastScreen Australia to actively target women aged up to 74 years

title: AGD048910 ODASA - The Provision of Services to the Design Review Panel - Request for Submission
blurb: This is for the Office for Design and Architecture South Australia’s (ODASA’s) State Design Review Program. The fundamental ongoing success and effectiveness of the Program is underpinned by the expertise of panel members, who enable ODASA to provide focused, constructive and independent design advice.New members will be selected to complement the existing skills within the current panel membership. We are seeking new members with knowledge of urban design, medium density residential design, sustainable development, education, landscape architecture, infrastructure and heritage.Successful applicants will be invited to join the Design Review Panel for an initial term expiring 30 June 2023 (with an option to extend for three years). New panel members will be invited to attend an induction session and approximately five to ten half-day sessions per year.To assist you in the preparation of your application, please find attached a formal invitation including a Request for Submission (RFS) Response Form and proposed contract template. If you have any queries please contact the Contact Person identified.

title: WRC048928 Cleaning Council Facilities
blurb: Wattle Range Council is responsible for a wide range of community buildings and facilities including halls, sports stadiums, visitor information centres, offices, BBQs and public toilets.  These facilities are located across the district, with the main assets in Millicent, Penola, Beachport and Southend.  Quality cleaning services are essential to provide amenity for residents and visitors and to ensure facilities are well presented.The objectives of the cleaning services contract are:	To ensure Council facilities are regularly cleaned to an agreed standard	To ensure a cost effective and efficient cleaning service that is fit for purpose	To have a prompt response and quick resolution when emergency cleaning is required	To be flexible in the delivery of the service to meet the changing needs of the community and Council.Consideration will be given to contractors who wish to submit a proposal for one or more separable portions eg. Public toilets, township / locality based, halls / office buildings only / childcare only.  Pricing must be submitted in the tender return spreadsheet and a detailed description of the services being tendered for, exclusions and assumptions is required in the tender submission.Council may enter into a contract for services with one or more parties. The contract term will initially be five (5) years, with the potential for one or more extensions up to a further four (4) years.The Contract(s) will be based on a lump sum, payable monthly for routine and periodical cleaning, with the provision for additional works based on a schedule of rates.The Contract(s) are results-focused and performance based and it is up to the contractor to allocate sufficient resources to meet and preferably, exceed the cleaning standards outlined in this specification at all times.   A compulsory briefing will be held on Wednesday 24 March 2021 at 10am at the Penola Visitor Information Centre, Arthur Street, Penola.  This will be followed by the opportunity to inspect the limited access Council facilities included in the contract.  The inspection is not compulsory and is expected to take the majority of the day.  Due to the large number of sites in the Contract, the inspection will focus on sites that are not available to the general public.  Tenderers are expected to make themselves aware of public facilities during their own time.The draft Conditions of Contract will be uploaded to the SA Tenders website by COB Wednesday 26 March 2021

title: Dismantling and Disposal of Plant and Infrastructure
description: The Bloodwood Creek Underground Coal Gasification (UCG) site (the Site) became an abandoned mine in March 2019, following the disclaiming of mining tenures held on the land. Both surface and sub-surface infrastructure remains on site, including several wells for UCG processes and water monitoring, a gathering network, process water management equipment and a power generation plant with associated infrastructure. These items present health, safety and environmental risks that need to be assessed and managed by Technical Services (TS), in line with the Abandoned Mines Management Policy.This aims to remove all redundant plant, equipment, buildings, and infrastructure to render the site in as safe a condition as practicable.

description: The Department of Transport and Main Roads (TMR) is seeking expressions of interest (EOI) from potential suppliers that are Registered Training Organisations (RTOs) and experts in the automotive industry. They must have currency in the latest industry practice and standards, and be willing to develop and deliver training and assessment (services) to new and existing approved examiners (AEs) and Approved Inspection Station (AIS) nominees and approval holders.The training and assessment must:	provide AEs, AIS and nominee approval holders with the required knowledge, skills and ability to perform the functions of their accreditation or approval	use an educational Learning Management System (LMS) that provides for online delivery and self-paced learning	validate knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the functions of their accreditation or approvalPlease note, Proponents are not required to provide a financial offer as part of the EOI Process.The purpose of the EOI is to determine market interest and identify suitable suppliers with the required experience, capability and capacity to develop and deliver the services. Only shortlisted suppliers will be invited to participate in stage two - the Invitation To Offer (ITO) stage.For detailed information please review the EOI and related Appendices.

title: Evaluation of the Queensland Intermediary Scheme
description: Queensland Intermediary Scheme Pilot ProgramThe Queensland Government committed to implementing a pilot intermediary scheme. The intent of the Queensland Intermediary Scheme (QIS) pilot program is to provide assistance to police and the courts to obtain best evidence from prosecution witnesses with communication difficulties in child sexual offence prosecutions.OpportunityDJAG is seeking to engage an organisation to conduct a process and outcome evaluation to assess the effectiveness of the Queensland Intermediary Scheme Pilot Program and the use of intermediaries to assist the administration of justice.  That is, the evaluation should consider the use of intermediaries from a criminal justice perspective.  The evaluation should include analysis of individual components of the process (i.e. police, prosecution, courts use) as well as the end to end process (from police investigation to court finalisation). The evaluation will be utilised to report to the Queensland Government on the effectiveness of the scheme, and inform recommendations for the future of the scheme.  An interim evaluation report must provide sufficient information to support a submission to government and justify the recommendations.Further detalied information with respect to this opportunity is contained in the RFQ documents (attached)

title: R8111 AIR555 Cocos (Keeling) Island Head Contractor Document & Construct – ITR
blurb: AIR555 Cocos (Keeling) Island Head Contractor Document & Construct AISREW Facilities Project - FOB
description: R8111 AIRBORNE INTELLIGENCE SURVEILLANCE RECONNAISSANCE ELECTRONIC WARFARE (AISREW) FACILITIES PROJECT - FORWARD OPERATING BASE COCOS (KEELING) ISLANDS(a)  the works under this ITR include provision of a secure, pre-built, modular FOB facility on CKI inclusive of the following:(i)  completion of the detailed design for all works, which is anticipated at this stage to require the involvement of the Commonwealth of Australia's (Commonwealth's) Novated Design Consultant (but noting the Commonwealth is considering and seeking input on different approaches to the completion of the design);(ii)  manufacture of the modular, secure facility under controlled conditions on the Australian mainland;(iii) transport and logistics to deliver the modules to the site on CKI;(iv)installation, completion, commissioning and certification of the facility; and(v) defects rectification and maintenance of the works  for the duration of the defects liability period which is expected to be for a period of 12 months (subject to any extensions under the Contract).The Commonwealth expects that by the time a contractor is engaged, the design for the works will have progressed to the 50% or Schematic Design Report stage.  The Commonwealth may or may not require the contractor to complete the design using the existing design consultant as the Commonwealth's Novated Design Consultant. It is currently proposed that the contractor would either:(vi)use the Commonwealth's novated design consultant to complete the design of the works;(vii) use the Commonwealth's novated design consultant to design specific elements of the works; or(viii)use its own subcontractors to complete the design and/or design verification.The Applicants' approaches to the above options and information on the Applicants' preferences are sought as part of the responses to the Invitation to Register Interest (Registrations of Interest).  During the conduct of any subsequent tender process, particularly if the novation of the existing design consultant is to be mandated, the Commonwealth intends to provide tenderers with access to the Commonwealth's design consultant to assist tenderers with developing their approach to the completion of the design.

Under the P4S model there are three regional delivery consortia (RDC) to deliver design, construction, and maintenance services respectively across the three geographical regions (North, South and West) within Sydney Water’s area of operations. The RFT is for Shared Purchasing under the Partnering for Success (P4S) delivery model being established by Sydney Water. Under the P4S model there are three regional delivery consortia (RDC) to deliver design, construction, and maintenance services respectively across the three geographical regions (North, South and West) within Sydney Water’s area of operations. title: GWIC – Tracking and Monitoring
blurb: The Greyhound Welfare and Integrity Commission (GWIC) is seeking proposals from suppliers to design, develop and implement GWIC monitoring and tracking of NSW registered greyhounds' solution according to GWIC business and legislative requirements.
description: The Greyhound Welfare & Integrity Commission’s Whole of Life Monitoring and Tracking Program will digitise many elements of the greyhound racing industry that are currently paper based making it easier, simpler, and quicker for participants, the Commission, and the industry to engage with one another and improve greyhound welfare and integrity outcomes.The Whole of Life Monitoring and Tracking Program will;• Improve greyhound welfare by implementing an eTracking system which will make it easier and quicker for the Commission to regulate, track, assure and report on the welfare of greyhounds registered in NSW throughout their lives.• Improve customer service by introducing a personalised, self-service portal where participants will have access to their greyhound racing, compliance, and welfare information, and be able to complete regular transactions online.• Minimise duplicate and manual transactions currently being performed by eliminating legacy systems and processes no longer required.

title: Central Darling Seismic Survey
blurb: The Central Darling Seismic Survey (CDSS) will acquire approximately 208 km of new 2D seismic data in data poor areas of the Darling Basin
description: Coal Innovation NSW (CINSW) is undertaking the Central Darling Seismic Survey (CDSS) in the central Darling Basin north of Wilcannia. The CDSS is the continuation of work to identify potential CO2 storage opportunities in NSW as part of the state-wide NSW CO2 Storage Assessment Project. Approximately 208 km of high-resolution seismic data along seven lines (Figure 1) will be acquired, processed and interpreted to better understand the regional setting and identify possible CO2 storage locations to be targeted for exploration drillingCoal Innovation NSW (CINSW) is undertaking the Central Darling Seismic Survey (CDSS) in the central Darling Basin north of Wilcannia. The CDSS is the continuation of work to identify potential CO2 storage opportunities in NSW as part of the state-wide NSW CO2 Storage Assessment Project. Approximately 208 km of high-resolution seismic data along seven lines (Figure 1) will be acquired, processed and interpreted to better understand the regional setting and identify possible CO2 storage locations to be targeted for exploration drilling

title: Specialist Software Industry Offer - Tranche 2
blurb: In 2019, the Agency partnered with nine Australian software organisations (10 products) to enhance their software for specialists to seamlessly and securely integrate My Health Record into their current systems. These enhancements will enable specialists to contribute information to the My Health Record system without adding steps to their clinical workflow.A number of vendors have released their product and several other vendors are in the pipeline to release the enhanced product later this year. We are already seeing an increase in the number of specialist letters being uploaded to My Health Record and as such the Agency is extending the initial industry offer and going back to market to provide opportunity so as many specialists in private practice as possible have access and can contribute to My Health Record.
description: One of the challenges in developing specialist-centric My Health Record functionality in CISs is that specialists comprise an extremely diverse user group. Different types of specialists are likely to have different information needs, and follow somewhat different workflows in accessing and sharing patient information. This industry offer has been designed to help meet that challenge.Objective: The objective of this industry offer is to facilitate the development and enhancement of My Health Record functionality in CISs used by private specialists. The Agency wishes to do this in a way that recognises the diversity of private specialists and leverages the deep understanding that software developers who service this sector have of their customers

title: Event Management Services for North America Distribution and PR Roadshow 2021-2022
blurb: The purpose of this procurement is to assess the market and secure a single vendor to support Tourism Australia's need in North America to deliver a distribution and PR focused roadshow in multiple locations across the USA and Canada in both 2021 and 2022.
description: This RFT is to procure an Event Management services company to support the Tourism Australia North America team with delivering a roadshow series of industry events across the USA and Canada in 2021 and 2022. Procurement will include venue and event costs for the roadshow to be managed by the successful tenderer. In 2021, the roadshow series will be deployed as a key platform to engage with travel advisors and media audiences in up to 9 different cities in the USA and up to 2 cities in Canada. The roadshow will support a ‘Border Open’ message to promote and sell Australia and aid the Tourism Recovery.  The Roadshow series will be conducted as a One Voice initiative in collaboration with State and Territory (STO) Partners and provide individual and distinct formats for the media audience and the travel advisor audience. The broader objectives of the roadshow are to:• Keep ‘Australia’ connected to both travel advisor and the media networks across core feeder market to maintain engagement and consumer engagement through positive news stories• Generate national, regional and local media coverage across online, print and broadcast outlets around all Australia has to offer as a top travel destination • By partnering with STO partners, provide dedicated destination training and updates for the attending advisors in each market.• Drive up ASP enrolment and engagement To drive event efficiencies, alignment of trade and media events within the same venue running concurrently is proposed. Despite Australia’s borders remaining closed, procurement is recommended now to allow for forward planning of the 2021 roadshow so it can be activated with shorter than usual lead times. The roadshow will form a key pillar of Tourism Australia’s recovery efforts in North America, once travel restrictions are lifted.

title: Request for Tender for Employment Facilitator and Support Services for the Local Jobs Program 2020-2022 in seven regions
blurb: Request for Tender for Employment Facilitator and Support Services for the Local Jobs Program 2020-2022 in seven employment regions.
description: The Department of Education, Skills and Employment (the department) is seeking submissions to this Request for Tender) from entities interested in delivering Employment Facilitator and Support Services for the Local Jobs Program 2020-2022 (LJP) in seven Employment Regions.  The seven regions are: Gippsland VIC; Western Melbourne VIC, New England and North West NSW; Illawarra South Coast NSW; Cairn QLD; Wide Bay and Sunshine Coast QLD; Murray and South East SA. Employment Facilitators operating in these regions were supporting the Regional Employment Trial. Projects established under RET will finish in June 2021. This tender is seeking submissions for services to support the Local Jobs Program from July 2021 to June 2022.

title: PSC001428 - Collaborative Meeting Rooms (AV & Technology) Upgrade
blurb: ANSTO has a variety of Audio Visual (AV) equipment in each meeting room of varying ages, quality and condition across the Lucas Heights campus. There is a growing demand for users to have a seamless meeting experience and therefore this project will focus on not only refreshing the technology hardware where applicable but also how the user meeting experience can be improved through the integration of the meeting room technology and the ANSTO M365 products (MS Outlook / Teams) and compatibility with typical conferencing platforms (WebEx, Zoom & Skype).Given the number of meeting across ANSTO a phased approach has been agreed with an initial list of rooms provided for phase one (this RFT).

title: RFP - Organisational Design Tool
blurb: RFx ID: 24120523Organisation: Ministry of EducationOpen date: Tuesday, 23 March 2021 4:00 PM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 21 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and TelecommunicationsRegion: WellingtonOverview: This RFP relates to the purchase of an organisation structural design tool which can utilise our workforce data to provide our leaders with structural design options and their costings. The key outcomes that the Ministry want to achieve are to be able to:•	Have this tool available as part of the Ministry’s human resource suite of software and systems so that the tool can complement our legacy systems. •	See organisation structural options at an individual, team, business group, regional and national level•	See organisational structural options and their distribution through other lenses such as gender, ethnicity, seniority, job type and salary band•	Change option’s levels and boundaries of teams, business groups and regions quickly to see the immediate impact on the structure•	See what happens with each change on the costing at different levels •	Save structural options for future reference•	Update options when new workforce data is uploaded•	Present options to leaders either electronically or in a printable form with an option to highlight where the main differences are for easy comparison•	Implementation of the solution•	Arrange suitable support for maintenance, upgrades, and training of the tool.

title: Information Management Roadmap Delivery Partner
blurb: Council is seeking Tenders from suitably qualified and experienced Tenderers to partner in the design, development and implementation of an Information Management (IM) Maturity Program that will be applied to all Council content and data. The partnership will include the design, development and implementation of an: IM Strategy; IM Governance Framework; Information Asset Register; Information Asset Processes; Enterprise Information Architecture (SharePoint Online); Single Content and Data Source; Search Engine; Mobility; Training and Documentation. As part of this maturity program, Council will be moving to SharePoint Online. This will require the preparation of a SharePoint Roadmap, review of and suggestions, potential implementation for the associated add-ons and assistance in the migration from SharePoint on premise to SharePoint Online. The SharePoint Roadmap, review of the associated add-ons and assistance in the migration to SharePoint Online may be offered under either a direct supply or subcontracted out, but Council's preference is for a Primary Contractor that will act as the single service provider that delivers the Council requirements in total. Services included in this quotation are: Part 1 - Information Management Maturity Program including: IM Strategy; IM Governance Framework; Information Asset Register; Information Asset Processes; Enterprise Information Architecture (in SharePoint Online); Single Content and Data Source; Search Engine; Mobility; Training and Documentation. Part 2 - SharePoint Roadmap including: a review of and suggestions for associated add-ons; assistance in the migration to SharePoint Online. A full description of the nature and extent of the services required by Council are set out in Section 3 of this Request.  An Information Management Maturity Plan will be provided to the successful respondent for reference. All IM components of this program must comply with the State Records Act. ISO 15489, ISO 16175 and ISO 9001. All content and products developed for this program will be the intellectual property of Council.

title: EST02020 Other Sites and Groupings Redevelopment Project - Request for Tender - Design Services Contract (DSC-1 2003)
blurb: The Other Sites and Groupings Redevelopment (OSAG) Project aims to support and improve the delivery of existing capabilities and services within the Defence Estate over the next 20 years. It will achieve this through rectification of long-term underinvestment in facilities and infrastructure at eight (8) Sites located in strategic locations around Australia and which provide unique functions and capabilities.
description: The Services required for this Project include design and related services in respect of the following Works: Damascus Barracks, Meeandah QLD:•&nbspReplacement of three existing warehouses with two new modern warehouse structures.•&nbspReplacement and consolidation of three other existing warehouses into a single warehouse structure.•&nbspRemediation of existing concrete hardstands and provision of new shade structures.•&nbspReplacement and consolidation of warehouse office accommodation.•&nbspRefurbishment of the site headquarters building and upgrade/replacement of the existing amenity facilities.•&nbspRemoval of ‘demountable-style’ working accommodation located within existing warehouses and consolidation in to three separate office blocks across.Wallangarra Stores Depot, QLD:•&nbspReplacement of the maintenance workshop/store for bulk liquids handling equipment (i.e., bulk fuel and bulk water).•&nbspUpgrading of the fire and potable water systems and sewage treatment plant. Proof & Experimental Establishment Port Wakefield, SA:•&nbspUpgrading of the high voltage (HV) power supply system (and switch to HV customer agreement).•&nbspReplacement and rationalisation of long-term and transit accommodation and messing facilities.•&nbspUpgrading of the potable water infrastructure.•&nbspResponding to Base Engineering Assessment Program (BEAP) only items in respect of Electrical Systems Redundancies. Proof & Experimental Establishment Graytown, VIC:•&nbspReplacement and relocation of the Data Acquisition/ Instrumentation building.•&nbspReplacement of the vehicle workshop facilities.•&nbspReconfiguration of the base entry precinct.Swan Island Army Detachment, VIC:•&nbspReplacement of the access bridge and guardhouse. •&nbspRefurbishment of the access road and causeways.Sarpeye Barracks, Thursday Island QLD:•&nbspProvision of a new transit accommodation block.•&nbspRefurbishment of the existing transit accommodation.•&nbspProvision of a Q-store dehumidifier. Land Engineering Agency Monegeetta, VIC:•&nbspRefurbishment of the Small Arms Testing facility.•&nbspUpgrading of the firefighting infrastructure.•&nbspAddressing electrical infrastructure issues. •&nbspReplacement of the Army Reserve depot facilities. Defence Nutrition Research Centre, Scottsdale TAS:•&nbspReplacement of office accommodation and storage buildings, incorporating new research collaboration facilities.The Services include Site investigations and the further investigation, options analysis and assessment of potential additional/alternative scope items during the 5% Master Plan Feasibility Review (MPFR) stage of the Project to assess their suitability for inclusion within the approved Project scope.

title: DFAT-EOI – Head Works Contractor – Design & Construct – Australian High Commission Funafuti (Tuvalu)
blurb: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) represented by the Overseas Property Office (OPO), is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) responses from suitably qualified and experienced Head Works Contractors (providing Design and Construct services) interested in working with DFAT to deliver a permanent property solution for the Australian High Commission in Funafuti TUVALU.The permanent property solution includes a two-bedroom residence, Chancery, outdoor areas and supporting engineering services.
description: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) represented by the Overseas Property Office (OPO), is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) responses from suitably qualified and experienced Head Works Contractors (HWC) interested in working with DFAT to deliver a permanent property solution for the Australian High Commission in Funafuti TUVALU.DFAT’s proposed delivery strategy is a Design and Construct model (delivery method and contract form) with a Head Works Contractor, to develop and deliver the permanent property solution using offsite construction.The permanent property solution includes a two-bedroom residence, Chancery, outdoor areas and supporting engineering services. DFAT is proposing offsite manufacture (prefabrication) in Australia and transport to Funafuti for site works and installation. The scope of this project includes all associated activities; prefabrication of the building in Australia, shipping, demolition of existing structures on site, civil works and carparking, services/utility connection, onsite construction and landscaping.
