title: Mōu Te Reo -Te Ahu o te Reo Māori Advertising Campaign
blurb: RFx ID: 24099248Organisation: Ministry of EducationOpen date: Tuesday, 16 March 2021 3:00 PM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 82000000 - Editorial and Design and Graphic and Fine Art ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: Te Ahu o te Reo Māori services will encourage and strengthen the education workforce to use te reo Māori correctly every day. Outcomes will be achieved by participants completing learning outcomes specified by Ngā Taumata o Te Ahu o te Reo Māori. These include seven taumata/levels for participants with abilities ranging from beginner to those proficient in Māori medium settings.  Te Ahu o te Reo Māori celebrated the successful completion of 1054 new te reo Māori advocates in the sector including teachers, support staff and educational leaders. Evaluation findings from the end of the first wave, along with participant feedback, found that the kaupapa:•	increased ability to use te reo Māori correctly and confidently in the classroom•	nurtured opportunities to create meaningful relationships with ākonga, parents and whānau•	increased understanding of the communities they are a part of, especially the stories, language features and dialects unique to the region.This ROI seeks to engage a supplier for Design, delivery, and distribution of an advertising campaign for the Te Ahu o te Reo Māori programme that will provide messaging tailored to specific audiences, grab attention, be clear, inviting and exciting with constant theme aligning with ministry principles and Te Ahu o te Reo Māori branding.Suppliers will be required to provide evidence they have experience in delivering a robust bilingual ad campaign.

title: Walking floor trailers for the Canterbury District Health Board Energy Centre
blurb: RFx ID: 24061134Organisation: Ministry of HealthOpen date: Monday, 8 March 2021 4:00 PM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 25170000 - Transportation components and systems25181700 - Product and material trailersRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Ministry of Health (the Ministry) seeks proposals from qualified suppliers for the design, fabrication and supply of three walking floor trailer units for the delivery of woody biomass to the new Christchurch Hospital Energy Centre. This procurement is being carried out in parallel with the CDHB's procurement of a woody biomass fuel supplier. The Centre will comprise a fit-for-purpose boiler house containing specialist plant that has been designed and procured by the the Ministry from Polytechnik Luft-und Feuerungstechnik GmBH (Polytechnik). The Centre will comprise of two biomass boilers, an LPG/diesel back-up boiler, fuel handling facilities and associated infrastructure to provide 8.3bar steam to the Christchurch Hospital campus and is classified as Importance Level 4 (IL4). The Centre’s fuel handling system comprises two Truck Docking Stations (TDS) providing redundant delivery points for walking floor trailers to unload fuel which will be conveyed via chain conveyors to the bulk fuel store. The successful supplier will be required to work with Polytechnik and the Canterbury District Health Board’s  (CDHB) fuel supplier (RFP currently in progress) to ensure the integration of the fuel handling system provided by Polytechnik and trucking logistics provided by the CDHB’s fuel supplier are coordinated with the walking floor trailer design to successfully deliver fuel to the TDS.

title: Giving Effect to Intensification Policies in the National Policy Statement for Urban Development 2020
blurb: RFx ID: 24093901Organisation: Kapiti Coast District CouncilOpen date: Tuesday, 16 March 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Thursday, 8 April 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 77000000 - Environmental ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Kāpiti Coast District Council (“the Council”) is classified as a “Tier 1 local authority” in the National Policy Statement on Urban Development (NPS-UD). Among other things, this classification means Council must: •	Review its Proposed Kāpiti Coast District Plan (“PDP”) to ensure it complies with Policies 1, 3 and 4 (see Part 3 sub-part 6) of the NPS-UD; and•	Publicly notify a plan change amending the PDP as necessary to achieve compliance with these intensification policies not later than 20 August 2022. While the PDP is enabling of higher and denser urban form in certain locations, and current constraints on density and heights in some locations may prove appropriate after identification and application of qualifying matters (see Policy 4), the strong direction in Policy 3 means Council is likely to propose a number of changes to the PDP to give effect to NPS-UD intensification policies.

title: New Pavilion Structure at Ormiston Senior College
blurb: RFx ID: 24077994Organisation: Ministry of Education - School InfrastructureOpen date: Monday, 15 March 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 5:00 PM +13:00Categories: 72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services95120000 - Permanent buildings and structuresRegion: AucklandOverview: Ormiston Senior College Board of Trustees (BOT) would like to construct a new pavilion structure adjacent to their existing building where the cafeteria is located. title: Warmer Kiwi Homes Heating Programme - Approved Heat Pump Appliances
blurb: RFx ID: 24101579Organisation: Energy Efficiency & Conservation AuthorityOpen date: Wednesday, 17 March 2021 9:30 AM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 12:00 PM +13:00Categories: 72151200 - Heating and cooling and air conditioning HVAC construction and maintenance services73171500 - Manufacture of electrical goodsRegion: New ZealandOverview: Warmer Kiwi Homes is a government-funded programme run by EECA, which is designed to support New Zealand families to live in warmer, drier homes.This is the final year of the three year heating programme, under which similar RFQs to this were run in 2019 and 2020. The aim of this procurement is to provide opportunities for additional Heat Pump Suppliers to be approved, to confirm the eligibility of existing Suppliers under this programme, and to allow those Suppliers to adjust their pricing. Existing (contracted) approved Suppliers need to respond to this RFQ in order to continue to supply heat pumps under this programme.This procurement will determine a list of Approved Heating Appliances (and their prices) which cover a range of heat pump sizes. These must meet minimum technical specifications and minimum warranty requirements, and the appliance must be suitably priced for the low-income market the programme is targeting.PLEASE NOTE:1)  There is a mandatory Supplier Briefing session by video conference for this RFQ on Tuesday 23 March and registrations are required by 5pm on Friday 19 March 2020.2)  Existing approved suppliers need to attend the Supplier Briefing and respond to this RFQ in order to continue to supply heat pumps under this programme.3)  There are two Response Forms required for this RFQ.

title: 15 Finnegan Street, DUNWICH QLD 4183
description: Tenders please note:Included as part of the  Works for Tradies program (Program), the State of Queensland through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works (the Principal) invites you to submit an offer for project 88682DC1, 15 Finnegan Street, DUNWICH QLD 4183.This Program involves the construction of a number of  new social housing units of accommodation in key regions across Queensland, and is intended to boost housing supply, drive economic activity and support construction across Queensland, post COVID-19. Housing and Homeless Services (HSS) and QBuild are working together to deliver this Program.Mandatory Tender Requirement: One of the key objectives to be achieved through the delivery of this Program is maximising opportunities for locally based building contractors. To be eligible to tender on this project, it is a mandatory requirement for  tenderers  to have a physical office (through which the project will be delivered)  located within 125KM radius of project location.  Failure by a Tenderer to satisfy the above mandatory requirement may result in the Principal declining to accept the Tenderer's Tender.  For details of all mandatory tender requirements, please refer to the Conditions of Tender. Tenderers please note:Tender documentation for this project is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/ Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild eTender site.

All works are to commence on the 28th of June 2021 and be completed by the 1st of October 2021.			Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors that meet the following requirements:							Appropriate QBCC Builders licences to undertake the entire scope of works				Professional Indemnity Insurance to the value of $ 1,000,000						 			Please contact Nadia Arkhipkina – Project Manager on nadia@honeywill.com.au with your company details and tender documentation will be emailed to contractors.  Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers.			Covid-19 Safety precautions will be mandatory for site inspections.			Submissions close on Friday, 16 April 2021 at 3:00pm

title: NZ Nutrition Survey - Development

Importantly, we require a Contractor(s) who can work with Kāinga Ora and its customers.What is in scope of this RFP•	A detailed plan for each solar energy system installed, including an initial site inspection and proposed timeline to deliver the works; •	grid-connected photovoltaic systems for between 70 to 100 properties (to be agreed and confirmed in a Work Order(s));•	supply of all components, materials, and resources and equipment required for installation;•	installation of the systems;•	system commissioning and any required compliance certification;•	the supplier to make arrangements with Kāinga Ora Customers (tenants) to access the house for inspection and installation activities. Note: Kāinga Ora will be responsible for gaining customer agreement to participate in this trial before their contact details will be provided to the Contractor; •	the identification of all works necessary to prepare the building and electrical system for the installation of the solar energy systems. This may include remediation works, roof strengthening where needed, ducting, wall and roof penetrations, meter board upgrades and associated wiring. These works         will be communicated to Kāinga Ora, and agreed to, through a Work Order prior to work being done.RFP documents can be downloaded free of charge from www.tenderlink.com/kaingaora/. Tender reference KOHC-962289. All submissions and queries must be made via Tenderlink. If you have any issues with Tenderlink, please contact Tenderlink on 0800 698 363.

title: Patient and staff experience measurement Software System_WDHB_CMDHB P21-449
blurb: RFx ID: 24135152Organisation: HealthSource New Zealand LimitedOpen date: Friday, 26 March 2021 5:00 PM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 28 April 2021 2:00 PM +12:00Categories: 43230000 - SoftwareRegion: New ZealandOverview: We are looking for a solution to support our Patient Experience, Staff Experience and Patient Reported Outcomes programmes. These programmes of work are in place to capture feedback to support quality improvement and/or service redesign projects to improve patient experience and outcomes. The ideal solution will allow us to survey using multiple methods eg. via emails, triggered from QR codes, or links from websites and can be completed through any devices type. To support the scaling up of our programmes, we want a solution that would allow automated scheduling and a person centric view of completed surveys. The solution must have robust API options to allow for automated feeds for scheduling surveys and exporting of specific data.

title: Ashburton Boiler Kitchen Enablement
blurb: RFx ID: 24117426Organisation: Canterbury District Health BoardOpen date: Monday, 22 March 2021 3:00 PM +13:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 73130000 - Food and beverage industriesRegion: CanterburyOverview: The cooking equipment currently in use in Ashburton Hospital uses steam that is provided by an on-site boiler. It is anticipated that this boiler will be replaced within the next 12 months with a ground-source system that will not be able to generate steam. For this reason, we are looking to procure cooking equipment that uses electricity as opposed to steam. We are seeking to replace a variety of kettles and steam oven equipment with electrically heated, similar sizes equipment.These items need to be of stainless steel construction and any surface that would reasonably be expected to come into contact with food being manufactured from SS316 grade stainless steel.We need to replace the following steam items with equivalent sized electrical items.

title: Building Teaching Capacity in Inclusive Education in the Pacific
blurb: RFx ID: 24116576Organisation: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and TradeOpen date: Tuesday, 23 March 2021 2:30 PM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 28 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 86000000 - Education and Training ServicesRegion: InternationalOverview: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (MFAT), will be inviting submission of responses from suitably qualified and experienced organisations or consultants (including consortia) to design and implement Build Teaching Capacity for Inclusive Education [the ‘Activity’] to support education professionals in improving learning outcomes for children at risk of exclusion in the Pacific.The Activity should be targeted to assist teachers, school leaders and teacher aides to create an enabling, supportive environment for teaching and learning that caters to needs of all children in the Pacific.MFAT envisages that the Activity would be a four year intervention in the third quarter of the 2021 calendar year. title: Case Management System
blurb: RFx ID: 24075735Organisation: Criminal Cases Review CommissionOpen date: Thursday, 11 March 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 5:00 PM +13:00Categories: 43230000 - SoftwareRegion: AucklandBay of PlentyCanterburyChatham IslandsGisborneHawke's BayManawatu-WanganuiMarlboroughNelsonNorthlandOtagoSouthlandTaranakiTasmanWaikatoWellingtonWest CoastOverview: Te Kāhui Tātari Ture (Criminal Cases Review Commission) is an independent Crown entity that reviews potential miscarriages of justice and refers appropriate cases back to the appeal courts. Te Kāhui Tātari Ture will also undertake outreach and education and from time to time, undertake inquiries into systemic issues found during investigations. As part of our mahi, Te Kāhui reviews cases from the across the criminal justice system in Aotearoa. As part of our mahi we are seeking information from suppliers who may be able to provide a case management solution to Te Kāhui. Based on the volume of current case work to date, Te Kāhui is seeking a technology solution to help support a more efficient back office management of case workflow.We would like to hear from suppliers who have a track record in providing similar software solutions, and are able to provide a solution that will address our needs.Requirements of the system (needs):-	Ability to link to SharePoint for storage of documents, resources, etc.-	Ability to generate proforma documents.-	Ability to assign cases to team members and assign case workflows/tasks.-	Time recording by case.-	Ability to log enquiries, including phone, email etc and note these against an active application (if available).-	Archive function that will be able to align with our disposals authority.Ideal requirements of the system (wants):-	Connects to Xero for time recording and spend – allowing us to track this closely.-	Background analytical ability to enable us to report on our SPE objectives.As a guide we will have approx. 250 open cases at any point, however we will need the ability to archive closed cases. There is an estimate of 25 users.This is an opportunity to work with a new organisation, the likes of which Aotearoa has not seen before.  Te ao Māori is at the heart of our organisation, and we are the first Criminal Cases Review Commission in the world to be established where there is an indigenous population. Working with us gives you a chance to be part of something truly impactful, powerful and ground-breaking in the New Zealand justice system.As part of your response you are welcome to direct us to a website, portfolio or other information source.

As part of our mahi, Te Kāhui reviews cases from the across the criminal justice system in Aotearoa. Based on the volume of current case work to date, Te Kāhui is seeking a technology solution to help support a more efficient back office management of case workflow.We would like to hear from suppliers who have a track record in providing similar software solutions, and are able to provide a solution that will address our needs.Requirements of the system (needs):-	Ability to link to SharePoint for storage of documents, resources, etc.-	Ability to generate proforma documents.-	Ability to assign cases to team members and assign case workflows/tasks.-	Time recording by case.-	Ability to log enquiries, including phone, email etc and note these against an active application (if available).-	Archive function that will be able to align with our disposals authority.Ideal requirements of the system (wants):-	Connects to Xero for time recording and spend – allowing us to track this closely.-	Background analytical ability to enable us to report on our SPE objectives.As a guide we will have approx. 250 open cases at any point, however we will need the ability to archive closed cases. There is an estimate of 25 users.This is an opportunity to work with a new organisation, the likes of which Aotearoa has not seen before.  Te ao Māori is at the heart of our organisation, and we are the first Criminal Cases Review Commission in the world to be established where there is an indigenous population. Working with us gives you a chance to be part of something truly impactful, powerful and ground-breaking in the New Zealand justice system.As part of your response you are welcome to direct us to a website, portfolio or other information source.

title: Arms Information Platform
blurb: RFx ID: 24119676Organisation: New Zealand PoliceOpen date: Tuesday, 23 March 2021 10:30 AM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 12:30 PM +13:00Categories: 43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and TelecommunicationsRegion: New ZealandOverview: BACKGROUNDThe Arms Transformation Programme is implementing legislative changes and making wider improvements to the administration of the Arms Regulatory system to protect the public from the harm that may be caused by the misuse of firearms. The Arms Legislation Act 2020 (‘the Act’) directs the Commissioner to keep and operate a registry for the purposes of the Act.The Act provides a regulatory framework to achieve its purposes which are to:(a) promote the safe possession and use of firearms and other weapons; and(b) impose controls on the possession and use of firearms and other weapons.To deliver the appropriate outcomes for the New Zealand public, Government will implement, operate, and maintain a digital registry that ensures management of firearms and other weapons is conducted in an effective and efficient way, using standardised processes. IS THIS AN OPPORTUNITY OF INTEREST?Government will implement a digital platform to manage the information related to Arms (Firearms, parts, ammunition and other restricted weapons), firearms licensing and the activities associated with the possession and use of firearms. The information held must be secure and readily accessible to our process partners and Police aiding in the collective intelligence of firearms in New Zealand.The platform must: •	Provide orchestration of day to day activities to ensure quality, consistency and performance monitoring.•	Be configurable to support ready adaptation to the changes within the regulatory ecosystem.•	Provide modern channels for applicants to submit applications, manage their details, review progress of their application, and make payments online.  •	Integrate with existing Police systems that support intelligence.ADVANCE NOTICE PURPOSEThe purpose of this advance notice is to alert the market to the upcoming opportunity to participate in an ROI process. A market briefing will be conducted on TUESDAY 30 MARCH 2021 at 12.30pm at Police National Headquarters, Wellington. Participants may attend in person or remotely.To register your interest in attending, please RSVP to tenders.national@police.govt.nz by COB FRIDAY 26 MARCH 2021.

title: SAFEC049047 Firefighting Helmets
blurb: The South Australian Emergency Services Commission (SAFECOM) on behalf of the Emergency Services Sector (ESS) consisting of the South Australian Metropolitan Fire Service (MFS), South Australian Country Fire Service (SACFS) and South Australian State Emergency Service (SES) seeks to engage up to four (4) Suppliers for the supply of firefighting helmets, who will:	MFS & CFS: Supply new structural helmets and associated accessories that are ‘fit for purpose’ for structural firefighting operations. The new structural helmets must be manufactured in accordance with the Australian/New Zealand Standard 4067:2012 – Protective helmets for structural firefighting;	CFS: Supply new rural (wildland) helmets and associated accessories that is manufactured in accordance with AS/NZS 1801:1997 – Type three (3) for occupational protective helmets;	MFS: Supply new multipurpose rescue/rural (wildland) helmets and associated accessories that is manufactured in accordance with AS/NZS 1801:1997 – Type three (3) for occupational protective helmets; and	SES: Supply new general-purpose rescue helmets and associated accessories that is manufactured in accordance with AS/NZS 1801:1997 – Type one (1) and type two (2) for occupational protective helmets.The ESS proposes a potential ten (10) year contract term, consisting of:	Initial Term: Five (5) years	Extension Option 1: Three (3) years	Extension Option 2: One (1) year	Extension Option 3: One (1) year It is anticipated the Agreement will commence in November 2021.

title: SAFEC049063 MFS - Thermal Imaging Camera (Structural)
blurb: The South Australian Fire and Emergency Services Commision (SAFECOM) on behalf of the South Australian Metropolitan Fire Service (MFS) seeks to engage a sole supplier for the supply and maintenance of Thermal Imaging Cameras for structural firefighting.The structural TIC is not required to be certified to NFPA 1801:2018 - Standards on Thermal Imagers for the Fire Service, however should conform to selected elements of NFPA 1801:2018. These elements include:	Product labelling and information;	Design requirements; and	Performance requirements.The structural TIC is not required to conform to selected elements of NFPA 1801:2018 - Standards on Thermal Imagers for the Fire Service. These elements include:	Intrinsic safety certification.SAFECOM proposes a potential ten (10) year contract term, consisting of:	Initial Term: Five (5) years	Extension Option 1: Three (3) years	Extension Option 2: Two (2) yearsIt is anticipated the Agreement will commence in August 2021.

title: SAFEC049049 Catering Services for the SACFS State Training Centre, Brukunga SA
blurb: The South Australian Country Fire Service (SACFS) is seeking a supplier to provide catering services at the State Training Centre in Brukunga SA. The SACFS State Training Centre provides catering services to fire and emergency service clients, government agencies and private commercial user groups both from South Australia, interstate and overseas.The State Training Centre operates seven (7) days a week with the majority of the training being conducted on weekend’s from March to December.  Bookings are ‘light’ in the months of January and February.The State Training Centre is an operational facility that may be utilised as a base camp for responding to emergency incidents at short notice.When responding to emergency incidents, the State Training Centre may operate continuously for 24 hours, for several days at a time. A catering service is required to support these requirements.  This Invitation to Supply (“ITS”) relates to the provision of full catering services and limited provision for cleaning services associated with the kitchen and dining rooms.The SACFS proposes a five (3) year contract term, consisting of:	Initial Term: Three (3) years.	Extension Option: Two x one (1) year (3+1+1)It is anticipated the Agreement will commence in July 2021.
description: The South Australian Country Fire Service (SACFS) is seeking a supplier to provide catering services at the State Training Centre in Brukunga SA. The SACFS State Training Centre provides catering services to fire and emergency service clients, government agencies and private commercial user groups both from South Australia, interstate and overseas.The State Training Centre operates seven (7) days a week with the majority of the training being conducted on weekend’s from March to December.  Bookings are ‘light’ in the months of January and February.The State Training Centre is an operational facility that may be utilised as a base camp for responding to emergency incidents at short notice.When responding to emergency incidents, the State Training Centre may operate continuously for 24 hours, for several days at a time. title: DIT049067 21C065 Enabling Works (Roads) For New State Schools located in Angle Vale and Aldinga
blurb: PROJECT DESCRIPTION The South Australian Government has committed $26.5 million to deliver road upgrades to support the new State schools in Angle Vale and Aldinga.Construction is progressing on two new South Australian schools set to open in Term 1, 2022, as part of the South Australian Government’s record-breaking $1.3 billion education build.These include a commitment to upgrade the existing junctions on Angle Vale Road, with Riverbanks and Frisby Roads to signalised staggered T-junctions, and a commitment to construct a roundabout at the intersection of Quinliven, How and Bowering Hill roads in Aldinga.Both projects include Shared Use Paths and upgraded pedestrian facilities. This will include the construction of three dedicated pedestrian refuges as part of the new roundabout at Quinliven, How and Bowering Hill roads, and relocation of the existing koala crossing, to approximately 80 metres further east on Quinliven Road.These upgrades will improve safety for all road users and encourage active travel to and from the schools.These two schools are both being built to accommodate up to 1675 students at each location, so by delivering these upgrades the State Government is investing in road safety for the hundreds of students and their families.PREQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS - R3 F15TENDER RESPONSE UPLOADShould you require assistance in uploading your tender submission electronically please contact the Tenders SA helpdesk on 8462 1401. It is recommended that you allow at least two hours prior to tender closing time to ensure that you upload your tender. A receipt number will be issued to confirm that your submission has been completed successfully.Multiple files may be permitted - please ensure individual files do not exceed 20MB per file.
description: PROJECT DESCRIPTION The South Australian Government has committed $26.5 million to deliver road upgrades to support the new State schools in Angle Vale and Aldinga.Construction is progressing on two new South Australian schools set to open in Term 1, 2022, as part of the South Australian Government’s record-breaking $1.3 billion education build.These include a commitment to upgrade the existing junctions on Angle Vale Road, with Riverbanks and Frisby Roads to signalised staggered T-junctions, and a commitment to construct a roundabout at the intersection of Quinliven, How and Bowering Hill roads in Aldinga.Both projects include Shared Use Paths and upgraded pedestrian facilities. This will include the construction of three dedicated pedestrian refuges as part of the new roundabout at Quinliven, How and Bowering Hill roads, and relocation of the existing koala crossing, to approximately 80 metres further east on Quinliven Road.These upgrades will improve safety for all road users and encourage active travel to and from the schools.These two schools are both being built to accommodate up to 1675 students at each location, so by delivering these upgrades the State Government is investing in road safety for the hundreds of students and their families.PREQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS - R3 F15TENDER RESPONSE UPLOADShould you require assistance in uploading your tender submission electronically please contact the Tenders SA helpdesk on 8462 1401. It is recommended that you allow at least two hours prior to tender closing time to ensure that you upload your tender. A receipt number will be issued to confirm that your submission has been completed successfully.Multiple files may be permitted - please ensure individual files do not exceed 20MB per file.

description: This Tender relates to the procurement of Lithium Iron Phosphate (LFP) Batteries.The procurement process will be conducted in the following stages:	Stage 1 - Goods Agreement via Open Tender	Stage 2 - Panel Agreement with multiple battery suppliers leveraging from the supplier and product information received in Stage 1 The term of Stage 1 contract shall be 1 year (August 2021 to August 2022)The approximate battery quantity for Stage 1 contract is 1500 to 3000 single stack1 LFP battery units.The term of Stage 2 contracts (with multiple battery suppliers) shall be for 5 years (September 2022 to September 2027).The approximate annual battery quantity required for Stage 2 contract is 2500 to 3000 single stack1 LFP battery units.

title: SEU EMUS RFT
description: Through this RFT, the Victorian School Building Authority (VSBA) Sustainability and Environment Unit (SEU) is seeking a suitably qualified organisation for the provision of Energy Management and Utilities Services including:	Develop a transition-in plan (based on the plan included in the Tender)	Develop a Project Delivery Plan to be finalised in consultation with the Department.	Develop an Energy Management and Utilities Framework and deliver energy management services and systems to achieve enhanced resource and asset management practices, further compliance with AMAF and staggered integration into AIMS.	Develop equipment performance specifications	Audits in four main categories:			Workmanship		Annual compliance against regulatory obligations		Electrical		Structural			Audit data analysis, pilots and case study development	Develop a proof of concept and maturing Energy Rating Framework for Early Childhood facilities, to be scalable for the broader asset portfolio.	Develop risk maps in relation to extreme weather events such as bushfire, floods, etc.	Other Services including, but not limited to:			managing a program of works in schools		acting as Superintendent in works contracts		assisting the Department to establish panels or other contractual arrangements		developing resources to assist schools		providing professional advice, trouble shooting and technical solutions		other services relating to management of energy and utilities in Victorian government schools. And associated matters.			Data Management and integration with the VSBA Asset Information Management System

title: Robina Hospital Mental Health Secure Fencing
description: The Queensland Government is seeking Proposals for Design and Construction works at Robina Hospital, Mental Health Secure Fencing Works include, but not limited to:1) Demolition works2) Provision of Secure Fencing (Type 1 & Type 2) with gates and anti-dig barrier, behind F & G blocks.The Contractor shall be responsible for the structural design, structural integrity and certification of the total fencing installation (Type 1 -  3.6m Prefabricated Modular Walls & Type 2 – 3.6m High security mesh fencing system). The Contractor shall design, supply, install and certify a complete secure fencing system including, but not limited to; Fence Panels Posts Rails Matching integral gates Reinforced concrete bored piers Reinforced concrete ground beams/mowing strips/retaining walls All sundry fixings             3) Provision of new basketball court and precast concrete seats to form a talking circle in F2-ADP courtyard. Reinstating existing basketball court in G2 courtyard.4) Provision of additional stormwater drainage to existing low spot in G2 courtyard, raising existing field gully in F2-ADP courtyard area, making good existing field gully in G block staff courtyard.5) Earthworks: Provision of fill and adjustment of existing levels to new finished design levels.6) Landscaping: Preparation and provision of suitable topsoil and turf, making good existing gardens etc., Removal of temporary gravel road behind F & G buildings.A Mandatory Site Visit is proposed for Wednesday 31 March 2021 10.30am - 12.00pm with further information provided upon receipt of confirmation. Refer to Notice to Tenders and Conditions of Tender documents for further information.Email: GCHHS.AMS.Contracts@health.qld.gov.au for all RFI's with responses uploaded to QTenders

title: Provision of Surveillance Audits and Certification for Integrated Management System
description: The Port of Townsville Limited (the Port) is seeking a suitably qualified supplier to assess and certify the Port’s Integrated Management Systems against published standards (The Standards).The intention is to enter into a three-year contract with two twelve-month extensions at the port’s discretion.The Port has mature systems and achieved certification to the standards as recent as 2020.  Further the Port is undertaking a review with the view to further integrate systems and intend purchasing new software to support this progression.In broad terms the objective of the engagement is to:	Evaluate the level of conformance with the Port’s Integrated Management System against the applicable standard(s).	Determine the ability of the ports management system to ensure it meets the applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.	Evaluate the effectiveness of the management system to ensure the Port is meeting its objectives.	Identify areas of improvement / non-conformance within the management system.The standards are:	ISO 9001:2015 – Quality Management Systems	ISO 14001:2015 – Environmental Management Systems	ISO 45001:2018 – Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems	ISO 27001:2013 – Information Technology Management Systems	ISO 31000:2018 – Risk Management StandardThe Risk Management Standard is a recent addition and will need initial certification and then ongoing surveillance audits.This RFQ will close at 3pm EST, Monday 19 April 2021. Please Note – only one (1) request for information will be accommodated and must be lodged no later than Monday 5 April 2021

title: Wet Hired Plant & Machinery Panel - Ottery Remediation Project
blurb: Wet Hired Plant & Machinery Panel for the remediation works.
description: The Soil Conservation Service is the Head Contractor engaged by NSW Legacy Mines to undertake the Ottery Remediation Project. This civil construction project involves a major campaign of rehabilitation works at both the Ottery Mine and Tent Hill Processing Area which are contaminated with Acid Mine Drainage (AMD) from historic mining activities for Tin and Arsenic. The remediation work involves the construction of a below-ground containment cell centred around 2 existing mining subsidence voids. Waste tailings bodies from both Ottery Mine and Tent Hill are to be excavated and treated with lime before emplacement in the cell according to specified layers and strict compaction. Excavation is guided by an experienced geochemist and the 8 layers form a critical sequence that aims to bind the heavy metals and reduce acidity in leachate. The containment cell will be capped with locally won clay and overburden then revegetated to native scrubland. The public Crown reserve will return to its current land use being a tourist attraction for mining enthusiasts. All works will be conducted in accordance with a fleet of Management Plans, environmental controls and strict occupational hygiene and workplace health and safety controls. The project is expected to take 6 months to complete during the winter period of May to October 2021. All works will be conducted in accordance with a fleet of Management Plans, environmental controls and strict occupational hygiene and workplace health and safety controls. title: HMAS Stirling Boat Landing Jetty Repairs, WA
blurb: HMAS Stirling Boat Landing Jetty Repairs, WA
description: The scope of this project involves repair works to the Officer’s Boat Landing Jetty at HMAS Stirling. The purpose of the works is to preserve the functional capacity of the jetty. The repair works include two main tasks – concrete patch repair and timber fender replacement. The concrete works include patch repair of concrete deck soffit, edges, and corners; installation of local galvanic protection anodes of the repaired reinforcement; and application of silane treatment. The timber works include removal and replacement of all timber fenders, waler beams, edge timbers, fasteners, waler beam metal brackets.

title: Engagement of a Delivery Partner to provide & support a Foreign Investment Case Management & Advanced Analytics Solution
blurb: Engagement of a Delivery Partner to provide & support a Foreign Investment Case Management & Advanced Analytics Solution.
description: Treasury’s existing foreign investment ICT platform needs upgrading to support the reformed foreign investment framework. In the 2020-21 Budget, the Government announced funding to implement a new ICT platform which will support more effective and efficient foreign investment application processing and compliance activities across Government.The funding also includes a new consolidated Register of Foreign Ownership of Australian Assets (administered by the ATO). This program of digital enabled projects is known as the Foreign Investment Digital Transformation (FIDT) Program. The FIDT Program will deliver a:– Case Management System – a modern case and compliance management platform.– Advanced Analytics capability – a new advanced analytics platform.– Consolidated Assets Register – register of foreign owned assets (out of scope – administered and built by the ATO).This RFT is seeking to secure a delivery partner for the Case Management System and Advanced Analytics Platform which when combined with integration and other services, will represent a complete solution for the Treasury (the Solution).The Treasury is also seeking a Delivery Partner(s) with appropriate technology solutions, delivery experience, and mindset to work collaboratively with it to iteratively design and deliver the Solution and business change. Establishing a successful delivery partnership is a critical success factor for delivering the FIDT Program and in realising the Government’s target outcomes and benefits. The delivery partner will also be required to integrate and establish connections between the solution and the new Register of Foreign Ownership of Australian Assets.

title: Command Support Training Contract
blurb: Training Delivery, Management, and Support Services
description: As part of the Australian Army’s Forces Command, the Defence Command Support Training Centre (DCSTC) conducts individual multi-discipline specialist training, manages trade structures and doctrine in order to generate robust, versatile and adaptive soldiers/sailors/airmen and officers for Army and the Joint Force. The role of DCSTC is to integrate, modernise, and implement individual training for the three Services and Joint capabilities, as well as Army trade management functions for assigned disciplines to enable and enhance both Army’s warfighting capabilities and Defence command support capability.DCSTC currently delivers a range of core training services through its Command Support Training contract. This contract is set to expire on 31 December 2021 and DCSTC is seeking the Services of a Provider in delivering the continuation of critical capability requirements in Industry Based and Commercial-Off-The-Shelf Communications, Music and Multi Media, Public Affairs, Military Police Investigator; and Intelligence training.DCSTC seeks a Service Provider who can provide a holistic end-to-end service that trains, assesses, confers qualifications, and offers remedial training options to learners in an agile shared operating environment.

title: North Shore District Court Weathertightness Remediation
blurb: RFx ID: 24142324Organisation: Ministry of JusticeOpen date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 3:30 PM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 27 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Categories: 30000000 - Structures and Building and Construction and Manufacturing Components and SuppliesRegion: AucklandOverview: The North Shore District Court (NSDC) Weathertightness Remediation Project (the Project) is a construction project, for the NSDC property located at 79 Corinthian Drive, Albany.This procurement process is to engage a main contractor, to complete this construction project.This project is to remediate and create a weathertight building envelope. Due to the intrusive nature of the weathertightness remediation works, seismic remediation works will also be carried out as part of the same project.  This project also encompasses replacement of the exterior cladding, window joinery and roof, remediation of moisture damage and structural repairs to improve seismic performance.  Due to weathertightness failures the courthouse is in a poor condition and it continues to degrade.

title: Freight Forwarding of products to support EECA's check testing programme
blurb: RFx ID: 24155998Organisation: Energy Efficiency & Conservation AuthorityOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 1:00 PM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 28 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 78000000 - Transportation and Storage and Mail ServicesRegion: InternationalOverview: EECA is seeking to appoint a freight forwarder to support its 2021-2024 Product Check Testing Programme. This programme involves intermittent shipping of products purchased in New Zealand to testing laboratories overseas. On average, we deliver products to overseas laboratories three times a year. We are seeking Respondents that are able to demonstrate capacity to deliver cargo (within one month of receiving products) as and when required.We want to work with a supplier who has a proven experience and record in freight forwarding products to overseas ports and can meet all of the other pre-conditions in section 3.2.We are seeking a solution that transports products to overseas laboratories in good condition (without loss or damage), on time, within budget, and includes the contract holder acting as the customs/importation agent.

title: Request for Tender for Provision of Home Share Services
blurb: The home share service aims to explore alternative affordable housing solutions for young people, while helping combat social isolation experienced by older people living alone.
description: The home share service aims to explore alternative affordable housing solutions for young people, while helping combat social isolation experienced by older people living alone. Through the service, older people (‘home owners’) with available accommodation in their home will be ‘matched’ with younger people (18-24) (‘occupants’) looking for affordable accommodation. The home share service will be trialled for 12 months in the inner city / Northern Sydney regionsThe home share service aims to explore alternative affordable housing solutions for young people, while helping combat social isolation experienced by older people living alone. Through the service, older people (‘home owners’) with available accommodation in their home will be ‘matched’ with younger people (18-24) (‘occupants’) looking for affordable accommodation. The home share service will be trialled for 12 months in the inner city / Northern Sydney regions

title: 2457-20/21 Ashley River Vegetation Clearance
blurb: RFx ID: 24147310Organisation: Environment CanterburyOpen date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 4:00 PM +13:00Close date: Monday, 26 April 2021 9:00 AM +12:00Categories: 70170000 - Water resources development and oversight77000000 - Environmental ServicesRegion: CanterburyOverview: The project involves removing vegetation which is currently choking a 13 km section of the Ashley River Rakahuri between Ashley Gorge and approximately 1 km east of Cottles Road.  This choking of the river by mature trees, mostly willow, and brush weeds is causing the river to spread laterally, resulting in erosion and loss of productive farmland.This proposal is the first stage of a project to restore a more natural braiding river regime for the Ashly Rakahuri and Okuku Rivers.  The end result will be reduced flood risk together with improved natural character, including habitat for native species.

blurb: The key outcomes from this RFP include:• Synergies for permanent and executive recruitment process• Leveraging a Service Provider's expertise• Renewed focus on icare's current business requirements which are no longer in the high growth start-up phase• Greater efficiencies and aligning service requirements that provide potential cost savings
description: The RFP provides icare with the following opportunities:The RFP provides icare with the following opportunities:• Create a consistent experience for icare Hiring Managers by presenting candidates that have the right skills and experience which decreases time to fill and minimises business disruption• Create a consistent and positive experience for candidates who are interested in working for icare• Promote innovation and cost savings in delivering the recruitment services• Rationalise technology options for integration into current systems (SuccessFactors)• Encourage social procurement outcomes• Establish robust data and reporting mechanism to provide financial data and management information• Guaranteed key performance levels and regular performance reviews with the Service Provider• Value-add services such as bespoke training and access to selective training• Ensure an uplift in risk management practices• Ensure a recruitment model that fits the expected future demands of the business

title: Qualitative research: Māori and Pasifika health and wellbeing
blurb: RFx ID: 24144136Organisation: Health Promotion AgencyOpen date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 8:30 AM +13:00Close date: Thursday, 29 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 81130000 - StatisticsRegion: New ZealandOverview: Te Hiringa Hauora/Health Promotion Agency is looking for research suppliers to collect and present qualitative data on Māori and Pasifika understandings of health and wellbeing. We are interested in the story-telling narrative, and understanding health and wellbeing related concepts such as collectivity, whānau/fanau, intergenerational wellbeing, spirituality and links to the environment. We are looking for either one research supplier experienced in Kaupapa Māori and Talanoa research methodologies, or two separate suppliers. Research with Māori participants needs to be Māori led, and research with Pasifika participants needs to be Pasifika led. This is a unique opportunity to influence our organisation’s understanding of health and wellbeing beyond our historical data collection methods. Your research skills and expertise will amplify the voices of Māori and Pasifika whānau/fanau and help us to understand what flourishing and thriving looks like to them.  To access the RFP and response form and to be updated with questions and answers please subscribe to this notice.

title: RFID Project
blurb: RFx ID: 24143745Organisation: Far North District CouncilOpen date: Tuesday, 30 March 2021 8:00 AM +13:00Close date: Thursday, 22 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Categories: 32000000 - Electronic Components and Supplies43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and Telecommunications44000000 - Office Equipment and Accessories and Supplies45000000 - Printing and Photographic and Audio and Visual Equipment and Supplies48000000 - Service Industry Machinery and Equipment and Supplies52000000 - Domestic Appliances and Supplies and Consumer Electronic ProductsRegion: NorthlandOverview: Far North District Libraries are seeking to transform and modernise the libraries’ service delivery via full migration of all six libraries to RFID and customer self-check operating models. This project’s goal is to create efficiencies as outlined in the Future Libraries Strategy that allows a positive refocus of skilled staff time away from routine transactional services into transformational programming services. This is an exciting opportunity to support a large initial project phase requiring significant goods and services investment, and further guarantee an ongoing vendor relationship for a minimum of 3 years to supply ancillary operational support services.   What we need•	Tenderers shall supply a range of products and services to support the requirements for  up to six New Zealand library sites  located within the Far North region,  (Paihia, Kawakawa, Kaikohe, Kerikeri Kaeo and Kaitaia) •	This includes full RFID retrospective collections tagging support; including the supply of mobile retrospective tagging hardware (retrospective tagging trolleys or equivalent), training session for internal staff who will complete the tagging process•	Initial tag supply (120,000 tags)•	Self-check and staff-returns hardware/software supply and install as specified•	Ongoing tag supply and support services including licensing•	Ongoing software and hardware technical support and development.•	Tenderer shall demonstrate proven experience working with public libraries within New Zealand delivering RFID projects, from retrospective tagging all the way through to operating and maintaining self-check and staff software and hardware post-install.•	The tenderer’s software must be able to  configure and operate successfully with Kotui/Symphony Workflows LMS.

title: 2020/21 Defence Industry Survey
blurb: RFx ID: 24157261Organisation: Ministry of DefenceOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 4:00 PM +13:00Close date: Wednesday, 21 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 15000000 - Fuels and Fuel Additives and Lubricants and Anti corrosive Materials25000000 - Commercial and Military and Private Vehicles and their Accessories and Components32000000 - Electronic Components and Supplies43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and Telecommunications46000000 - Defense and Law Enforcement and Security and Safety Equipment and Supplies81000000 - Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services86000000 - Education and Training Services92000000 - National Defense and Public Order and Security and Safety ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Defence Industry survey was established in 2016 as a repeatable annual assessment to measure Defence industry's satisfaction with their engagements with the Ministry of Defence (MoD), the New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) and prime contractors.Industry is a key partner of Defence and is a critical enabler of Defence Force operations.As a key partner, we would like to hear from you if you have engaged as a prime or sub-prime contractor with MoD or NZDF over the last year regarding the supply of equipment, goods and services, either directly or via another contractor. Some questions are open ended and designed to get your thoughts and ideas. If we would like to refer specifically to these in our published results, we will not share any information that could identify you or your company without consulting with you in the first instance.Your survey responses will remain confidential. We will only report aggregated data, along with how we intend responding to your suggestions for improvement. As the survey is designed to measure engagement with Defence, we welcome feedback from as many individuals as possible from within an organisation who have interacted with the Ministry of Defence and/or New Zealand Defence Force.If you are interested in completing the survey, please find the link below. The survey is hosted by SurveyMonkey and you don’t require additional login.  Please allow 15 - 20 minutes to complete this survey.SurveyMonkey Link:  For further information, please contact industry@defence.govt.nz with 2020/21 industry survey in the subject line.

title: Main Building Contractor for the refurbishment of two classrooms at Gleniti School
blurb: RFx ID: 24138532Organisation: Ministry of Education - School InfrastructureOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 20 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance ServicesRegion: CanterburyOverview: Block 6 is a 4 classroom block of a style originally constructed in the 1970's. In 2014 Gleniti commissioned a ILE refurbishment of Block 3 (similar style to Block 6). This refurbishment has been hugely successful with plenty of positive feedback from teachers and students as to the benefits gained from creating a modern learning environment. This has now become the 'standard' that the School wishes to apply to the remaining classrooms, as funds and priorities permit. Classrooms 1 & 2 of Block 6 were upgraded in 2020 and the school wishes to continue this through in the room 3 & 4, with a refurbishment which includes improved lighting and ventilation, adapting wasteful 'cloakrooms' into breakout spaces, using glass partitions to help improve the learning environment and adding linings to improve acoustics.

title: Supply, install and commisson a remote control system for operation of the Reedy Lake Regulators.
description: The works of this Contract comprise the supply, delivery, installation and commissioning of the following mechanical and electrical equipment:Reedy Lake Inlet Regulator	Supply and fit electric operated actuators (one for each of the three gates) to the existing inlet regulator (a 3-gate undershot regulator) for operation of the weir gates.	Supply and install a battery pack power source and solar panel system of sufficient capacity to provide for periodic opening and closing of the weir gates.	Supply and install a control system to allow remote operation of the weir gates via the mobile phone network.Reedy Lake outlet Weir	Supply and fit an electric operated actuator to the existing tilting weir gate outlet regulator to provide for operation of the weir gate.	Supply and install a battery pack power source and solar panel system of sufficient capacity to provide for periodic opening and closing of the weir gate. 	Supply and install a control system to allow remote operation of the weir gate via the mobile phone network.

title: DEW049071 River Vessel Waste Disposal Station, LOCs Contract
blurb: The Department for Environment and Water (DEW) operates 13 River Vessel Waste Disposal Stations (RVWDS) along the length of the River Murray. These stations provide a sewage and waste (domestic rubbish) disposal service to operators of houseboats and other recreational vessels on the river. The day-to-day management of the RVWDS is the responsibility of the Contract Manager, based at Berri. The operations and maintenance activities of the stations are undertaken through two separate contracts:A ‘Mechanical and Electrical’ services contract, for the undertaking of (skilled) preventative maintenance and breakdown/repair maintenance. This contract is presently awarded to SA Water.One or more Local Operator Contractor(s) (LOC), for the undertaking of general (unskilled) housekeeping, waste removal, monitoring pump hours and initial troubleshooting in the event of service difficulty.Currently two contracts are awarded to two service providers and these contracts expire on 31 May 2021.  Quotes are requested for the renewal of this service only and not the Mechanical and Electrical services contract.

title: RFT - CN000142: Parwan-Balliang Irrigation District Pipeline
description: CN000142: Parwan-Balliang Irrigation District Pipeline The Parwan-Balliang Irrigation District (PBID) scheme will supply recycled water to several properties in the Parwan and Balliang areas, south of Bacchus Marsh, in Victoria. Recycled water from three Recycled Water Plants (Bacchus Marsh, Melton and Sunbury) will be supplied to customers' outlets through a transfer main (the PBID pipeline) to be constructed in both road reserves and private property. Customers will be responsible for all on-farm infrastructure connecting to the outlets on the PBID pipeline. This Request for Tender (RFT) is for the construction of the Parwan-Balliang Irrigation District (PBID) pipeline.  The work involves: 		Installation and commissioning of approximately 14km of 600mm and 675mm diameter RRJ GRP pipe, 450mm diameter PE pipe, and associated fixtures; 			Installation of trenchless crossing of several creeks and roads; 			Supply of various pipes and fittings, noting that the Principal will supply the GRP pipe; 			Installation of customer irrigation offtake assemblies including meters and associated equipment; 			Interaction with various landowners for construction within easements on private property. 	The Principal will supply the 600mm and 675mm GRP pipes, and the contractor will supply and install all other pipe and fittings as required by the specification, including all pipe required for trenchless sections.  All pipes and fittings installed must be in accordance with Western Water’s approved pipe products as set out in the MRWA web portal. http://www.mrwa.com.au/Pages/Home.aspx  All work under the contract will be required to be completed no later than June 2022 and an earlier finish will be requested. A virtual industry briefing will be held on Wednesday 14th April, and questions during the tender period (until end of Period for questions) are to be directed via the Forum on the Buying for Victoria website. The contract will be delivered under AS2124 and the current program indicates the following key dates.**  Tender Opening: 1st April 2021 Tender Briefing: Wednesday 14th April, 10:00am.  Tender Closing Time: early June 2021 Execution of Contract: end August 2021 Works operational: May 2022 **These dates are indicative only and subject to change. Final evaluation criteria will be provided within the RFT documentation, noting that Tenderers will be required to provide/demonstrate: 		Capability to comply with the technical requirements of the brief; 			previous successful experience on similar projects; 			capability to meet their proposed completion timeframe; 			experience and planned approach to managing interactions with landowners, including installation of irrigation offtake assemblies; 			capability to comply with various federal requirements including as described below; and 			other information as requested in the RFT process. 	 Building Code 2016 The Code for the Tendering and Performance of Building Work 2016 [Cth] (the Building Code) applies to the building work associated with this project. By submitting a tender for this project, tenderers become a ‘code covered entity’ and are therefore subject to the requirements of the Building Code from submission of their tender for this project.  Further information will be provided in the Request for Tender documentation, including the requirement for all tenderers to submit a Workplace Relations Management Plan with their tenders for approval by the Australian Building and Construction Commission (ABCC) in accordance with Part 6 of the Building Code. OFSC Accreditation Scheme It is also a requirement of this project that the builder(s) contracted to undertake the building work be accredited under the federal Work Health and Safety Accreditation Scheme, established under the Building and Construction Industry (Improving Productivity) Act 2016 [Cth], at the time of entering into the contract for the building work and while the building work is being carried out.*  The builder(s) must comply with all conditions of Scheme accreditation.   * Paragraph 26(g) of the Building and Construction Industry (Improving Productivity) (Accreditation Scheme) Rules 2019 [Cth] outlines provisions applying to joint venture arrangements that include accredited and unaccredited builders.

title: Thredbo Valley Track Extension - Elevated Platform 603
blurb: NPWS is seeking tenders from experienced Contractors for the design and construction of an elevated platform that will form the final component of the 38 kilometre shared use Thredbo Valley Track in Kosciuszko National Park.  The elevated platform will traverse an area of identified geo-technical hazards and cross-slope in close proximity to the Thredbo River.  The finished structure will link the Thredbo Valley Track Extension to the Thredbo River Day Use Area.  The location of the elevated platform will also provide many National Park users the opportunity to view and experience the beautiful Thredbo River on an easy short walk from Thredbo River Day Use Area.

title: Provision of Transitional Aged Care Program (TACP) Services
blurb: HealthShare NSW, on behalf of Murrumbidgee Local Health District (MLHD), invites tenders seeking Non-Government Organisations (NGO) to provide Non-Clinical services to clients across the MLHD associated to the Transitional Aged Care Program (TACP) Services.
description: The objective of this Request for Tender (RFT) is to seek Non-Government Organisations (NGO) to provide Non-Clinical services to clients across the Murrumbidgee Local Health District associated to the Transitional Aged Care Program (TACP) Services.The Transitional Aged Care Program (TACP) Services provides short term restorative care to optimise the functioning and independence of older people after a hospital stay. It is goal-oriented and therapy focused. The program runs for up to a 12 week period post discharge from hospital. TACP may consist of multiple clinical care such as physiotherapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy and also include a range of Activities of Daily Living (ADL) including personal care, domestic assistance, meal preparation, social activity and ADL shopping and home safety.The target group are older people discharged from an acute hospital and needing low intensity therapy and support at home for a period of up to 12 weeks.

title: Tenancy Management Solution - Request for Proposal
blurb: RFx ID: 24162734Organisation: Wellington City CouncilOpen date: Thursday, 1 April 2021 4:30 PM +13:00Close date: Friday, 23 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 43230000 - SoftwareRegion: New ZealandOverview: WCC is a local government authority which provides affordable homes to low-income households, and to those who face barriers to other types of housing. We support those most in need, with over 1900 units across 60 locations across Wellington city, by offering rents set at 70% of market rent.The City Housing business unit (BU) has Tenancy Advisors that handle day-to-day tenancy matters for approximately 3500 tenants, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. These include applications for and allocation of housing, inspections, payments and end of tenancy processes.Tenancies are currently managed in a tenancy management system that has been in place since the early 2000’s. The current system manages property information, tenant information, financial transactions, and is a central repository for tenancy related notes generated by the Tenancy staff. The current system is now several versions behind the most up-to-date release and does not currently cohesively integrate with key WCC systems and processes. This means we currently have an over-reliance on external and/or manual processes, negatively impacting our internal efficiencies and the service WCC are ultimately able to provide to our customers. The Council has therefore decided to replace the existing tenancy management system with a new Tenancy Management Solution (TMS), as described in this RFP.Our primary objective is to engage and work closely with an experienced software solution provider to provide, configure, support and evolve a Tenancy Management Solution, that supports the day-to-day management of BU functions and delivers a great experience for our housing customers. To avoid any doubt and to help you decide whether or not to respond, WCC is not looking for: •	On-premise software installations.•	Theoretical approaches•	New builds or solutions that do not currently exist i.e. are still conceptual. •	A solution that is a module within or that requires the purchase of a broader solution e.g. ERP or Business Process Management (BPM) solutions. •	Methods or technologies that present unacceptable risks to project delivery. •	Solutions that are inflexible or costly to update or evolve over time.

title: Overflow Building Consent Processing
blurb: RFx ID: 24162172Organisation: Whangarei District CouncilOpen date: Thursday, 1 April 2021 3:30 PM +13:00Close date: Thursday, 15 April 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services80000000 - Management and Business Professionals and Administrative Services83000000 - Public Utilities and Public Sector Related ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: Whangarei District Council (WDC) are reviewing their overflow building consent processing services.This background to this category includes:▪ the services are set out in the in-scope area below▪ the services are currently supplied through a mix of internal resources and contracted out resources▪ the mix of internal versus contracted out work varies on a day-to-day basis depending on: the number and type of consents to be processed available internal staff:▪ skills and qualifications▪ absent/illness▪ on training▪ demand for consents is between 1300 and 1500 per year. The last three years have shown no sign of slowing down▪ the council team process about 1200 per yearThe council will be appointing a panel of suppliers:▪ one preferred supplier and one or two reserves depending on their capacity▪ the panel is open – other suppliers could be added to it if demand is too great for the preferred supplier and reserves or a panel supplier went out of business▪ if the preferred supplier came off the panel then the first reserve from the current procurement process could be used as the new preferred▪ work is allocated to the preferred supplier in the first instance and if they can’t take all the demand the work is offered to the reserve or reserves. If there are two reserves then it would be allocated on the basis of: quality of work completed turn-about so work is evenly apportioned

title: Flyger Road poplar and willow nursery maintenance contract
blurb: RFx ID: 24134316Organisation: Northland Regional CouncilOpen date: Thursday, 1 April 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 77000000 - Environmental ServicesRegion: NorthlandOverview: The Poplar and Willow Nursery, Flyger Road is a nursery operated by the NRC to produce viable planting material for the Northland region. The planting material produced by the nursery is used together with soil conservation planting plans to help mitigate soil erosion to improve water quality and farm productivity. The nursery consists of 16 blocks of mixed cultivars of poplar and willow. A contract for is sought for the maintenance of the nursery as defined in the RFT document. This contract duration is for two years with the option of extending for an additional year at the mutual agreement of both parties.

description: Parks Victoria (in cooperation with Sports & Recreation Victoria), invite suppliers to submit a fixed lump sum price for the design & construction of a new shared use sporting pavilion at Albert Park.The project requires a design and construction team to finalise the design and commence construction in accordance with the tender documentation.Please find attached all available information to allow for the submission of your price for both design and construction elements.Please complete all tender schedules and provide all information as requested with your submission.Tenders close on Thursday 6th May 2021 at 14:00pmSubmissions receive after this time will not be accepted.All tender queries must be submitted in writing Please note, Suppliers will be required to abide by Victorian Government policies & procedures, including but not limited to the following: 	Social procurement 	Local jobs First Policy	Environmentally sustainable development (ESD) initiativesWe look forward to receiving your submission. Please note, the online forum will be turned off today (12th April 2021) at 2pm.All queries are to be sent to the contacts provided. All queries will be actioned and issued as addenda or as further information to all parties. Addendum No.1 was uploaded 22nd April 2021 at 8:26pmAddendum No.2 was uploaded on 27th April 2021 at 10:06pmAddendum No.3 was uploaded on 28th April 2021 at 5:37pmAddendum No.4 was uploaded on 4th May 2021 at 8:53pm

title: Request for Proposals for a Box Making Solution for the Tāhuhu: Preserving the Nation’s Memory Programme
blurb: RFx ID: 24166191Organisation: Department of Internal AffairsOpen date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 10:30 AM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 4 May 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 14000000 - Paper Materials and Products23000000 - Industrial Manufacturing and Processing Machinery and Accessories73000000 - Industrial Production and Manufacturing ServicesRegion: WellingtonOverview: This RFP relates to securing a box making solution to be utilised for the eventual move from Archives New Zealand (Mulgrave Street) to the new Archives Facility (2 Aitken Street) and Regional Shared Repository.As part of Tāhuhu, there is a requirement for Te Rua Mahara o te Kāwangatanga (Archives New Zealand) and Te Puna Mātauranga (the National Library of New Zealand) to prepare their holdings and collections for relocation. All items must be appropriately packaged not only to ensure the safe and secure transportation to any new location, but to also support the ongoing preservation strategies of both institutions.To efficiently achieve the high-volume of packaging needed over the next 5 to 7 years, the Department requires a box making solution. It is intended that this solution will be used by Archives New Zealand, the National Library and Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision throughout the Tāhuhu Programme and beyond this (i.e. for ongoing BAU requirements following the completion of the Programme).

title: EOI - Evans Head Park and Foreshore Rejuvenation Project
blurb: The purpose of the project is to complete the construction of the park redevelopment which consists of the Riverside Precinct, Central Precinct and Beachside Precinct. Construction consists of demolition of existing park infrastructure, construction of new stormwater drainage, kerbs, pavement, footpaths, fencing, electrical, sewer, water, gas, playground, lighting and landscaping.
description: RHP wish to ascertain the level of interest and suitability of leading civil, landscaping and services contractors to complete the construction of the Evans Head Park and Foreshore rejuvenation Project, which consists of: Riverside PrecinctRiverside Precinct• Decommissioning of existing camp sites establishing new public open space of the Central Precinct• Reconfiguration & refurbishment of 50 new short-term camping sites all with power, water and sullage• Creation of footpath linking Town Centre to Evans River Foreshore. Central PrecinctCentral Precinct• Construction of new picnic shelters, BBQ facilities and a Regionally Iconic Playground• Construction of new landscaped Amphitheatre & events space• Kiosk upgrade, including the improvement of outdoor eating areas• Equal access design for all above infrastructure including beach & foreshore.• Repairs and upgrades to shared pedestrian and bicycle path• General landscaping & beautification• Reconfiguration of the existing road network including provision of additional visitor day parking. Beachside Precinct• Construction of 6 new luxury self-contained cabins (architecturally and environmentally designed)• Construction of new landscaping and beautification of public-facing boundaries The intention of the EOI process is to short list interested contractors based on their demonstrated ability against the evaluation criteria.

title: Rongoā Services 2021-2024
blurb: RFx ID: 24157411Organisation: Ministry of HealthOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 5:00 PM +13:00Close date: Thursday, 6 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 85000000 - Healthcare ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: This Request for Proposal (RFP) is an invitation to suitably qualified providers (Respondents) to submit a Proposal for the provision of rongoā services.The Ministry of Health (Ministry) has supported access to and delivery of rongoā services since 1991. The Ministry currently has contracts with 20 providers for the delivery of rongoā services in various regions. These contracts expire on 30 June 2021. We are looking to put new contracts in place to take effect from 1 July 2021. We propose contracts will be for an initial term of three years, (ie from 1 July 2021 to 30 June 2024), with the Ministry holding one right of renewal for a further period of three years.Current holders of contracts for delivery of rongoā services are eligible to apply for new contracts, as are any other providers who meet the eligibility conditions..Contracts for successful Respondents will specify a minimum target number of client contact sessions which the provider must achieve each year.A primary condition for selection is being able to demonstrate that there is a reasonable likelihood of your being able to meet at least that target number of client contact sessions. This means being able to attract and maintain a customer base and provide staffing resources necessary to deliver that level of activity.Services are expected to be delivered within a defined geographical area. Respondents should engage appropriately with mana whenua if proposing to offer services in an area away from their rohe or usual place of operation, or if proposing to offer rongoā services for the first time.

title: Shipyard Construction of a Research Vessel
blurb: RFx ID: 24178224Organisation: National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research LimitedOpen date: Wednesday, 7 April 2021 1:00 PM +12:00Close date: Wednesday, 5 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72141200 - Marine construction servicesRegion: InternationalOverview: The National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research Ltd (NIWA) requires a replacement for its 40-year-old research vessel RV Kaharoa.A new multipurpose Research Vessel is required to meet NIWA’s survey needs now and into the future. These include offshore fisheries surveys (demersal and pelagic trawling and acoustic surveys), oceanographic surveys, hydrographic surveys.The vessel needs to be capable of deployment and recovery of a range of equipment, including ROVs/AUVs. NIWA have commissioned Naval Architects Skipsteknisk AS to produce a basic vessel design and tender documentation for vessel construction.We are seeking to engage a suitably qualified and experienced shipyard to accept the Skipsteknisk AS design, and work with Skipsteknisk AS on the detailed design, construction and outfitting of this vessel (approx. length 36m). The proposed completion date to be June 2024.

title: Hauraki Pumpstation Inlet Upgrades (Shovel Ready) – Mill Road No 1 & No 2.
blurb: RFx ID: 23988639Organisation: Waikato Regional CouncilOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 4:00 PM +13:00Close date: Friday, 21 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 81101500 - Civil engineering95000000 - Land and Buildings and Structures and ThoroughfaresRegion: WaikatoOverview: Waikato Regional Council (Council) invites tenders for Hauraki Pumpstation Inlet Upgrades (Shovel Ready) – Mill Road No 1 & No 2 and Roger Harris Pumpstations.This Tender is for the upgrade of two pumpstation inlet structures over one construction seasons to improve equipment access to screens for weed clearance, and health and safety upgrades. Mill Road No 1 and No 2 pumpstations are located at the end of Mill Road, Paeroa and are programmed for the 2021/22 construction season. The pumpstations are programmed for inlet bay upgrades to address the following issues:•	Health and safety improvements to reduce operator risk (walkways, handrails, lighting);•	Sump corrosion below water level (Mill Road No 2); •	General remediation of crib walls; and•	Provide access to weed clearing equipment to improve effectiveness during operation.This project is receiving funding from the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) as part of the COVID19 economic recovery “Shovel Ready” stimulus.

title: Lotto NZ RFP for Thermal Paper Processing
blurb: RFx ID: 24162767Organisation: New Zealand Lotteries CommissionOpen date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 3:30 PM +12:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 14121800 - Coated papersRegion: New ZealandOverview: Lotto NZ has a  network of around 1500  retail outlets throughout New Zealand  that require a continuous supply of thermal coated printed stock of yellow paper for our iconic lotto tickets.  Despite a recent marked growth in our online channel, retail sales currently account for over 60% of total sales. The balance of total sales varies according to changes to our game portfolio, and fluctuations in our jackpot amounts. The object of this Request for Proposal (RFP) is to seek a partner to execute the processing and printing of the thermal yellow paper, and the subsequent dispatch of the full order of prepacked cartons of stock to our   warehouses located in Auckland and Wellington.  This enables us to distribute stock to the  Lotto NZ retail network within set timeframes and in accordance with set standards of quality and accuracy. We supply the product at our cost to  retailers. Lotto NZ exists to exist to provide safe gaming that allows New Zealanders to play and win while contributing money back to New Zealand communities. With 100% of our profits going to the community, via the New Zealand Lottery Grants Board, we generate funding that supports the vital work of thousands of Kiwi organisations and charities every year.Therefore cost efficiency and the highest quality of production is paramount to us. Any errors in the printing or finishing of the product may lead to hardware malfunctions, and loss of sales. Should a production error occur, remediation and identification of faulty individual rolls can be extremely onerous. Lotto NZ is an iconic brand, with high visibility and awareness from the general public and our customers in the event of any perceived errors in our materials.  It is therefore vital that we achieve 100% production accuracy and quality through this contract. Lotto NZ tickets are produced for our draw-based games: Lotto, Strike, Powerball, Bullseye and Keno (see www.mylotto.co.nz for more information on game play). The yellow paper tickets are printed in store using terminals manufactured by International Game Technology PLC (IGT). Each retail outlet has at least one terminal and printer and associated hardware in the store.
