title: Staff Safety and Security Training
blurb: RFx ID: 24178741Organisation: New Zealand Fish and Game CouncilOpen date: Wednesday, 7 April 2021 2:00 PM +12:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 46000000 - Defense and Law Enforcement and Security and Safety Equipment and SuppliesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The need to procure these services externally has arisen because Fish and Game New Zealand do not always have their own security subject matter experts, within Health Safety and Security (HSS), may not have the capacity to deliver the expected volume of staff safety security training workshops required to support Ranger's frontline nationally. The key objectives of this procurement are to:1.	Secure the services of a supplier of qualified staff safety and security facilitators to ensure the delivery of comprehensive, consistent, and high-quality staff safety and security training to Rangers (both staff and volunteers) the content of which is being developed in-house. 2.	Establish a strategic partnership with an external supplier that encourages their collective input and feedback into the content and delivery model. All content will remain the intellectual property (IP) of Fish and Game New Zealand.Fish and Game New Zealand is seeking:•	The services of experienced staff safety and security qualified facilitators, on an “as needs” basis, to ensure the delivery of comprehensive, consistent, and high-quality security training to our people.•	A shared facilitation workload model that allows Fish and Game New Zealand to share this workshop demand between the internal compliance team, and one external supplier who can deliver staff safety and security training.•	Establishment of a strategic partnership with external supplier that encourages their collective input and feedback into the content and the delivery (which drives continuous improvement - continuing to mature and improve Fish and Game New Zealand owned staff safety and security content and training model).We have four Pre-Conditions that Respondents must be able to meet1.	All supplier facilitators working on Fish and Game regional sites must agree to complete a ‘Ministry of Justice Form – Request for Criminal Conviction History – Third Party.’2.	All supplier qualified facilitators must be First Aid qualified. Certificates must be provided as part of the RFQ Response.3.	Supplier must hold current professional indemnity insurance valued at $1m. Insurance document must be provided as part of the RFQ Response.4.	Supplier qualified facilitators (a minimum of two) servicing this contract, must have a minimum of: 4.1	5 years’ previous experience in a staff safety and security related occupation (e.g., Police, Corrections, Private Security). 4.2	2 years’ experience delivering facilitation.

title: Water Storage – Project Management Services
blurb: RFx ID: 24168691Organisation: Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences Limited (GNS Sciences)Open date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Close date: Thursday, 29 April 2021 1:00 PM +12:00Categories: 77000000 - Environmental Services80101600 - Project managementRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Institute of Geological and Nuclear Sciences Limited (GNS) is seeking to appoint a suitably qualified Project Manager(s) who will be responsible for overseeing a series of tasks associated with the collection of scientifically robust data as part of a joint GNS and MBIE Provincial Development Unit (PDU) initiative to create a science platform to improve our understanding of water storage opportunities and water availability.The platform (Aotearoa Aqua Intel) is designed to provide independent, scientifically robust data that will enable findings to be drawn and applied across the country as well as providing region-wide benefits to the regions involved in the assessments and investigations.Reporting to the Project Governance Group the Project Manager(s) will keep GNS programme managers and the project Steering Committee (GNS and PDU) informed of progress, risks and opportunities, costings, and any significant issues

description: Queensland Health is seeking expressions of interest (EOI) from potential suppliers for the Provision of a Service Improvement Strategy for the Care of People with Personality Disorders in Queensland’s Hospital and Health Services (HHS). The purpose of the EOI is to determine market interest and identify suitable suppliers with the required experience, capability and capacity to develop and deliver the services. The EOI is the first stage of a two stage process. The EOI process will be used to shortlist potential suppliers. Only shortlisted suppliers will be invited to participate in stage two - the Invitation To Offer (ITO) stage.For detailed information please review the EOI.

title: MacGregor State School - Amenities Roof Replacement & Refurbishment (With Design Responsibility)
description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for tender submissions for the roof replacement and refurbishment of the existing Amenities Block at MacGregor State School, located at 370 McCullough St, Macgregor QLD 4109 as a part of the Targeted Maintenance Program (TMP).			The scope comprises of the design and construction of a new roof system and rainwater goods in addition to the refurbishment of the existing amenities block including asbestos removal, new floor finishes, cubicles, painting, fixtures and associated hydraulic and electrical works. All works are to be completed by the June 2021.			Tender submissions will be accepted from contractors that meet the following requirements:							Appropriate QBCC Builders licences to undertake the entire scope of works				Professional Indemnity Insurance to the value of $ 1,000,000.00						 			Please contact Adrian Watts – Project Manager on adrian@honeywill.com.au with your company details and tender documentation will be emailed to contractors.  Details of the site inspection will be advised in the email and letters to tenderers.			Covid-19 Safety precautions will be mandatory for site inspections.						Submissions close on Thursday, 22 April 2021 at 3:00pm.

title: Demolition of disused buildings  Nathan Depot
description: The Queensland Government is seeking Proposals for TMR03821 - Demolition of disused buildings at Nathan Depot. The Department of Transport and Main Roads requires an experienced and licenced Demolition Contractor to demolish and remove four disused buildings at the Nathan Depot.A mandatory site meeting will be held on site at 10.30am on Wednesday 14 April 2021 so potential contractors can develop some familiarity with the site conditions, building structures and site operations.You will need to contact CPO_Tenders@tmr.qld.gov.au to confirm attendance at the site visit.

title: CQUniversity Ultrasound Machine Fleet
description: Friday, 09 April, 2021CQUniversity would like to advise receipt of tender questions / clarifications. Please see responses provided in the attached Tender Clarification 01 - 09.04.2021 document as well as the revised Goods and Services Agreement document: 'Goods and Services - 09Apr2021 - v2.1.docx' which replaces the tender document 'Goods and Services - 18 Dec 2020.docx'.CQUniversity is seeking Proposals for Ultrasound Equipment. The Medical Sonography course at CQUniversity has a strong national reputation due to its quality graduates, excellent student experiences and strong linkages with industry partners. The four year Bachelor/Graduate Diploma course is accredited by the Australian Sonographers Accreditation Registry (ASAR). The unique feature of this course is the sonography simulation labs. CQUniversity’s current ultrasound systems are coming to their end of life at the completion of 2021. The fleet of 20 ultrasound systems are spread across five campuses being Mackay, Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. In the interest of student experience and equity, all machines on all campuses must be the same and also be highly regarded by the ultrasound industry to ensure smooth transition for students from simulation labs to the clinical environment. We are requesting the provision of a quote to supply the equipment described in the scope of requirements below. For detailed information on the specific goods / services sought under this tender, please review the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".

title: Design and Construct 1 x 4 Bedroom Detached House (General Standard) - TINGALPA 9 Solomon Crescent
description: Tenders please note:Included as part of the  Works for Tradies program (Program), the State of Queensland through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works (the Principal) invites you to submit an offer for project 88409DC2 - TINGALPA, 9 Solomon Crescent - Design and Construct 1 x 4 Bedroom Detached House (General Standard).This Program involves the construction of a number of  new social housing units of accommodation in key regions across Queensland, and is intended to boost housing supply, drive economic activity and support construction across Queensland, post COVID-19. Housing and Homeless Services (HSS) and QBuild are working together to deliver this Program.Mandatory Tender Requirement: One of the key objectives to be achieved through the delivery of this Program is maximising opportunities for locally based building contractors. To be eligible to tender on this project, it is a mandatory requirement for  tenderers  to have a physical office (through which the project will be delivered)  located within 125KM radius of project location.  Failure by a Tenderer to satisfy the above mandatory requirement may result in the Principal declining to accept the Tenderer's Tender.  For details of all mandatory tender requirements, please refer to the Conditions of Tender. Tenderers please note:Tender documentation for this project is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/ Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild eTender site.

title: Professional Support for Teaching Foundational Phonics Based Literacy
blurb: RFx ID: 24165163Organisation: Ministry of EducationOpen date: Tuesday, 6 April 2021 9:00 AM +12:00Close date: Monday, 10 May 2021 1:00 PM +12:00Categories: 86000000 - Education and Training ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Ministry of Education is seeking to appoint an organisation who has researched and can supply professional support and coordination across Aotearoa New Zealand, to teach foundational literacy based on current international research and best practice by equipping teachers to explicitly teach phonological awareness and support learners to transfer this to reading and writing. This will be incorporated into teachers’ current methods of teaching literacy. The system will have been trialled and evaluated in New Zealand and demonstrate that it works for a diverse range of learners.This will involve training for:a. School sector literacy specialists to enhance the support they provide for teachers and learners. Literacy specialists include, but are not limited to, Resource Teachers: Literacy, Resource Teachers: Literacy Māori, Resource Teachers: Learning and Behaviour, Learning and Support Co-ordinators, Kāhui Ako literacy leads.b. Teachers of foundational literacy New Entrants and Years 1 to 3. The aim is to increase expertise in teaching phonic based literacy teaching and learning across the sector with literacy specialists providing support for teachers to make sustained changes in teaching practice and for schools to make system level changes to teaching literacy. This will reduce the sector’s reliance on external experts.

title: Waikato - Building Capability to Employment Services
blurb: RFx ID: 24158146Organisation: Ministry of Social DevelopmentOpen date: Thursday, 1 April 2021 9:00 AM +13:00Close date: Monday, 3 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 93141500 - Social development and services93141800 - EmploymentRegion: WaikatoOverview: MSD is committed to reducing the number of working age people who need to rely on a benefit, as a means of improving economic independence and social wellbeing.  Through MSD, services are purchased to get the right support to assist people to prepare for, make the transition to, and stay in work.MSD seeks to engage providers to undertake delivery of the Building Capability to Employment programme in Waikato Region from July 2021 to 30 June 2026.The aim of the Building Capability to Employment Service is to assist clients who identify as Maori, or who are Sole Parents, or who have some type of health condition, including mental illnesses to prepare them for and achieve sustainable employment.The Ministry is looking for credible providers who have the capability, experience and infrastructure to deliver Building Capability to Employment Services in Waikato Communities. You will need to have a good track record in the management and implementation of related programmes and effective networks and strong relationships within their local community.You should have the ability to provide a service that addresses client’s individual needs and circumstances in order to support clients to move into sustainable employment as quickly as possible.The successful providers will demonstrate that they will provide further support to clients to enter and remain in employment.

title: Video Management System Transformation Project – Request for Information, Product Stream
blurb: The Department of Home Affairs is seeking further information from the market on capabilities and enhanced video management system functionality for future planning, design and specification purposes
description: The Department of Home Affairs (the Department) currently maintains an operational CCTV network of more than 6000 cameras at 119 sites across Australia. The CCTV network is central to operations and an essential business asset for the Australian Border Force (ABF) covering video surveillance across airports, seaports, international mail gateways, container examination facilities, district offices, the National Monitoring Centre (NMC), the Australian Border Operations Centre (ABOC), National Uniform Store, armouries, and other ABF sites. A core component of the Department’s operational CCTV network is the Video Management System (VMS). The VMS is central to the coordination, management, access, recording and supportability of the CCTV network. The Department is looking to have the VMS at the core of its video intelligence capability, and wherever practically possible, to maximise the use of automation, artificial intelligence and machine decision making to increase the effectiveness of officer operations in the field. The purpose of this RFI is to obtain market and product information from Respondents, as well as obtaining new information that will enable the Department to improve requirement definition, design and specification, and then subsequently seek responses from the market in a future request for tender process.

title: Evaluation and Support Services for ODA Procurement, Grant and Other Arrangements
blurb: Evaluation and Support Services for ODA Procurement, Grant and Other Arrangements
description: The Commonwealth of Australia, represented by the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (‘Department’), invites Individuals to tender for the provision of Evaluation and  Support Services for ODA (Official Development Assistance) Procurement, Grant, and Other Arrangements in accordance with this Request for Tender (RFT). Through this RFT the Department is seeking Individual experts that can primarily be a participating member or provide support to procurement evaluation committees and selection committees for grants and other financial arrangements. For procurement evaluation committees the Department typically has four voting members with two being independent. It is these roles the Department is primarily seeking to fill through this RFT. Independent evaluation committee members should, among other things, be able to critically evaluate tender responses in terms of the operational and commercial value and risk that they pose. To do so evaluators must be able to understand the complexities and risks in operating multimillion-dollar multiyear projects in resource constrained environments.

title: LAND4503Ph1 Armed Reconnaissance Helicopter Replacement Project – Planned procurement
blurb: Notice for the provision of Managing Contractor (MCC-1 2003) services for the Planning and Construction of buildings, services and infrastructure in connection with the proposed ‘Land4503Ph1 Armed Reconnaissance Helicopter Replacement Project'. The project is proposed to include works at Swartz Barracks, Oakey (QLD); Robertson Barracks, Darwin (NT) and Robertson Barracks Close Training Area, Darwin (NT).
description: Notice for the provision of Managing Contractor (MCC-1 2003) services for the Planning and Construction of buildings, services and infrastructure in connection with the proposed ‘Land4503Ph1 Armed Reconnaissance Helicopter Replacement Project’. The project is proposed to include works at Swartz Barracks, Oakey (QLD); Robertson Barracks, Darwin (NT) and Robertson Barracks Close Training Area, Darwin (NT). The prospective project scope includes but is not limited to: -1 Aviation Regiment (1 Avn) Robertson Barracks. Adapting and optimisation of current infrastructure and facilities to support he increased number and spatial requirements of the airframes under consideration. The works include a requirement to redevelop the apron, as well as increasing the footprint of two hangars. Additional scope is proposed to future proof the site by supporting Chinook (CH-47F) operations at the site. -Army Aviation Training Centre (AACnTC) Swartz Barracks, Oakey. Upgrade or rebuild of the infrastructure and facilities at AAcnTC -Training at Robertson Close Training Area (RCTA). Inclusion of a Forward Arming and Refuelling Point (FARP) including landing, refuelling and rearming facilities. -Temporary Facilities. Temporary facilities in the form of hangars, working accommodation and enabling infrastructure will facilitate the continuity of operations at 1 Avn Regt during the transition phase.

title: Emissions reduction program - Solar panels Installation at Moorabbin Hospital
description: Dear Tenderer(s)Monash Health seeks to engage a suitable contractor for the replacement for the installation of solar panels at Moorabbin Hospital in 2021The key deliverable of this tender is to provide a full turnkey solution which will include the installation of a grid-interactive solar photovoltaic (PV) embedded generating systems. The Installation of a 300 kWp embedded Solar PV system at the Monash Health Moorabbin Hospital site, including the capability for the inverter to automatically provide gross generation data to the environmental data management system.Scope:The key deliverable of this project is the completion of these works on time and within the allocated budget. Based on the complexity of the project it has been determined to appoint a single contractor to achieve the following objectives:	Timely completion of works	Ensure quality of works at each stage of the project	Manage the effort and risk relating to engagement of multiple contractors	Control project costFurther specifications for the scope of this tender are provided in Specification PDF document of the tender documents.

title: Transfer of captive ex-broodfish Cobia (Rachycentron canadum)
description: The Department of Agriculture and Fisheries (the Department) is seeking Expression of Interests from interested Aquaculture or Aquarium enterprises for the transfer of captive ex-broodfish Cobia (Rachycentron canadum).	There are 10 ex-broodfish Cobia available, including 6 males (5 – 20 kg, up to 118 cm in length) and 4 females (20 - 30 kg, up to 146 cm in length).  All fish are between 4-5 years old.	Successful bidder/s must organise and pay for logistics (removal and transport), relevant biosecurity tests, and any quarantining..	The ex-broodfish Cobia are not suitable for human consumption.	All fish are acclimated to indoor culture environments.	All fish are tame and feed from hand. Strong exhibition potential.	The Department acknowledges that all reasonable steps have been taken to ensure that the supplied Cobia are free from disease and in good health and are provided in good faith.	The successful bidder/s must have the necessary Aquaculture or relevant wildlife exhibitor licences (or prepared to obtain such a licence) to hold such species on their own premises.	The successful bidder/s will be required to enter into an “Agreement for the Transfer of Goods” with the Department before or on the date of removal.	The fish will need to be removed from the Department’s facility by COB 30 May 2021.	Bidders will need to complete the attached Bidders Declaration and questionnaire and the successful bidder/s will be selected based on your responses to those questions.

title: Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) Solution
description: Request No: 532828Name of Sourcing Activity: Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) SolutionCouncil Contact Officer: Stephanie HillBackground:Brisbane City Council is the largest local government in Australia in both population and budget. It is dedicated to ensuring Brisbane is a great place to live, providing leadership and good governance for the people of Brisbane and managing our resources effectively to support a city that is liveable, vibrant, accessible and sustainable.Council currently utilises a range of different tools to assist in the identification, administration and response to cyber security threats. Council is now turning to a Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) solution to help automate and modernise our cyber security posture. The Cybersecurity Operation Centre (CSOC) is responsible for cyber security strategy, management and service delivery. A SOAR solution will be used by the team to increase general productivity, efficiency, integration and consistency in their security operations centre.This Opportunity:Through an informal, non-binding process, Council is seeking:	information from the market in order to establish the availability of a SOAR solution that aligns with Council’s current and future security technology roadmap and the development of skills for the team that will be using it	to identify potential product and service offerings and to gain enhanced insights into our current plans and the value/benefits that your technology may offer	technology demonstrations from technology developers to showcase their solution and further assist Council to identify the appropriate SOAR technologies and to gain a greater understanding of the available options.Response Documents:Please find attached our Market Survey containing instructions for your participation. Please see the "Specification Documents" in "Section 3 - Here is the detail".Key Dates of the Activity: Date of release to market: 9 April 2021Closing date: 23 April 2021Return to:Please return the completed survey to the following email:  Stephanie.Hill@brisbane.qld.gov.auAll questions relating to this RFI must be directed to the Council Contact Officer. Questions posted on QTenders will not be addressed.

title: Supply of water monitoring sensors - Mount Oxide
description: PLEASE NOTE: a project brieifng session has been organised for Thursday, 22 April 2021 to answer your technical questions. The session will be held using MS Teams and we require your details (name and email) to register you. If you are intersted, please email AMUProcurement@resources.qld.gov.auThe department requires supply only of water quality monitoring sensors to replace existing legacy devices at remote abandoned mine sites in Queensland. This is the first stage of a wider project to upgrade monitoring and telemetry equipment at these sites. Future sensor purchases will likely be required as funding becomes available.Supply of water quality monitoring sensors (sondes) to meet or exceed the criteria below:	Mine pit water monitoring:			Monitored parameters to be a minimum of: water level (shallow depth range), pH, Electrical Conductivity and Temperature.		Suitable for long term unattended deployment in mine pits and other permanent water storages in an acidic water environment with pH down to 2.3 possible (pH 2.5 to 3.0 common), with potential for very high concentrations of sulfur, iron and other metal contaminants.		Additional ‘stand-alone’ water level devices may be considered to provide redundancy. This may include bubblers, ultrasonic, or any other type of water level sensor deemed suitable.		(initial purchase of 2 to 4 units expected)			Water course monitoring:			Monitored parameters to be a minimum of: water level (shallow depth range), Electrical Conductivity and Temperature.		Suitable for long term deployment in local ephemeral streams which may be dry for most of the year, subject to high ambient temperatures (40 to 50ºC) and potentially subject to acid water flows (pH > 3.0)		(initial purchase of 2 to 5 units expected)		Please note: delivery by no later than 15 June 2021 is required.For any queries, please contact Andrea Bell-Booth via AMUprocurement@resources.qld.gov.au.Addendum 1 issued 15 April 2021

blurb: The District Council of Ceduna (the Council) invites tenders from Tenderers for the purchase of Solar Jetty Lights and Poles and or the Supply and Installation of Solar Jetty Lights at the Denial Bay Jetty – Ceduna South Australia. title: Internal Audit of the Grants Management Office
blurb: The purpose of this internal audit is to provide an independent assessment of risk management processes, and review and evaluate the Grants Management Office's approach to acquitting funding for infrastructure projects delivered by NSW Councils.
description: Internal audit for Grants Management Office The purpose of this internal audit is to provide an independent assessment of risk management processes, and review and evaluate the Grants Management Office’s approach to acquitting infrastructure projects. This will require the consultant to conduct an independent review of one hundred infrastructure project acquittals, including supporting documentation and site visit reports. The consultant will also be required to review and evaluate the risk framework applied to projects. As this is the initial internal audit of acquittals conducted by the Grants Management Office, the scope will be refined during the engagement period. The consultant will draw on their demonstrated experience of providing audit, risk management, governance, financial analysis, acquittal or evaluation services to the NSW Government within the context of grants management. Essential criteria for this engagement include: • Full prequalification on the Performance and Management Services Scheme (SCM0005) under engagement type 6a Internal and External Audits • Insurances as stipulated in RFT – Part B Response Form • Compliance with NSW Procurement Policy Framework and other relevant policies to the supply of the Service Key deliverables for this project are: • Audit of one hundred SCCF infrastructure project acquittals • Evaluation of the risk framework performance • Draft and final reports including the analysis, findings, conclusions and recommendations of the internal audit • Meetings with RNSW staff to discuss audit inception, progress and findings RNSW believes a 6 – 8-week program is a suitable engagement duration.Internal audit for Grants Management Office The purpose of this internal audit is to provide an independent assessment of risk management processes, and review and evaluate the Grants Management Office’s approach to acquitting infrastructure projects. title: Alcohol and Other Drug Community Based Withdrawal Service
blurb: RFx ID: 24185695Organisation: Southern District Health BoardOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 8:00 AM +12:00Close date: Friday, 7 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 85000000 - Healthcare ServicesRegion: OtagoSouthlandOverview: The 2018 Report of the Government Inquiry into Mental Health and Addiction, He Ara Oranga, confirmed that alcohol and drug addiction recovery services around the country are under pressure, fragmented, uncoordinated and lacking consistency.In response, the Wellbeing Budget 2019 made mental health and addiction a top priority with $1.9 billion allocated over four years to mental health wellbeing. Southern DHB has been allocated funding for the provision of 1.6 FTE community-based withdrawal management nurses as part of this funding package.We are seeking proposals for the provision of a service covering the geographical areas of Invercargill, Southland District and Queenstown Lakes, these areas have been identified as high priority.

title: Wrap-around Support Services for Self-employment
blurb: RFx ID: 24189638Organisation: Ministry of Social DevelopmentOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Close date: Friday, 7 May 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Categories: 83000000 - Public Utilities and Public Sector Related Services86000000 - Education and Training ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The Ministry of Social Development helps New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent. Many New Zealanders are trapped in a cycle of benefit dependence because of intersecting factors that impede or prevent sustainable participation in the workforce. The Ministry is seeking to appoint a provider that will deliver a programme that can help MSD clients to develop their business skills. The programme will be targeting clients nationwide. This procurement relates to the delivery of a programme designed to support MSD clients who are seeking opportunities in self-employment.This is an opportunity to play a key role in supporting our clients in communities to help them develop and nurture their business ideas. The successful provider will be given a 12 month contract with a right of renewal over two years subject to programme performance.For more information please refer to the attached RFP document.

title: Wigan Street Trunk Main Upgrade - Stage 2
blurb: RFx ID: 24116540Organisation: Gore District CouncilOpen date: Wednesday, 31 March 2021 8:30 AM +13:00Close date: Friday, 7 May 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 83101500 - Water and sewer utilitiesRegion: SouthlandOverview: Following the February 2020 Floods, there were multiple collapses in the road above the DN1000 wastewater trunk main along Wigan Street (the pipeline). As a result of this event, the Council undertook an emergency project to renew 170m of the pipeline in 2020. However, the remaining 1.6km of this pipeline is in extremely poor condition requiring replacement in the short term. This project has been developed to address this problem.ScopeThe Scope of this contract is as described below: •	Upgrade ~DN1000mm concrete cast in-situ “egg shaped” Wastewater Trunk Main in Wigan Street, Gore.•	Renew DN150mm asbestos cement (AC) Watermain in Wigan Street, Gore.Description of the Contract WorksThe Contract Works shall comprise the works described within the various Tender Documents including without limitation:•	Supply and construction (replacement) of 800m DN900mm RCRRJ (microsilica) (or similar approved – through alternative tender submission) combined wastewater trunk main;•	Supply and construction of no. 6 DN1050mm RC MH risers, covers and lids;•	Construction of no. 1 DN1500mm RC MH, risers, cover and lid;•	Supply and construction (replacement) of no. 9 sumps/mud tanks incl. leads;•	Supply and construction (replacement) of no. 55 property laterals incl. rodding eye;•	Supply and construction of 980m DN180mm PE100 PN12.5 (SDR13.6) watermain;•	Supply and construction (replacement) of no. 55 property laterals incl. toby connection;•	Pavement and surfacing of trenched alignments through carriageway;•	Ancillary works; and•	Any associated road closures, diversions, or associated temporary works incl. over pumping.The above list summarises work that is included in the contract. It is provided for general information only and is not necessarily a complete list of all the requirements.The Contractor should note that descriptions of general and technical requirements above do not include numerous items of work, particularly minor items.

title: Rural Capacity Upgrade Programme
blurb: RFx ID: 24187927Organisation: Crown Infrastructure Partners LimitedOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 8:00 PM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 8 June 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Categories: 43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and TelecommunicationsRegion: New ZealandOverview: We are seeking Proposals to consider for funding solutions to address rural connectivity issues such as those that arose during the COVID-19 lockdown.  The specific focus is on increasing broadband capacity in rural areas that have experienced congestion and poor broadband experience or are likely to experience congestion in the short-to-medium term.  The Government Funding will be used to facilitate enhancement of broadband service to these under-served rural areas throughout New Zealand, including businesses, farms, marae, and households that are not within the footprint of the existing UFB and RBI2 initiatives, and who cannot currently access and will not be able to access, terrestrial broadband service at a speed greater than 20Mbps downstream and 3Mbps upstream after current planned market upgrades.

title: Longitudinal study of the impact of COVID-19 on people in Aotearoa New Zealand
blurb: RFx ID: 24192329Organisation: Ministry of HealthOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 3:00 PM +12:00Close date: Monday, 31 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 80000000 - Management and Business Professionals and Administrative Services81000000 - Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services85000000 - Healthcare Services86000000 - Education and Training ServicesRegion: AucklandBay of PlentyCanterburyChatham IslandsGisborneHawke's BayManawatu-WanganuiMarlboroughNelsonNorthlandOtagoSouthlandTaranakiTasmanWaikatoWellingtonWest CoastOverview: This Request for Proposal (RFP) is an invitation to suitably qualified Respondents to submit a Proposal for a longitudinal study of the impact of COVID-19 on people in Aotearoa New Zealand. This is an opportunity for a suitability qualified group of research providers to develop and lead a national multi-disciplinary longitudinal study of people in Aotearoa New Zealand with laboratory confirmed or probable COVID-19. The key objectives of this study are to improve our understanding of the short and long-term physical, psychological, and economic impacts of COVID-19 on affected people in Aotearoa New Zealand, and to highlight any equity issues faced by this cohort.The Ministry encourages a collaborative proposal by researchers who together have the credibility, connections and capability to design, lead and execute this important project.

title: PMM2020-08 Novel technologies to mitigate the risk of dolphin capture in inshore trawl fisheries
blurb: RFx ID: 24184729Organisation: Ministry for Primary IndustriesOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 9:30 AM +12:00Close date: Friday, 14 May 2021 2:00 PM +12:00Categories: 70000000 - Farming and Fishing and Forestry and Wildlife Contracting ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: The fisheries risk assessment used to inform the update of the Hector’s and Mauī dolphin Threat Management Plan (TMP) estimated that the risk to dolphins from trawl fisheries was low compared with set net fisheries (Roberts et al. 2019).  However in some locations in the South Island relatively high spatial overlap between dolphins and trawl fishing effort meant that trawl risk was not negligible, and in Mauī habitat there is a desire to ensure that residual risk effectively zero.  There is a need to better understand the way in which Hector’s dolphins interact with trawl vessels and fishing gear, to inform trawl risk mitigation options.  Currently there are trawl gear restrictions in place in some high-dolphin-density areas requiring that nets have a headline height less than 1 m, on the assumption that low-headline-height nets have a lower probability of capturing a dolphin.  This assumption is reasonable but the magnitude of any such effect on dolphin catchability has not been demonstrated empirically.  Other mitigation options may also prove useful, for example the use of real time proximity alarms, or acoustic deterrents to prevent dolphins from approaching or entering the net, but the effective design of any such options first requires that we understand how dolphins interact with the fishing gear, potentially leading to capture.
description: The fisheries risk assessment used to inform the update of the Hector’s and Mauī dolphin Threat Management Plan (TMP) estimated that the risk to dolphins from trawl fisheries was low compared with set net fisheries (Roberts et al. 2019).  However in some locations in the South Island relatively high spatial overlap between dolphins and trawl fishing effort meant that trawl risk was not negligible, and in Mauī habitat there is a desire to ensure that residual risk effectively zero.  There is a need to better understand the way in which Hector’s dolphins interact with trawl vessels and fishing gear, to inform trawl risk mitigation options.  Currently there are trawl gear restrictions in place in some high-dolphin-density areas requiring that nets have a headline height less than 1 m, on the assumption that low-headline-height nets have a lower probability of capturing a dolphin.  This assumption is reasonable but the magnitude of any such effect on dolphin catchability has not been demonstrated empirically.  Other mitigation options may also prove useful, for example the use of real time proximity alarms, or acoustic deterrents to prevent dolphins from approaching or entering the net, but the effective design of any such options first requires that we understand how dolphins interact with the fishing gear, potentially leading to capture.

title: Omokoroa Domain Playground Construction
blurb: RFx ID: 24186202Organisation: Western Bay of Plenty District CouncilOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 1:30 PM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 11 May 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72121400 - Specialized public building construction services72153100 - Athletic and recreational facility construction servicesRegion: Bay of PlentyOverview: Western Bay of Plenty District Council (Western Bay) wishes to procure an experienced contractor that is familiar with and experienced at implementing and project managing playground construction.  The contractor will be responsible for project managing & supervising all of the work required and will need to establish a good working relationship with Council staff.  Familiarity with NZ Playground Standards is important as is customer service skills as there is a high level of community interest in this project.  What’s important to Western Bay:•	Ability of the playground  to be easily maintained by our maintenance contractor  •	Our goal is to have the project completed in 2021. •	Suitability prepared site to ensure successful installation of equipment in a coastal environment•	Supplier experienced with the installation process and engagement with playground equipment suppliers. •	Installation to meets Council’s requirements as per this RFT and NZ legislation & Standards.  •	Retention and protection of existing natural environmentThe Contract Works at Omokoroa Domain Reserve, Omokoroa includes:•	Preparation to establish the works and site;•	Earthworks;•	Prepare and establish new Services (drainage, electrical, water etc);•	Modify existing carpark area;•	Construct new retaining walls, decking, edgings, features etc;•	Install playground equipment (including to NZS5828 - equipment supplied by the Principal);•	Source and install playground safety surfacing (including to NZS5828);•	Install park Barbeque Facility, Furniture etc (items supplied);•	Soft tree and landscape preparation, installation and finishing.•	New kerb and channel•	Pavement construction•	Footpath construction•	Vehicle crossing construction•	Stormwater drainageWestern Bay welcomes suitable contractors to bid for this contract.

title: SH73 / Weedons Ross Road Intersection Improvements. Pre- Implementation and Implementation
blurb: RFx ID: 24169676Organisation: New Zealand Transport Agency (Waka Kotahi)Open date: Wednesday, 7 April 2021 8:00 AM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 11 May 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72141000 - Highway and road construction servicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: This is a Professional Services contract for SH73 / Weedons Ross Road Intersection Improvements. Pre- Implementation and Implementation.NZ Transport Agency (NZTA) are proposing improvements to the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection in West Melton.  It is currently a priority cross-roads intersection with SH73 being the priority movement.  West Melton Road joins Weedons Ross Road 20m south of SH73 as a priority T-intersection.A Single Stage Business Case (SSBC) has investigated options and through consultation with the community and key stakeholders has proposed a solution for improving the efficiency and safety of this intersection.  The proposed solution provides for;•	signalising the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection.•	closing the West Melton Road/Weedons Ross Road intersection and terminating West Melton Road with a cul-de-sac.•	creating a new link road connecting West Melton Road to Weedons Ross Road opposite Kingsdowne Drive with a new roundabout, (approximately 275m south of the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection).•	creating a network of shared paths and footpaths.•	relocating, protecting, upgrading utilities within the project area including the SDC stockwater races. The purpose of this contract is to engage a consultant to take ownership of the project from the current stage of development and further develop this solution through design to construction completion.Electronic copies of the RFT documentation are attached to this advertisement.  All tender queries should be directed to the Tender Secretary by email:  christchurchtenders@nzta.govt.nz All responses to tender queries/clarifications will be answered by Notice to Tenderer which will be available in the GETS addenda.Tender submissions shall be uploaded to GETS eTender box in two separate files (pdf format plus EXCEL spreadsheet Schedule of Prices).The GETS file upload limit is 50MB.  The files should be labelled:•	File No 1 – 4346     Proposal excluding Price•	File No 2 - 4346     PriceTender submissions will only be accepted electronically via the GETS eTender Box.Tenderers should refer to the GETS website for instructions on uploading their tender submission files https://www.gets.govt.nz/SupplierUserTenderHelp.htm
description: This is a Professional Services contract for SH73 / Weedons Ross Road Intersection Improvements. Pre- Implementation and Implementation.NZ Transport Agency (NZTA) are proposing improvements to the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection in West Melton.  It is currently a priority cross-roads intersection with SH73 being the priority movement.  West Melton Road joins Weedons Ross Road 20m south of SH73 as a priority T-intersection.A Single Stage Business Case (SSBC) has investigated options and through consultation with the community and key stakeholders has proposed a solution for improving the efficiency and safety of this intersection.  The proposed solution provides for;•	signalising the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection.•	closing the West Melton Road/Weedons Ross Road intersection and terminating West Melton Road with a cul-de-sac.•	creating a new link road connecting West Melton Road to Weedons Ross Road opposite Kingsdowne Drive with a new roundabout, (approximately 275m south of the SH73/Weedons Ross Road intersection).•	creating a network of shared paths and footpaths.•	relocating, protecting, upgrading utilities within the project area including the SDC stockwater races. The purpose of this contract is to engage a consultant to take ownership of the project from the current stage of development and further develop this solution through design to construction completion.Electronic copies of the RFT documentation are attached to this advertisement.  All tender queries should be directed to the Tender Secretary by email:  christchurchtenders@nzta.govt.nz All responses to tender queries/clarifications will be answered by Notice to Tenderer which will be available in the GETS addenda.Tender submissions shall be uploaded to GETS eTender box in two separate files (pdf format plus EXCEL spreadsheet Schedule of Prices).The GETS file upload limit is 50MB.  The files should be labelled:•	File No 1 – 4346     Proposal excluding Price•	File No 2 - 4346     PriceTender submissions will only be accepted electronically via the GETS eTender Box.Tenderers should refer to the GETS website for instructions on uploading their tender submission files https://www.gets.govt.nz/SupplierUserTenderHelp.htm

blurb: A vendor agnostic tool that provides a single-pane-glass view for Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) of all the cloud workloads.
description: TfNSW needs a way to have visibility of the multiple tenancies in their AnyCloud platform to perform CSPM for policy violations and Incident Response investigations. AnyCloud provides a public cloud environment  on AWS and Azure direct to internal groups to control autonomously via the native consoles and API interfaces of the cloud provider, plus a series of Transport services to optionally enable integration with the rest of the cluster. This procurement will be evaluating a CSPM solution that will perform cloud visibility, risk management, security governance, security monitoring and investigation for incident responses on the AnyCloud platform. title: Pensioner Housing Grounds Maintenance
blurb: RFx ID: 24170217Organisation: Whangarei District CouncilOpen date: Thursday, 8 April 2021 8:00 AM +12:00Close date: Monday, 3 May 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 30121800 - Landscape architecture materials72102900 - Facility maintenance and repair servicesRegion: NorthlandOverview: Whangarei District Council (Council) is going to the market for:- Pensioner Housing Grounds MaintenanceThe process will be a two-staged open market process:- Registration of Interest (ROI)- Request for Proposal (RFP)This ROI is the first formal step in the process and is intended to be of minimal effort for respondents and allow the Council to create a short list of suppliers to invite to enter the RFP process.This procurement is for 3-year maintenance contract for all grounds at the Whangarei District Council’s 16 Pensioner Housing Villages. Currently a contractor maintains the grounds, these include:•	Lawn mowing,•	Litter removal,•	Weed management, •	Garden maintenance, •	Hedge and shrub maintenance and•	Any other ground works as required.Having an experienced team to maintain the grounds offers a number of benefits. These services reduce litter and unwanted landscaping debris while preserving the property and increasing visual appeal for residents and general public.The presence of litter on the grounds have a tendency to attract unwanted pests like rats and cockroaches along with scavengers like rats. These pests will wreak havoc on the interior and exterior of the pensioner villagers. Felled trees and hedges not only are unattractive safety risks to persons, but they can cause roof and siding damage when not attended to properly. Experienced grounds service staff can also help spot any potential hazards before they become major issues, making their services invaluable. A grounds maintenance service keeps the pensioner villagers looking tidy year-round. This helps promote positive reputation for the Council.

title: Identifying Regionally Significant Surf Breaks
blurb: RFx ID: 24185366Organisation: Environment CanterburyOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 70000000 - Farming and Fishing and Forestry and Wildlife Contracting Services77000000 - Environmental Services81000000 - Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services83000000 - Public Utilities and Public Sector Related ServicesRegion: CanterburyOverview: Environment Canterbury is embarking on a significant planning review programme that includes the Regional Policy Statement and the Regional Coastal Environment Plan. This procurement opportunity relates to obligations that Environment Canterbury has under the New Zealand Coastal Policy Statement (NZCPS) to protect the values of the regions significant surf breaks. This includes requirements under NZCPS Policy 2 to protect the rights of mana whenua, Policy 16 to protect surf breaks of national significance, Policy 13 for the perseveration of natural character and Policy 15 for the protection of natural features and landscapes. The Canterbury region has two surf breaks of national significance that have already been identified in the NZCPS, both located in Kaikōura – Mangamaunu and Meatworks. There has been no further work to identify other surf breaks in Canterbury that are significant on a regional scale. Environment Canterbury is seeking to undertake a significance assessment of all the surf breaks in Canterbury to inform the development of the regional planning framework. In order to develop a fit for purpose and responsive planning framework we also need to understand the potential threats to the regions significant surf breaks.

blurb: RFx ID: 24188000Organisation: Department of the Prime Minister and CabinetOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 8:00 AM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 4 May 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 86000000 - Education and Training ServicesRegion: New ZealandOverview: DPMC is a mid-sized agency of eight business units, with approximately 275 staff in Auckland, Wellington, and Christchurch. We have a unique role as the trusted advisor, leader, and steward of our system of executive government. Our purpose is to advance an ambitious, resilient and well-governed Aotearoa New Zealand. The strategic outcomes of this purpose are:	Outcome 1: The Government is enabled to deliver its priorities.	Outcome 2: Aotearoa New Zealand’s systems and institutions of executive government are trusted, effective and enhance our nation’s reputation.	Outcome 3: People living in Aotearoa New Zealand are, and feel, resilient, safe and secure.One of the most important responsibilities of any Government is to ensure the security and territorial integrity of the nation, including protecting the institutions that sustain confidence, good governance, and prosperity.  In order that this responsibility can be discharged, a Government requires its national security machinery to be well led, strategically focused, co-ordinated, cost-effective, accountable, geared to risk management, and responsive to any challenges that arise and to the needs of Ministers.  To achieve the expectations of Government, we are looking for an experienced supplier who can deliver a high quality national security sector professional development programme to government officials that underpins New Zealand’s national security system.This will be a unique opportunity for a supplier to enhance its brand by working alongside the government national security sector. There will also be opportunities for the selected supplier to leverage off this programme and we are open to consideration on how this could be achieved.

title: EXPRESSION OF INTEREST - RNGIM Main Civil Works
blurb: RFx ID: 24188020Organisation: KiwiRail GroupOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 8:00 AM +12:00Close date: Thursday, 29 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 22000000 - Building and Construction Machinery and Accessories30000000 - Structures and Building and Construction and Manufacturing Components and Supplies72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services78000000 - Transportation and Storage and Mail Services81000000 - Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services83000000 - Public Utilities and Public Sector Related Services95000000 - Land and Buildings and Structures and ThoroughfaresRegion: New ZealandOverview: KiwiRail, supported by Auckland Transport (AT), is looking to engage primary suppliers who will partner with them to deliver the main civil physical works as part of the Rail Network Growth Impact Management (RNGIM) programme. These suppliers will demonstrate a highly collaborative culture, agile systems, personnel and other resources. Innovation is highly prized, especially in helping KiwiRail find ways to deliver RNGIM within a tight three (3) year timeframe, i.e. “deliver more in less time”. Suppliers may be either from a single company, or from a lead contractor in a joint venture with other contractors.KiwiRail is seeking contracting team(s) who have a demonstrated track record in working well together, strong collaborative cultures working with clients and stakeholders to successfully deliver civil works packages for horizontal civil infrastructure. In addition the contracting team(s) will have robust company systems to plan and manage resources, and generally flat organisational structures that encourage agility and quick decisions.This includes demonstrating a commitment to Zero Harm and prioritising sustainability outcomes, while taking into account whole of life costs and the potential adverse impacts of both construction and operations.Tender ProcessThis EOI is an open process and all suppliers are invited to participate in this EOI stage. This EOI process is intended to ascertain and shortlist suppliers capable of responding to an in-depth Request of Proposal (RFP) process to select the preferred supplier(s) for this contract.Suppliers that do not engage in this EOI process will not be able to submit a response to the RFP for this contract.Indicative timeline:1) EOI in GETS: Response deadline: Thursday, 29 April 2021, 5:00 p.m.2) RFP to shortlisted Respondents TBCHow to apply:Please respond to the following the instructions included in this EOI following the stated requirements before 5:00pm on Thursday, 29 April 2021.Please specify a contact person for this tender (including email) and ensure that the contact person is registered under your company's supplier profile in GETS.If you want to comment on the proposed process please include your comments with your response.If you have questions regarding the registration process, please contact the contact person above.

title: More Jobs More Care - Phase One RFP
blurb: More Jobs More Care (MJMC) - Phase One is a NSW Government initiative with a regional focus that includes a range of services such as values based recruitment, accreditation fee waivers, training, job matching and mentoring.
description: MJMC is a NSW Government initiative to support the care sector to invest in, train, and retain new care sector workers. MJMC Phase One seeks to support potential workers consider the care sector as viable career opportunity with a range of services to support their entry into the sector through training and skill development.By providing a service that supports a new worker through recruitment, accreditation and training, MJMC Phase One also seeks to support services providers find the right staff for their organisation and clients, and support a more stable disability sector workforce.

title: Procurement of a main building contractor to create a breakout area between two classrooms at Ngakonui Valley School
blurb: RFx ID: 24159546Organisation: Ministry of Education - School InfrastructureOpen date: Wednesday, 7 April 2021 9:00 AM +12:00Close date: Monday, 3 May 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance ServicesRegion: WaikatoOverview: The Contract Works required are: The proposal is to create a breakout area that can be used by the two teaching spaces, and to better utilise and incorporate the existing veranda / deck, toilet, and cloak areas.Create a breakout area between the two classrooms. Approximate size of new breakout area 38.5m2. Involves a building extension of approximately 36.5m2.New roofing and design will be required.Relocate the existing wet area in Block I to the new breakout area (can be used by both classrooms).Relocate the existing pupil’s toilets (provide self-contained toilets x2). MOE preference would be to have an external door access.Install new glazed aluminium stacker doors (or similar) between the two teaching spaces and new breakout area. Allowing easy access between spaces, good vision, and flexibility. Lighting - Replace the existing older T8 fluorescents with new LED fittings complete with diffusers.RCD protection - The existing distribution boards have no RCD's or the RCD's they have do not meet current standards. Provide RCD to meet the latest Ministry of Education Electrical Installations Standard for Schools.Underfloor insulation - There is currently no underfloor insulation. Provide Expol (or similar) underfloor insulation.The existing classrooms are in good condition with good carpet floor coverings, Autex Composition lining to walls surfaces, and acoustic ceilings.Heat pumps are approximately seven years old - noted for replacement in the second 5YA period. Noted that the exterior cladding of Block H appears to be an asbestos material. Asbestos testing will be necessary, and if positive, an asbestos managementplan will be required.Blocks H & I will then become the "middle school".Refer to attached preliminary concept floor plan. This is a general outline of the project, subject to preliminary and final architectural design.

title: Widening of King Georges Road (A3) between Forest Road and Stoney Creek Road
blurb: Registrations of Interest (ROI) are invited from pre-qualified contractors with Transport for NSW under the National Prequalification Scheme at R4 and F50, for the widening of King Georges Road from Stoney Creek Road, Beverly Hills to Forest Road, Hurstville for about 1.4 kilometres to create three lanes in each direction.  Widening will be carried out along the western side of King Georges Road for about 1.1 kilometres (north of Forest Road to south of Young Street); and along the eastern side of King Georges Road for about 300 metres (north of Dudley Street to north of Warwick Street).A briefing will be held at 11am on Thursday 15 April 2021 via Microsoft Teams.The successful tenderer will be selected through a two phase procurement process.  The first phase requires applicants to submit this ROI.  A short list of applicants will then be selected from this ROI process and invited to tender for the work.All applicants must comply with the NSW Government Procurement Policy Framework (NSW Framework), NSW Government Supplier Code of Conduct (NSW Code) and New South Wales Industrial Relations Guidelines: Building and Construction Procurement (NSW Guidelines).Copies of the NSW Framework and NSW Code are available at www.procurepoint.nsw.gov.au.  The NSW Guidelines are available at www.industrialrelations.nsw.gov.au.This project is jointly/fully funded by the Australian Government.The Code for the Tendering and Performance of Building Work 2016 applies to this project.  This document is available at https://www.legislation.gov.au/Details/F2019C00289.  By submitting an ROI for this project you will become subject to the Code for the Tendering and Performance of Building Work 2016.It is a requirement for this project that the successful contractor be accredited under the Australian Government Work Health and Safety Accreditation Scheme (the Scheme) at the time of entering into the contract for ‘building work' for the Project and must maintain accreditation under the Scheme while the ‘building work' is being carried out.  Information on the Scheme is available on the Australian Government website at www.fsc.gov.au.

title: Coffs Harbour Boat Ramp Upgrade - Stage 1
blurb: Transport for NSW is seeking Tenders for construction of the Coffs Harbour Boat Ramp Upgrade - Stage 1.
description: Transport for NSW is seeking Tenders for construction of the Coffs Harbour Boat Ramp Upgrade - Stage 1.Transport for NSW is seeking Tenders for construction of the Coffs Harbour Boat Ramp Upgrade - Stage 1. The Works will contribute towards the achievement of the Project Objective by undertaking the following works: ·       Extension of the existing breakwater further north by approximately 75m·       ·               ·       Widening of the existing boat ramp, including topping slab over the existing ramp surface and additional ramp width to provide two extra lanes for vessel launching·       ·               ·       Supply and installation of additional pontoons and supporting piles·       ·               ·       Construction of scour protection works within the boat ramp basin·       ·              Construction of scour protection works within the boat ramp basin ·       Ongoing dredging of the boat ramp entrance area as required to maintain a navigable entrance during the works·       ·               ·       Dredging of the entrance channel and boat ramp basin to provide a suitable bed level for the upgraded boat ramp facility·       ·               ·       Transport of dredged material to Park Beach and placement for beach nourishment purposes.·       ·

title: Management Framework for Marine Biodiversity
blurb: RFx ID: 24185458Organisation: Environment CanterburyOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 70000000 - Farming and Fishing and Forestry and Wildlife Contracting Services77000000 - Environmental ServicesRegion: CanterburyOverview: What we need:•	An overview and analysis of the current framework for managing marine biodiversity and ecosystems, summarised in a well-written, well-illustrated and concise report. What we don’t want:•	Full details of all the management tools.•	Recommendations about the role of regional councils in managing marine biodiversity and ecosystemsWhat’s important to us:•	We want to fully understand the current management regime in this complex and changing area, before we explore the options for our regional policy and planning documents. •	We want clear identification of the gaps in the current framework (if any).Why you should bid•	This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the knowledge and information basis that will underpin the Regional Council’s development of the regional planning framework. •	This is an opportunity to demonstrate strong policy analysis skills, in an area that is likely to be of wider interest to central and local government.

title: Development of Water Use Manual
blurb: RFx ID: 24182635Organisation: Environment CanterburyOpen date: Thursday, 8 April 2021 1:00 PM +12:00Close date: Friday, 30 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 77000000 - Environmental Services81000000 - Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services83000000 - Public Utilities and Public Sector Related Services95000000 - Land and Buildings and Structures and ThoroughfaresRegion: CanterburyOverview: •	What we needEnvironment Canterbury is seeking to build on and extend the scope of its existing Water Use Data Management Guidelines to provide the technical knowledge and writing skills to develop and subsequent publication of a Water Use Manual, that can be utilised by Consent Holders, Service Providers and Environment Canterbury Staff•	What we don’t wantEnvironment Canterbury is not seeking the development of tools or technology to manage water use data, nor any infrastructure development manage water use data.•	What’s important to us.Given the detailed nature of the requirements, and the need to be aligned with National and Industry standards, we are seeking a supplier with significant understanding of water use data within New Zealand, with practical and demonstrable knowledge of the following:•	“water engineering”, irrigation design and water measurement technical expertise •	understanding of consents, consents planning and associated processes •	background in compliance monitoring and/or RMA investigations •	high-level of systems thinking and (business) analytical experience. •	Why should you bid?You have proven experience of producing technical documentation of this nature, that is available for consumption both by technical experts and the general public, along with understanding the legislative requirements re documents / information packs of this nature.

title: On-Bus Announcement System
blurb: RFx ID: 24167401Organisation: Greater Wellington Regional CouncilOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 10:00 AM +12:00Close date: Wednesday, 19 May 2021 12:00 PM +12:00Categories: 43000000 - Information Technology Broadcasting and TelecommunicationsRegion: WellingtonOverview: Greater Wellington Regional Council (GWRC) is seeking request for proposal (RFP) from suitably qualified and credible providers, to provide the hardware, software and content required to implement and maintain an on-bus next stop announcement system to a portion of GWRC’s Wellington-based bus fleet.This initial procurement is for deployment on up to 240 of GWRC’s 386 buses, with the remainder to be done in future.  A full region-wide implementation of a system is ultimately required, therefore this project provides the opportunity for further implementation upon successful completion of this procurement. The intent of the On-Bus Next Stop Announcements project is to improve the customer experience for bus users by providing more accessible journey information through on-board bus announcements. The project scope is restricted to audio and visual information, with a primary focus on people with visual impairments.GWRC will be looking for providers with the following attributes for this project:•	a strong track record and broad range of experience with transport-based systems, and particularly customer information systems•	the ability to deliver on a methodology that balances innovation, risk and complexity•	the ability to develop tools that have the functionality to support current challenges and the flexibility to adapt to future challenges•	local presence, with strong New Zealand base and international expertise•	a willingness to work in an open, honest and collaborative manner•	the desire to build capability within the client team and across the sector.Note: GWRC issued an Advance Notice on 22 Dec 2020 relating to this RFP.  Supplier Questions Please submit all questions via this GETS tender

title: Rural report for District Plan review
blurb: RFx ID: 24192962Organisation: Kaipara District CouncilOpen date: Monday, 12 April 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Close date: Friday, 23 April 2021 5:00 PM +12:00Categories: 70130000 - Land and soil preparation and management and protection77000000 - Environmental ServicesRegion: NorthlandOverview: Kaipara District Council is located in Te Taitokerau, Northland. We are a relatively small Council, with roughly 25,000 residents spanning both the east and west coasts. We have many rural and coastal communities. We are also the fastest growing region in Te Taitokerau Northland. Some areas of our district have experienced over 30% increase in population within the last 10 years. Te Roroa and Te Uri o Hau are our Mana Whenua partners whose rohe overlap with Kaipara District.   A report needs to prepared for the District Plan Review which addresses Kaipara District’s rural zoning and provides suitable information that can support Council’s section 32 RMA evaluation.

title: Mahi Anamata - Relocation Logistics Management
blurb: RFx ID: 24185294Organisation: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and TradeOpen date: Friday, 9 April 2021 1:30 PM +12:00Close date: Tuesday, 20 April 2021 4:00 PM +12:00Categories: 72000000 - Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services80000000 - Management and Business Professionals and Administrative ServicesRegion: WellingtonOverview: MFAT of Foreign Trade and Affairs (MFAT) is inviting Registrations of Interest from suitably qualified and experienced Suppliers to  scope, plan and execute a sequence of relocations, both within building as well as removal of furnishings out of the building) to support a fit out upgrade programme in MFAT’s Head Office. The Mahi Anamata project will deliver a change in office layout for 10 floors of MFAT’s head office in HSBC Building, Wellington. Each floor will need to be vacated temporarily to allow the works to occur. This will need to happen in a phased approach where displaced staff need to be accommodated at other floor levels. All of this work needs to occur with and within tight space, time, security, storage and other limitations or restrictions. The programme of works is not yet confirmed, but likely to occur between late June and mid-November.MFAT is looking for a supplier who can test (and improve where needed) the feasibility of MFAT’s phased approach to relocations, scope the work, which will include liaising directly with all MFAT as well as external stakeholders, such as:-	Managers or representatives of affected business divisions (people being relocated. i.e. almost all of approx. 800 MFAT staff in the building)-	construction and furniture suppliers-	Fit out Project manager (The Building Intelligence Group)-	MFAT security and suppliers-	IT staff-	Facilities Management staff-	Records and Archives staff-	Procurement advisor-	Communication manager-	Change manager-	Relocations Company (to be procured)-	and of course the MFAT internal project teamMFAT is not looking for relocation services in this tender. The successful supplier would be ineligible to bid for the relocations work when it is openly tendered.

title: Sustainable Household Scheme Management Services
description: The Environment, Planning and Sustainable Development Directorate (EPSDD) is responsible for the management of the Sustainable Household Scheme Management Services (the Scheme) which is one of several Climate Action initiatives funded in the 2020-21 budget. The Scheme was originally announced during the 2020 election and its realisation is a high priority for the Territory Government. The zero interest loans available under the Scheme have attracted significant interest from the community and loans delivery is subject to tight deadlines and high levels of oversight. This tender seeks to engage a qualified and experienced Service Provider to manage and administer the Scheme.

title: QRWQP Designing for the Future Independent Review
description: The Department of Environment and Science (DES) is seeking offers for an independent review as follows:The Office of the Great Barrier Reef (OGBR) is seeking to evaluate aspects of the Queensland Reef Water Quality Program (QRWQP) investments to identify improvements and look towards the value proposition and options for continued investment and delivery models for QRWQP, its program partners and the agriculture sector.  The objective of this project is to:	Through evaluation, provide an evidence base that can inform future QRWQP design.	Identify the success factors or key components that could be continued or enhanced.	Identify the barriers and potential strategies for more effective program delivery, monitoring and evaluation. For detailed information on the specific services sought under this tender, please review the attached Request for Quote and Contract Details.

title: PIMPAMA, 85 FAIRBOURNE TCE & 3 NEWBURY ST
description: Tenders please note:Included as part of the  Works for Tradies program (Program), the State of Queensland through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works (the Principal) invites you to submit an offer for project 88434/438 - PIMPAMA, 85 FAIRBOURNE TCE & 3 NEWBURY ST - Design and Construct 1 x 4 Bedroom Detached House (General Standard) and 1 x 3 Bedroom Detached House (General Standard).This Program involves the construction of a number of  new social housing units of accommodation in key regions across Queensland, and is intended to boost housing supply, drive economic activity and support construction across Queensland, post COVID-19. Housing and Homeless Services (HSS) and QBuild are working together to deliver this Program.Mandatory Tender Requirement: One of the key objectives to be achieved through the delivery of this Program is maximising opportunities for locally based building contractors. To be eligible to tender on this project, it is a mandatory requirement for  tenderers  to have a physical office (through which the project will be delivered)  located within 125KM radius of project location.  Failure by a Tenderer to satisfy the above mandatory requirement may result in the Principal declining to accept the Tenderer's Tender.  For details of all mandatory tender requirements, please refer to the Conditions of Tender. Tenderers please note:Tender documentation for this project is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/ Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild eTender site.

title: Integrated Management System Software
description: Port of Townsville (the Port) is responsible for port operations at Townsville and Lucinda as well as pilotage services at Abbot Point.  The Port is seeking software for its Integrated Management System (IMS) to manage its regulatory obligations, risks, audits, actions and event (incident) management in accordance with International and Australian standards.Specifically, the standards to be managed within the IMS are:	ISO 31000 – Risk Management	ISO 9001 - Quality Management System;	ISO 45001 - Occupational Health & Safety Management System;	ISO 14001 - Environmental Management System; and	ISO 27001 - Information Security Management System.The Port has issued this Invitation to Offer with the objectives of:	Obtaining software for its IMS system:			that is a commercial off the shelf system with a modern UI design, ease of use, and ability to use in the office and field without sacrificing functionality;		that is a fully digital system allowing both Port and third party access to remove the need for paper based workflow;		that enables standardisation of IMS functionality e.g. recording an incident across all Port operations and Standards;		that moves the Port from a compliance viewpoint to an assurance based approach;		that uses appropriate levels of notification to staff to allow them to manage IMS based workload without overwhelming them;		that recognises the Port is a Head of Power and has obligation and condition management requirements specific to that Power; and		that provides best practice processes out of the box.			Obtaining implementation services to ensure the IMS system is operational in a timely, functional and cost effective manner;	Obtaining a supplier that can act as a partner and provide experience based guidance on best practices with a view to improving Port’s processes.The Port’s preference is delivery of IMS solution(s) via Software as a Service.  The Port will also consider Hosted and On Premise solutions.Closing date and time -  Offers must be lodged by 1:00 pm Australian Eastern Standard Time on Friday April 30th, 2021 via QTenders https://qtenders.hpw.qld.gov.au/qtenders/Indicative timetable - Indicative timetable (subject to change)	Invitation issued -  Wednesday 31st March, 2021.	Briefing Session - Wednesday 7th April, 2021.			​Briefing session - The Port will hold a briefing session at 9:30am (Qld Time), Wednesday 7th April via Microsoft Teams. It is NOT mandatory for Suppliers to attend the briefing session in order to submit an offer.				A maximum of two representatives from each supplier can attend the briefing, with names and contact details provided via tenderlodgements@townsville-port.com.au by 12:00pm (AEST Time), Tuesday 6th April, 2021.					Closing date for questions - Wednesday 14th April, 2021.	Closing date and time for offers - 1:00 pm (AEST Time) Friday 30th April, 2021.	Intended completion date for shortlisting of Suppliers - Friday 14th May, 2021.	System demonstration by shortlisted suppliers - Monday 24th May – Friday 4th June 2021.	Intended completion date for evaluation - Friday 18th June, 2021.	Intended date for formal notification of successful Supplier - Friday 25th June, 2021.	Intended implementation period - Monday August 2nd  – Friday 26th November, 2021.

title: WESTCOURT, 8-10 CREEDY STREET - 7x1 Bedroom Units - PQC Level 2
description: Tenderers please note: Services: Design and Construct The Queensland Government through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works, invites suitably qualified contractors to submit an offer for: 7x1 Bedroom Units at 8-10 Creedy St, Westcourt. Eligible Contractors are required to have a minimum Prequalification (PQC) System Level 2 and must have an office located in the FNQ region. Where a PQC Level is stated, the Principal is not obliged to provide tender documents, consider or accept a tender unless the tenderer is appropriately registered under the Queensland Government's PQC System for the PQC Level required (or higher). Tender documentation is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild eTender site. The tender close date is Wednesday 5th May 2021 at 14:00pm AEST.

title: Work for Tradies Program  - INALA, 115 Inala Avenue - 1x4-bedroom detached house (General standard)
description: Included as part of the  Works for Tradies program (Program), the State of Queensland through QBuild, a business unit of the Department of Energy and Public Works (the Principal) invites you to submit an offer for project 2DC88612 INALA, 115 Inala Avenue - 1x4-bedroom detached house (General standard).This Program involves the construction of a number of  new social housing units of accommodation in key regions across Queensland, and is intended to boost housing supply, drive economic activity and support construction across Queensland, post COVID-19. Housing and Homeless Services (HSS) and QBuild are working together to deliver this Program.Mandatory Tender Requirement: One of the key objectives to be achieved through the delivery of this Program is maximising opportunities for locally based building contractors. To be eligible to tender on this project, it is a mandatory requirement for  tenderers  to have a physical office (through which the project will be delivered)  located within 125KM radius of project location.  Failure by a Tenderer to satisfy the above mandatory requirement may result in the Principal declining to accept the Tenderer's Tender.  For details of all mandatory tender requirements, please refer to the Conditions of Tender.Tenderers please note:Tender documentation for this project is available from the eTender website at https://etender.hpw.qld.gov.au/ Submissions are to be electronic via the QBuild eTender site.
