description: Preferred Supplier Panel (PSP) for the provision of Groceries, Dairy and BeveragesThis ITO will seek to appoint Suppliers to a PSP for Groceries, Dairy and Beverages in the following Categories and Sub-Categories.									Category									Sub-Categories													Grocery Products									Dry Goods			Biscuits; baking mixes and supplies; flour and milled products; soups; stocks; powders; packaged desserts; savoury snacks; confectionary; nuts; grains; legumes; jelly; spreads; jams; preserves; sugar; sweetener; dry pasta; rice; noodles; cereals; oats; porridge; pulses; seasoning; dried herbs; spices; sauces; dressing; canned goods; vinegar; condiments; dried fruit; dried vegetables; fruit cups pureed fruit.													Frozen Goods			Meat; poultry; fish and seafood; vegetables; fruit; pies; pastries; cakes; generic prepared frozen meals; muffins; desserts, ice cream (and diary free ice cream with protein min of 3 g per 100g) and convenience foods													Miscellaneous  			Packaged (chilled or dry) smallgoods such as sliced meats, fats and oils; butter; margarine; eggs and egg products; tofu; hommus.													Dairy Products									All milk products (such as white milk; flavoured milk; specialty milks (soy, Ultra-high treatment and lactose free milk); long life milk; powdered milk; evaporated milk; condensed milk; buttermilk); yoghurt; custard; cream; sour cream; cheese													Beverages									Tea; coffee; chocolate powders; juice; cordial; spring water; soft drink; sports drinks.						The following Categories of ‘Groceries, Dairy and Beverages’ are specifically excluded from this ITO:	Fresh Food (Vegetable, Meat and Bread Products)	Texture modified foods	Prepared meals for Therapeutic Diet Requirements of Texture Modified Diets	Thickened fluids	Kitchen ConsumablesWe have prepared a general presentation which is available to view on the Business Queensland Website.https://www.business.qld.gov.au/running-business/marketing-sales/tendering/supply-queensland-government/buying-categories/preferred-supplier-panel-groceries

title: RFT0354 - Sealing Andersen & Henry St Brooloo
description: Invitation to Tender No. RFT0354RFT0354 - Sealing – Andersen & Henry St BroolooTenders are invited to establish an AS2124 contract for the reconstruction and sealing of Andersen and Henry Streets, Brooloo. The works generally include: Lopping and chipping of trees/ vegetation within the footprint of the works Formation earthworks Removal of existing stormwater pipe on Henry Street at Anderson Street intersection Installation of cross road pipe culvert A 150mm pavement overlay of the in-situ subgrade Reinstate existing property accesses Full with cutback bitumen primerseal Full width single/single spray seal Installation of signage and road edge guide posts Temporary erosion and sediment control treatments, during and following construction Temporary Traffic Management Site clean-up and demobilisation.Documents are available from the VendorPanel website at https://www.vendorpanel.com.au/gympie/tendersTenderers must be registered with the VendorPanel site to be able to download documents, request information and submit a Tender.Suitably endorsed Tenders close at the below website address at 2pm on 28 April 2021. In accordance with s228(8) of the Local Government Regulation 2012 (Regulation), Council may decide not to accept any tenders it receives.In accordance with s288(9) of the Regulation any accepted tender must be the one deemed most advantageous to Council. It is noted that the lowest price tender may not be the most advantageous.All Tenders must be submitted via the VendorPanel Website https://www.vendorpanel.com.au/gympie/tenders

description: The Department of Education (DoE) is calling for tender submissions for the construction of a New Flexible Learning AreaBuilding at Tullawong State High School, located at 22-70 Del Rosso Rd, Caboolture QLD 4510.The new building contains 2 Classrooms, an office, a data room, a withdrawal room, a lifeskills classroom, a PWD Amenities, astaff amenities, a staff PWD Amenities, a student amenities, a cleaners store and a covered outdoor learning area. The positionof the building is at the front of the school with limited site access and working space. description: FCNSW requires a qualified and suitable Civil contractor to carry out major earthworks to re-align and widen on Carrollina & Willagalong Roads, which are both existing unsealed roads to facilitate B-double trucks. title: Positive Behaviour Support Skills Development Program

description: icare has undertaken a comprehensive project to improve service delivery and quality of life outcomes for people with challenging behaviour secondary to traumatic brain injury across the past 5 years. An on-going service gap is the number of skilled and experienced positive behaviour support (PBS) practitioners available to participants of the Lifetime Care and Support Scheme and the Workers Care program.As a next step in this process, icare plans to issue an open market Request for Proposal (RFP) to solicit proposals from suitable Service Providers with the appropriate levels of skill, qualifications and experience to deliver the Positive Behaviour Support Skills Development program to icare practitioners with the aim of increasing the number and skillset of PBS Practitioners who can work people with challenging behaviour secondary to traumatic brain injury and specifically within the Lifetime Care & Workers Care programs.

title: Provision ofGNSS Field Survey Kits
blurb: Geoscience Australia (GA) maintains a pool of geodetic quality Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) Field Survey Kits that are made available to the Australian research community to better understand the geophysical structure of the Australian continent.This opportunity exists to upgrade and modernise the equipment pool over the next five years. Under this opportunity, GA expects to be able to rely on a single supplier to provide up to 10 GNSS Survey Field Kits a year over the next 5 years as described below.If requested, the Tender must be able to provide access to test equipment to assist the evaluation of their response. All test equipment will be returned to the tender once evaluation has been completed.

title: Gas Chromatography Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometry
blurb: Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometer (GC-QQQ) system
description: National Measurement Institue (NMI) requires a fully integrated Gas Chromatography – Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometer (GC-QQQ) system for the routine analysis of environmental, pharmaceutical, agricultural and food samples. The successful tenderer must include delivery, full installation, commissioning and training for a minimum of 4 analysts over a 3 day period. The system must be capable of operating on a standard 240 V, 10 or 15 Amp power supply.

title: Freight Consignment Information Systems use
blurb: The Department seeks a supplier to investigate, collect and report details of freight consignment information systems in use across Australian freight and logistics supply chains.
description: Information technology and electronic data are increasingly important to the efficient and effective operation of freight supply chains and meeting Australia’s growing freight task more safely and efficiently. The purpose of the proposed Freight Consignment Information System Use in Australia procurement is to compile an information base about freight consignment systems currently in use across a range of different freight supply chain sectors in Australia. The information sought includes details of existing data standards and data exchange protocols, the extent to which data is currently exchanged electronically between supply chain partners and the importance of real-time data exchange to supply chain participants across different industry supply chains. The compilation of this information will provide for the first time an overview of freight consignment information system use across Australian freight supply chains.

title: Species Expert Assessment Plans (SEAPs) Project
blurb: Request for Tender for species and ecological communities Species Expert Assessment Plans (SEAPs) in response to the 2019-20 bushfiresRequest for Tender for species and ecological communities Species Expert Assessment Plans (SEAPs) in response to the 2019-20 bushfires
description: As part of the Australian Government’s bushfire response the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment is seeking to engage Service Providers to deliver a number of Species Expert Assessment Plans (SEAPs) for species and ecological communities. This includes; the assessment of identified groups of species and / or ecological communities for threatened listing status against Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999 (EPBC Act) criteria and IUCN guidelines where relevant, and development of listing assessments and conservation advices.The groups include:•Freshwater fish•Freshwater turtles•Plants•Lizards and snakes•Terrestrial mammals•Frogs•Rainforests and wet forests of south-east AustraliaThis project will accelerate listing assessments and improve the currency of EPBC Act lists. Service Providers are to deliver listing assessments and conservation advices that meet EPBC Act requirements for review by the Threatened Species Scientific Committee and advice to the Minister for the Environment

The carpark will create 89 carpark spaces for the Main Works construction workforce during the Memorial’s Development Project.  The Project is referred to as the Campbell High School Carpark.Tenderers should note that the reference to AWM000609 is to be taken as referring to this RFT number AWM000510.In agreement with and on behalf of the ACT Education Directorate, the Memorial is undertaking the construction of a permanent surface level carpark located to the north-east of the Campbell High School site, adjacent to the Memorial. The carpark will create 89 carpark spaces, to be temporarily leased to the Memorial for a three year period. During this period, the carpark will be utilised by the Main Works construction workforce, before being returned to Campbell High School as a permanent asset.Further details of the Requirement are set out in the Statement of Requirement included as Schedule 1 – Statement of Requirement of the RFT.

title: Carbon Market Expert
blurb: The Clean Energy Regulator is seeking a carbon market expert to undertake user research into the makeup of the carbon market, including capturing who the players are, the different commercial models and how these models might develop in the future, in particular, how they would respond to the development of an exchange traded market.
description: The Clean Energy Regulator is seeking a carbon market expert to undertake user research into the makeup of the carbon market, including capturing who the players are, the different commercial models and how these models might develop in the future, in particular, how they would respond to the development of an exchange traded market.What we need:We want someone wo knows, or who can get access to, allthe players in the carbon market. We want to understand what carbon market players need to grow the market, understand the scope of innovation that we might see as part of the future carbon market and identify potential risks to, or arising from the existence of an exchange platform.You will have commercial insights to the business models, be able to bring understanding of the types of engagements that will occur and can provide a path to manage any conflicts or potential conflicts as they may be industry players. If currently in the market, you must be able to engage across the market broadly. If you currently operate outside the carbon market, you will need to demonstrate ability to understand and access all segments across the whole marketIdentify all different players in the carbon marketSupplyDemand (including businesses and state and territory government)Different intermediariesDifferent business models of the playersInterview and harvest of information from CER staffKnowledge that we haveMap out all the different players in the carbon market(Must include their own model if they are in the space). Visual product describing interactions between market players or alternative product (by agreement) describing the market players and interactions Run workshops with different segmentsWhat needs do the different players/segments want out of the new carbon marketIdeas for innovations on how the new market could operateRisks/concerns arising from the existence of an exchange platformWorkshop design including questions and approachWorkshop events – delivered in appropriate formats i.e. face to face or online

title: Current and potential costs of diseases and invertebrate pests in Australian grains
blurb: Current and potential costs of diseases and invertebrate pests in Australian grains
description: This investment will estimate the economic impacts of pests and diseases across crops and grain growing regions. It will provide an indication of the scale of losses to be minimised to protect potential yield. It will inform on how these impacts may have changed since the previous loss assessments. The process will seek opportunities to incorporate measures of adoption of RDE to quantify to impacts of GRDC investment. This investment proposal considers diseases and pests KIT outcomes 3.3.3 (disease) and 3.4.1 (pests). The previous reports are: The Current and Potential Costs from Diseases of Wheat in Australia 2009; The Current and Potential Costs from Diseases of Barley in Australia 2009; The Current and Potential Costs from Diseases of Oilseed crops in Australia 2011; The Current and Potential Costs from Diseases of Pulse crops in Australia 2011; The Current and Potential Costs of Invertebrate pests in grain crops in Australia 2013. GRDC can provide the successful applicant with access to some specific data sets, being majority GRDC crop type, crop hectares, yields, resistance rating mix of regional production and financial data by ABS SA2 to assist with the analyses.

blurb: This RFT seeks to address the software selection, installation and configuration of a mail utility through the services of a Services Provider for the Modernising Business Registers (MBR) Business Inbox Solution.
description: As part of the Modernising Business Registers (MBR) Second Pass Business Case scope, the ATO is delivering a business inbox and notifications service that will provide users with a secure digital destination for government agencies to deliver correspondence to a business entity. This service will provide a single business mailbox per registered business entity that will enable individuals to easily access and action mail delivered to their business mailbox. The service will manage an inbox user’s preferences, roles, permissions and their relationships with a business and their transactions to enable the community of business users to be informed and up to date with their obligations and entitlements. This service is also designed to be extensible for other government agencies in the future.

title: Notification to industry for RFT JLC20-001 in the 4th quarter of FY 2020/2021
blurb: Pre-notification of RFT release for Global Freight and Customs Clearance Services to the ADF.
description: As per the Defence Annual Procurement Plan (APP) JLC20-01, the Commonwealth was planning to release a single-stage Open tender approach to market in the 4th quarter of FY 2019/2020 for the provision of Global Freight and Customs Clearance Services to the ADF (JLC20-001) from a single prime contractor. As a result of the industry disruption caused by COVID-19, the Commonwealth notified industry of a 12 month delay to the release of the single-stage open tender approach to market (AusTender reference: JLC20-001-Notice1 published 26 May 20).After consultation with industry via an RFI (ATM ID: JLC20-001-RFI) the Commonwealth considers that risks inherent to an open tender for Global Freight and Customs Clearance Services can now be managed and that such a process is likely to result in a value for money procurement outcome. Accordingly, the Commonwealth plans to release a single-stage open tender approach to market via AusTender in the fourth quarter of FY 2020/2021 to replace the current GFF contract. An industry brief will be conducted in Melbourne shortly after the release of the open tender. The details in relation to the conduct of the industry brief will be included within the open tender.

title: Croajingolong Coastal Wilderness Walk – Concept Plan and Feasibility Assessment
description: Parks Victoria seeks tenders to develop a concept plan and feasibility assessment for future government investment in a multi-day experience centred on the Croajingolong coastline in East Gippsland.This work will review the opportunities with regard to economic, social, cultural, environmental and related analysis, engage with the visitor economy sector, and culminate in a concept and feasibility assessment. This assessment will factor in operational planning and management of risks, to strategically justify future investment required. While considering the strategic opportunities, the assessment needs to also identify potential immediate measures that could be the basis for investment.The Department of Jobs, Precincts and Regions (DJPR), including Regional Development Victoria, is a key funding stakeholder with significant interest in the strategic direction for the project and is partnering with Parks Victoria to deliver this work.The concept plan and feasibility assessment for the Croajingalong Coastal Wilderness Walk project will holistically scope and market test a multiday experience. This should critically review activities that, combined, may form a ‘product’ such as hiking, canoeing, touring, and the setting of the Point Hicks Light Station. The feasibility assessment will identify the feasibility, market demand, business model and impact assessment for new experiences to determine a future operating model as a basis for further investment. Additionally, the project will identify a portion of early works that can be progressed to delivery stage, enabling part of the project to be ready to support Victoria’s economic recovery with further investment.

title: Docklands Media Precinct - Expression of Interest
description: The Victorian Government is please to offer to market the following opportunity:	A long-term leasehold interest;	The business opportunity associated with Docklands Studios Melbourne;	Six purpose-built sound stages with a combined capacity of approximately 10,000 sqm, including a new $46 million Sound Stage 6 (slated for completion in late 2021);	Ancillary annexes and facilities, including a new three level annex and refurbished mess hall;	A 6,170 sqm workshop and ancillary office building with eight bays of varying sizes for set and props construction, costume and storage; and	The 6.4 hectare DSM site which includes land fronting Docklands Drive that is well positioned to facilitate built form DMP related development.Alternatively, respondents may consider only the development opportunity fronting Docklands Drive, including the development of a new workshop and its air rights.The State recognises that the market may adopt different approaches to the opportunity. Therefore, it is incumbent on Respondents to convince the State of the merits of their proposal.Respondents are encouraged to present an innovative value proposition that responds to the State’s Vision and Objectives and demonstrates clear intent to maintain DSM as a world class film studio capable of attracting large local and international productions. Strategies for achieving operational objectives may include working with the existing Studios operator, or acquiring the operational rights of the DSM business.Under either scenario, it is imperative that the value proposition is clearly articulated. Respondents are encouraged to consider any development and partnership opportunities beyond the DSM site which would further advance Government's objectives for the precinct.

title: MFEP- Vegetation Management 2021/22 to 2025/26
description: Vegetation Management is undertaken throughout Melbourne Region to maintain & improve fuelbreak, and to prepare areas for planned burning. These works are undertaken to ensure the safety of the fire fighters by removing hazardous trees, hanging branches, exposed rocks and stumps from fuelbreaks. Also complex hazardous trees removal from areas identified for planned burning, and broad hectare mulching to help manage fuel loads.This procurement is for schedule of rates for various machines and personnel required to undertake vegetation management works. The tender has been separated into five (5) portions based on location of parks and the type of landscape e.g. forest, grasslands. Details of the separable portions can be found in Schedule 12 and with maps available as a separate document on Tender Vic website.This contract will be for a total of five (5) years and structured as a 3 year contract with 2 x one year options.As the works associated with this tender is dependant on outside factors (e.g. weather effects creating more hazardous trees, number of planned burns affect how many burns need works undertaken the following year), there is no guarantee on the amount of work to be approved each year. Some years many have a significant amount of works, while other years they may have minimal work, or no work, for some portions.

title: MFEP- Fuelbreak Slashing 2021/22 to 2025/26
description: Fuelbreak Slashing is undertaken by the Melbourne Fire & Emergency Program (MFEP) throughout Melbourne Region to reduce grass height on fuelbreaks prior to the peak fire season. Fuelbreak are slashed between November to February (depending on location and curing rate of grass) with each fuelbreak being slashed at least once. Some second cuts may be required depending on grass growth and the fire season.Various machines are used in order to undertake the slashing due to the natural environment where the fuelbreaks are located and uneven/sloping fuelbreaks.This procurement is for schedule of rates for various machines required to undertake fuelbreak slashing.  The tender has been separated into five (5) portions based on location of parks and the type of landscape e.g. forest, grasslands. Details of the separable portions can be found in Schedule 12 and with maps available as a separate document on Tender Vic website.This contract will be for a total of five (5) years and structured as a 3 year contract with 2 x one year options.Note that while the amount of fuelbreaks to be slashed is relatively consistent, there will be variations each year dependant on growth rates/winter growth, changes to fire priorities, additional/removal of parks requiring slashing, and requirements for second cuts.

The work involves interfacing and reworking of existing assets, thus attendance at the tender briefing is strongly recommended prior to preparing a submission.Questions during the tender period are encouraged and can be directed to the Principal via the official tender publication on the Tenders VIC website.

andWestern Sydney (500 ha, 15 km perimeter); andWestern Sydney (500 ha, 15 km perimeter); andYathong Nature Reserve, near Cobar in Central West NSW (40,000 ha, 105 km perimeter).Yathong Nature Reserve, near Cobar in Central West NSW (40,000 ha, 105 km perimeter).Yathong Nature Reserve, near Cobar in Central West NSW (40,000 ha, 105 km perimeter).    The final location for the western Sydney and South Coast sites will be advised following further assessment and consultation with local stakeholders.The final location for the western Sydney and South Coast sites will be advised following further assessment and consultation with local stakeholders.    The project will facilitate the reintroduction of threatened and declining animal species and restoration of ecosystem function and processes.The project will facilitate the reintroduction of threatened and declining animal species and restoration of ecosystem function and processes.

title: Request for QuoteThe Excellence in Smoking Cessation Training, Education & Resources (ESTER) Project – Development of Smoking Cessation Training
blurb: A priority for the Cancer Institute NSW (the Institute) is to reduce the use of tobacco, including by embedding smoking cessation interventions as routine practice in health services. The Excellence in Smoking Cessation Training, Education and Resources (ESTER) project aims to improve access, uptake and quality of smoking cessation training in NSW through the implementation of the NSW Smoking Cessation Training Plan: Building workforce capabilities in NSW 2021-2023 (the Plan). The four key strategies within the Plan are:• Provide leadership and establish governance structures• Develop training standards• Develop training to address workforce needs• Strengthen training system enablers.The scope of this RFQ is to develop high-quality training for health professionals and community sector workers who play a critical role in delivering smoking cessation interventions. This will include standard modules suitable for all health professionals and community workers, and tailored modules for those working in specific clinical services or with priority groups.Training required includes competency-based smoking cessation e-learning and face-to-face/webinar-based training packages that include curriculum outlines, lesson plans, PowerPoint slides, participant workbooks, video resources, knowledge and practical assessment guidelines and tools. Training will be aligned to the NSW Standard and will address identified gaps in training quality and access, build workforce capabilities across the state, and establish training pathways to support different intervention delivery levels and meet the needs of people who smoke.

title: Market Sounding for Patient Entertainment (SWSLHD)
blurb: South Western Sydney Local Health District (SWSLHD) are undertaking this market sounding in order to obtain feedback on Patient Entertainment options prior to undertaking a formal approach to market. At the conclusion of market sounding, SWSLHD intend to develop a statement of requirements that incorporates industry feedback in respect to the feasibility of the procurement activity, the capability of the market, the existence of a competitive market and the capacity of the market to meet the requirements. The objective of this document is to communicate SWSLHD's requirements and expectations in respect to Patient Entertainment Systems and solutions for use in SWSLHD facilities nominated. The Respondent acknowledges and agrees that the SWSLHD will not be liable to the Respondent for any costs or expenses incurred by the Respondent as a result of its participation in this market sounding exercise, including where no procurement activity follows the market sounding.

title: Battery Opportunities (Large and Small Scale) Market Sounding
blurb: Current and future capabilities, contracting models and trends in the large and small scale battery market.
description: Current and future capabilities, contracting models and trends in the large and small scale battery market.Sydney Trains is undertaking a portfolio based approach to managing their energy cost and emissions, and is interested in understanding current and future market capabilities in the arena of battery technology, including both large and small scale opportunities.Specific focus areas include what providers are doing in the battery market to bring these opportunities to their customers to assist with the overall management of their energy portfolio. With a focus on cost,  environmental outcomes and current & future contracting methodologies.Participants are invited to confirm their interest in participating by sending an email to the following:Matthew.woodland@transport.nsw.gov.au and shelley.lister@transport.nsw.gov.au. Upon receipt of email confirming interest further instructions will be provided.

title: EOIArgyll Estate Renewal Project
blurb: Builders, developers and community housing providers are invited to express their interest in participating in a housing renewal project in Coffs Harbour, in partnership with the NSW Land and Housing Corporation and the Aboriginal Housing Office.
description: Builders, developers and community housing providers are invited to express their interest in participating in a housing renewal project in Coffs Harbour, in partnership with the NSW Land and Housing Corporation (LAHC) and the Aboriginal Housing Office (AHO).LAHC and AHO are seeking a partner to explore how infill medium density housing development could increase housing supply and diversity, and accelerate the renewal and revitalisation of the Argyll Estate in Coffs Harbour.

title: School Dental Program Mobile Diagnostic Imaging Solution - VNA
description: The school dental program will implement a mobile diagnostic image management solution.  The solution will support the acquisition, viewing (manipulate & annotate), reviewing (onsite and remote), transmission, storage, archival, sharing and reporting of digital imaging and radiographs from any treatment location required by the School Dental Program.  The solution will be vendor-neutral and capable of handling various media from a range of clinical digital radiology acquisition technologies from different vendors (including Intraoral X-ray, Phosphor plate X-ray, digital sensor, Digital Panoramic X-ray, Cephalometric X-ray and Cone Beam computed tomography) modalities.  The mobile diagnostic imaging solution will interface with DHSV’s existing Patient Management system, Titanium, currently accessed via a Citrix published application.The Mobile Diagnostic Imaging Solution will be delivered via two procurements. This tender for Image management including Vendor Neutral Archive (VNA) and viewing system.  A separate tender #180 Mobile Diagnostic Imaging – Digital Modalities for the dental image acquisition modalities.DHSV is aware there are many models for the delivery of a mobile diagnostic imaging solution.  Only submissions with multiple submissions will be considered.  The approaches that are currently under consideration include:	Capital purchase (hardware & software)	Software only (hardware provided by DHSV)	Managed service (annual operating cost)	Solution as a service (SaaS)DHSV can procure hardware from Victorian State government contracts and registers, however, if specific hardware is recommended for the solution, cost estimates for the hardware is required for the solution.The functional and non-functional requirements for the tender are outlined for response within Attachment 2 Tender Specifications Spreadsheet.  The respondent is required to complete and submit this excel spreadsheet as part of their tender submission. All costs associated with any offerings should be detailed in the Attachment 5 Pricing Schedule.  Pricing to be expressed in Australian dollars and be exclusive of GST, the pricing breakdown should separate out: 	Total project implementation cost (including systems integration)	One-time hardware cost, 	Hardware maintenance and support costs, (include the hardware refresh cycle and approximate cost of two refresh cycles)	One-time software acquisition cost including a clear explanation of the license rights and limitations of the license you are recommending 	Ongoing software maintenance and support costs or subscription cost, including a clear explanation of the license rights and limitations of the license you are recommending. It is expected that the respondents can demonstrate experience in implementing the proposed mobile diagnostic imaging solutions (or similar solutions) to meet the clinical and business needs of the school dental program.

title: LGBTIQ+ Homelessness Grants Program

The LGBTIQ+ Homelessness Support Service will be a partnership approach, enabling people to seek coordinated support at both homelessness entry points and services as well as at an LGBTIQ+ support organisation

title: Data & Analytics Platform
description: South East Water is one of Melbourne’s three state-owned metropolitan water retailers.  We provide water, sewerage, trade waste and recycled water services for residents and businesses in Melbourne’s south east, located in the state of Victoria, Australia.For further information regarding South East Water please visit www.southeastwater.com.au.South East Water is looking to appoint a suitable, qualified implementation partner to provide advanced Data and Analytics professional services for South East Water and its wholly owned subsidiary, iota Services Pty Ltd (iota).For the last three years, South East Water has been developing an end-to-end Digital Utility solution. This solution will introduce IOT device data to underpin business transactions and as a key source of data for an advanced Analytics capability. This Analytics capability will inform business decision making in the Digital Utility.More details can be found in the tender pack.

title: Victorian Spirit Beverage Services - CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park
description: Melbourne & Olympic Parks (M&OP) is Australia's heart of sports and entertainment. Welcoming more than 2.5 million people across hundreds of events annually, M&OP has long been the home of the most iconic and world-class event experiences Australia has to offer.Upon completion in September 2021, the Melbourne & Olympic Parks precinct will open its 5th venue: CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park, a premium conferences and events centre and public café space.  CENTREPIECE is positioned to be Melbourne’s most eventful and marvellous place and purposed to create memorable experiences that are like no other.The CENTREPIECE brand seeks to encapsulate the cultural magnetism of Melbourne, with menus influenced by the city’s vibrant culinary scene and featuring local craft beers, acclaimed wines, Melbourne’s famed small batch spirits and quintessential coffee. Melbourne & Olympic Parks is seeking invitee’s response to the invitation for the supply of goods and/or services as outlined in Part A.2.This Invitation is for the Victorian Spirits Beverage services for CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park.

title: Victorian Beer and Cider Services - CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park
description: Melbourne & Olympic Parks (M&OP) is Australia's heart of sports and entertainment. Welcoming more than 2.5 million people across hundreds of events annually, M&OP has long been the home of the most iconic and world-class event experiences Australia has to offer.Upon completion in September 2021, the Melbourne & Olympic Parks precinct will open its 5th venue: CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park, a premium conferences and events centre and public café space.  CENTREPIECE is positioned to be Melbourne’s most eventful and marvellous place and purposed to create memorable experiences that are like no other.The CENTREPIECE brand seeks to encapsulate the cultural magnetism of Melbourne, with menus influenced by the city’s vibrant culinary scene and featuring local craft beers, acclaimed wines, Melbourne’s famed small batch spirits and quintessential coffee. Melbourne & Olympic Parks is seeking invitee’s response to the invitation for the supply of goods and/or services as outlined in Part A.2.This Invitation is for the Beer and Cider Beverage services for CENTREPIECE at Melbourne Park.

title: Provision of Genetic Testing Services
description: The Royal Womens Hospital is seeking tender submission from suitably qualified providers for the Genetic Testing Services.

title: Wild Otways Intitiative - Integrated Monitoring Framework
description: The Corangamite Catchment Management Authority is seeking to engage the services of a suitably qualified supplier to design and deliver the The Wild Otways Initiative - Integrated Monitoring Framework (the Framework).The Framework will be developed by the selected provider in consultation with the CCMA, Australian Government, Wild Otways Initiative Project Steering Committee and other project partners and will be delivered under guidance of the CCMA from 2021 through to project completion in June 2023.The Framework will play a pivotal role in collating and analysing the research and monitoring outputs of five discreet Wild Otways Initiative sub-projects and help to communicate a clear and concise story about the outcomes, developments, learnings and legacy of the Initiative. The Corangamite CMA is seeking the services of an experienced project manager and project team with relevant expertise in environmental project monitoring and evaluation to deliver the Wild Otways Initiative - Integrated Monitoring Framework.

title: Great Ocean Road Coastal Trail (Fairhaven to Skenes Creek) Master Plan and Trail Planning and Design Report
description: Department of Environment, Land, Water and PlanningREQUEST FOR TENDER (RFT)(eTender)The Department of Environment, Land, Water and Planning is responsible for planning the Great Ocean Road Coastal Trail (Fairhaven to Skenes Creek) in partnership with Eastern Maar Aboriginal Corporation, Parks Victoria and the Great Ocean Authority and Colac-Otway Shire Council. The Department is seeking responses to this RFT for development of the Great Ocean Road Coastal Trail (Fairhaven to Skenes Creek) Master Plan and Trail Planning and Design Report. This RFT - CMS102427, is for the planning, oversight and completion of a Great Ocean Road Coastal Trail (Fairhaven to Skenes Creek) Master Plan and Trail Planning and Design Report. Request for Tender (RFT) for:            Great Ocean Road Coastal Trail (Fairhaven to Skenes Creek) Master Plan and Trail Planning and Design ReportTender/Reference number:                CMS102427Issue Date:                                            23 April 2021Place for lodgement:                           http://www.tenders.vic.gov.au (Buying for Victoria)Closing Time and Date:                      Thursday 20 May 2021 at 2:00 pm local timeProject Manager:                                 Evan LewisTelephone:                                           0427 524 228Email:                                                    evan.b.lewis@delwp.vic.gov.auPlease note:Tenderers are advised to register at the tender’s page of the Buying for Victoria Website (http://www.tenders.vic.gov.au) in order to receive any further information (including amendments, addenda, and further conditions) that may apply to this RFT.The Tenderer’s Response (RFT Part D) must be completed in the format specified and submitted electronically through the Tenders Website.Late Tenders will not be accepted.  Tenders submitted by facsimile or email will not be accepted.

title: Employee Assistance Program
description: WorkSafe Victoria is seeking to engage a suitably qualified organisation to provide an Employee Assistance Program and Case Management services for the employees of WorkSafe Victoria at all its sites and locations of work. Respondents must be able to offer face to face and telephone/online counselling options for employees. Respondents must also be able to provide telephone and online counselling services 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.WorkSafe is seeking responses for the delivery of these services from 1 September 2021, for an initial three year term, with the option for extension by two further years in one-year increments.

title: Port Campbell National Park – Facility Cleaning Services
description: The Port Campbell National Park, including the Twelve Apostles Visitor Site is a very significant tourist attraction, receiving approximatel two million visitors/year.   The site is the preferred destination for families, local tourists and international visitors.   Action is required to ensure that this experience is managed to ensure that people still value their visit even through the peak visitation period.The subject facility cleaning contract provides specific services at specifc locations.   Sites include the Port Campbell Public Toilet, Port Campbell Work Centre and the Twelve Apostles Visitor Site.   Works include rubbish removal and amenity cleaning on specified days and schedules.Important Notes:A mandatory meeting will be held at 1 pm at the Parks Victoria, Port Campbell Office, Monday 3rd May, 2021.   Contractors must RSVP for the mandatory meeting by COB Friday 30 April, 2021. Contractors may only send a maximum of  two representatives to the mandatory meeting.Questions regarding the specification must be received by email by COB 17 May 2021.Respondents are to lodge their tender responses marked CONFIDENTIAL, Tender #ITS2-00255 - Port Campbell National Park - Facility Cleaning Services by 5:00pm Monday 24 May 2021 in the electronic tender box on tenders.vic.gov.auThe lowest or any tender will not necessarily will not necessarily be accepted.

title: STEP DOWN BEDS
description: Formed in 1998, Barwon Health is the largest regional health service in the state of Victoria. With a catchment area outside of the Greater Geelong area that extends throughout south western Victoria, Barwon Health cares for a population in excess of 500,000. A broad spectrum of care is delivered, meeting the needs of the community at all stages of life and circumstance. The comprehensive range of services includes emergency and acute medicine, mental health, primary care, community services, residential aged care and sub-acute care and rehabilitation. Care is delivered across the region via a number of sites. The hospital precinct, dedicated primarily to acute care, education, training and research, encompasses the main University Hospital Geelong and immediate periphery locations in central Geelong. Sub-acute inpatient care and residential aged care is delivered from the McKellar Centre in North Geelong, with an additional residential aged care site in Charlemont. Community based care is delivered from numerous sites throughout the region, including in people’s homes. Barwon Health also operates from additional sites across the region to provide administrative services, providing support in the delivery of clinical care. There is high demand on health care services, driven by an increase in the size of the population, the ageing of the population, and the increase in the number of births each year. In 2018-19, Barwon Health reported 78,126 presentations at the Emergency Department, 21,847 operations and 87,004 inpatient separations. To support access and flow from bed based services, Barwon Health is seeking to partner with an agency, such as a supported residential service, for people transitioning out of hospital who are unable to live independently in the short term. The facility will only be used when there is a clear plan for returning home or to a bed based service for planned ongoing health care and/or rehabilitation.The aim of the service is to achieve a step down accommodation support service for patients deemed not suitable to be discharged home in the short term. The tender is being undertaken to improve the consumer experience, ensuring people are in the most appropriate care facility.

title: Provision of Budgeting & Forecasting Software Solution for Alfred Health
description: Alfred Health is seeking responses from suitably qualified suppliers to improve its Budgeting and Forecasting capabilities, along with variance analysis reporting for actual results. For this purpose, the health service intends to procure a Budget and Forecasting cloud based system to facilitate the business requirements to budget and forecast for future periods and report against the results, as the actual financial results are posted in General Ledger (GL) - usually when the period closes.Alfred Health is aiming to provide an integrated Budget and Forecasting which has the ability to provide automated transfer of datasets and files from GL and potentially Payroll to the new Budget and Forecast solution. The new solution must either be able to provide required Budget and Forecasting reporting and Monthly/Periodic Variance Analysis reporting or be able to be integrate output to a reporting tool such as Power BI or other integrated reporting solutions.NB. All communications during the tender period must done via Buying For Victoria Online Forum.

title: Digital Skills and Jobs Program - To establish a panel of Training Course Suppliers
description: DJPR is seeking to establish a Panel of training course suppliers with the capability and capacity to deliver high-quality courses that are respected by industry and that will enable participants to develop the job-ready skills required to transition into a digital career - in one or more of the following categories:	Web development	Programming/software development	Cybersecurity	Digital marketing, operations, support	UX/UI	Project (agile) management	Product management	Cloud	Data analytics	AI/machine learning.

title: Merbein Common and Kings Billabong track grading and capping
description: This project will assist in delivering riparian activities to meet the requirements of the Regional Catchment Strategy and Mallee Waterway Strategy.Kings Billabong Park and Merbein Common are popular recreational areas adjacent to Mildura Central and the Merbein Township respectively. These public land areas are used by members of the public for birdwatching, bushwalking, fishing, and camping. The area has suffered from vegetation disturbance, and erosion due to vehicle disturbance. As a result of this activity there is now a significant network of unofficial tracks throughout this landscape. maintaing key access roads will reduce impacts on these sensitive areas.

title: EDRMS Design and Implementation
description: The Goulburn Ovens Institute of Technical and Further Education (GOTAFE) is responsible for the provision of a range of education services.GOTAFE is now is seeking responses to this Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of an Electronic and Document Management System (EDRMS) as outlined in Part A.2 - Specifications of the request.The key objectives of the procurement are, but not limited to:	Integrated solution across GOTAFE Departments, Campuses, and Communities including a comprehensive and institute-wide approach which considers GOTAFE Strategy, Digital Strategy, Systems Architecture, and Integration with current systems.	Enhanced information security and compliance with privacy requirements	Strengthened document governance.	Curated content across the information lifecycle	Improved compliance with other regulatory requirements (corporate and educational)	Simplified access for users across a range of devices, locations, and roles	Improved document classification, interoperability, and retrieval, which may include assigning a unique identifier to each item of content (supporting GOTAFE's ability to access, share, and audit documents), and increased use of formal document classification.	Enhanced storage and archival capacity and capability	Streamlined digital workflows and approvals, and information exchange.	Reduced paper storge and handling costs	Improved Environmental footprint	Streamlined and Centrally stored and managed database.

title: Victorian Rural Generalist Program Training & Supervision Collaboration Project
description: Increasing supervision capacity of RG Trainees in distributed rural and remote communities.  Address barriers to accredited training for RG Trainees, with a focus on the PGY2 training year. This project will focus on supporting supervisors, general practices and small rural health services so that they can become accredited to supervise trainees across all stages of RG training in each of the training settings including general practice, urgent care and inpatient care as well as residential aged care.The previous bodies of work (Attachment 1-3) examined the health service capabilities in the distributed communities, including volume and case complexity. Along with this, to achieve accreditation, the next piece of work must explore the supervision elements required for trainees on the VRGP to work towards their RG2 training goals and beyond.It is important to map out the supervision requirements of the multiple options doctors of different characteristics and interests might pursue at this stage. These include being part of the following programs that articulate with the RG career pathway: PEP, IP, ACRRM, RVTS, RACGP, RJDTIF, MDRAP and PMCV.Secondly, it is critical to identify what sort of PGY2 step can be used most effectively, where and why based on the chances of accreditation and delivering high quality training. This includes reviewing the current PMCV accreditation requirements for PGY2 and how they can be maximised with alternative supervision arrangements. This also somewhat depends on considering the qualifications of doctors working in these locations, their credentialed specialties and interests in supervising.Finally, it is important to explore the barriers and enablers to implementing the various pathways and supervision options, so as to achieve the desired training.This project will be in partnership and collaboration across the following three regions as identified by The Department of Health:  Lodden Mallee, South West and Hume Regions.

title: Site Security Works
description: Goulburn Valley Health (GVH) is a public owned regional hospital located in Shepparton, Victoria as established under the Health Services Act 1988 (Vic). GVH is a multi-campus facility providing a broad range of hospital and community services throughout the Hume Region. The Shepparton campus, located at Graham Street Shepparton has 266 beds providing acute medical, surgical, obstetrics, paediatrics, rehabilitation, psychiatric and intensive coronary care.Following a security review, GVH is enhancing the site security in the south-east quadrant of the Graham Street campus. The scope of these works includes but is not limited to the following: 	Automated vehicular & manual pedestrian tubular security gates and associated access control.	2100H Pressed Spear tubular security fencing and 2100H Colorbond fencing.	CCTV and external lighting works.	Minor demolition, civil works and line marking.The successful Bidder will be responsible for coordinating & executing the above works as per the specified requirements.

title: Maketu Cemetery
blurb: RFx ID: 23910006Organisation: Western Bay of Plenty District CouncilOpen date: Friday, 29 January 2021 8:00 AM +13:00Close date: Tuesday, 2 March 2021 5:00 PM +13:00Categories: 72121400 - Specialized public building construction services72141100 - Infrastructure building and surfacing and paving services72141500 - Land preparation services72151900 - Masonry and stonework servicesRegion: Bay of PlentyOverview: Suitably qualified and experienced contractors are invited to tender for the construction of the burial expansion works at the existing Waherekau Maketu Cemetery. This project is a continuation of the existing burial site and comprises of traffic control, erosion and sediment controls, site set out, earthworks, concrete capped stone terrace retaining walls, concrete footings and walkways, concrete garden edging, continuation of the existing concrete access road, landscaping works, vegetated swales and precast stormwater soakage manholes, and as-builts.What we require: The bulk of the construction works requires cutting terraces into the ridge slopes of the proposed burial site to create new burial plots. These terraces shall be supported by concrete capped stone walls with concrete footing, to imitate the existing burial plots on the opposite side of the gully.A new concrete road is required as an extension to the existing concrete access road. The construction works includes stripping topsoil and earthworks, importing suitable base material and constructing a new concrete pavement to follow the natural slope of the existing ridge.Other construction works comprise the construction of concrete walkways for burial plots, concrete edging for the ash gardens, landscaping, and grassed swales along the northern and southern boundaries of the new site with the northern swale feeding into a soakage manhole.

title: WALK049228 Long-Term Lease & Development Opportunity - Council Land (Smith & Fuller Street Walkerville)
blurb: The Corporation of the Town of Walkerville (Council) invites Expressions of Interest from Registrants interested in entering into a long-term lease agreement over approximately 8,060m2 of Council owned land,  for the purpose of the incoming lessee investing in and developing the Site to:	maximise Site usage;	provide greater community access to, engagement with and use of the Site; and	address the capital and structural decline of the existing building(s) on the Site.The subject Site is located between Smith Street and Fuller Street Walkerville (refer REOI documentation for further information).While Council is of the position that the primary purpose of any development on the Site is to benefit the community, Council acknowledges that a commercial business / operation / activity may also be required to be established on the Site concurrently to ensure a redevelopment is feasible for all parties. Council is open to considering any proposal provided that any such commercial business / operation / activity is aligned with the envisaged uses of a Community Facilities Zone (namely the provision of a range of community, educational, recreational and health care facilities).This REOI is open between 27 April 2021 and 22 June 2021 (inclusive).

title: CTTG049201 Medium Density Residential Development: 13 Australia Avenue, Modbury
blurb: The City of Tea Tree Gully (the Council) invites development proposals via a two-stage tender process (the Tender Process) to develop land owned by the Council at 13 Australia Avenue, Modbury (the Site). The Site is approximately 130 metres x 33 metres set within a public reserve (Australia Reserve) with a 10 metre frontage to Australia Avenue for access purposes. The Council invites proposals for a two storey, medium density residential development at the Site (the Australia Avenue Development Project or the Project.)

title: Sandbox Appliance
blurb: Security Sandbox Solutions
description: Request for Information: ICT Security Sandbox solution proposals -1. Introduction The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade’s (DFAT) purpose is to help make Australia stronger, safer and more prosperous by promoting and protecting our interests internationally and contributing to global stability and economic growth.The department provides foreign, trade and development policy advice to the government. We work with other government agencies to ensure that Australia’s pursuit of its global, regional and bilateral interests is coordinated effectively.DFAT is the lead agency managing Australia’s international presence, operating a network of 115 overseas posts in five continents with over 2,900 staff located in Australia and an additional 3,300 personnel employed overseas.Information Communications and Technology (ICT) is critical to DFAT’s day-to-day business operation and with such a large and complex international network it is essential that DFAT maintains an efficient and secure network environment. It is essential that DFAT’s data holdings and ICT infrastructure are protected from information security threats and its systems are fit for purpose and comply with Commonwealth Government regulations.

title: SATC049216 2022-24 TA Beverage Services
blurb: The South Australian Tourism Commission is seekign a provessional service provider fo rthe provision of bar and beverage services associated with the Tasting Australia 2022 hub "Town Square" at Victoria Square.Please refer to the attached documents for further inforamtion.

title: COM049213 CC202114 Coastal Walkway Construction - Field River
blurb: The City of Marion Coastal Walkway spans from Marino to Hallett Cove.The Coastal Walkway Plan together with Council’s recently endorsed Asset Management Plan (available on council’s website) provides a renewal strategy that prioritises capital expenditure on renewal and replacement. This strategy is in accordance with Councils asset condition assessments and endorsed levels of service.The entire Coastal Walkway will be renewed over the course of the coming years in accordance with the Asset Management Plan, subject to funding.This project (Coastal Walkway Construction - Field River) is the first renewal of one of the elements of the Coastal Walkway, and involves constructing a robust and sustainable walkway using varying sustainable building materials to improve accessibility to a wider range of users and assist in protecting and enhancing valuable remnant vegetation through existing dunes and again, with sensitivity to the natural environment.Given the coastal location and environment, preservation of the natural assets of the coastal reserves is a key feature of its community value. Accordingly, coastal erosion, the stability of natural slopes, riparian features and the health of indigenous vegetation are key to ensure the walkway retains its integrity and its value to the community.The entire length of the corridor follows the coastline above the high-water mark through Coastal Areas as defined by the new SA Planning and Design Code. All land is either under the care, control and management of the City of Marion, or forms coastal conservation parks managed by Department for Environment and Water.

title: COO049250 Disposal and Processing of Street Sweeping & Catchment Materials
blurb: The City of Onkaparinga is the largest metropolitan council in SA with its size of 518.4km2. Stretching along a world class foreshore and a region of some of the biggest wine manufactures in the world.Our waste service team undertake routine sweeping of approximately 2,200 km of kerbing each year and dispose on average approximately 2,550 tonnes of material from sweeping.Our Civil Drainage team undertake and or contract the cleaning of GPT’s, trash racks and SEP each year and on average dispose of approximately 1,300 tonnes of material each year.This scope invites service providers to demonstrate their ability to assist in the disposal and processing of material collected from street sweeping, gross pollutant traps (GPT), trash racks and side entry pits (SEP) around the City of Onkaparinga.

title: COO049251 Green Organics Drop-Off Serivce
blurb: The City of Onkaparinga provides a free green organics drop off service to residents in addition to regular kerbside organics collections. Each residential property is entitled to one green organics pass each year.The service will be a “drop-off” service whereby residents transfer their garden organics to designated locations using their own means of transportation. This scope invites service providers to demonstrate their ability to assist in the delivery of a green organics drop off service to the residents of Onkaparinga.

title: SAFEC049221 Web Content Management System
blurb: SAFECOM, on behalf of the Emergency Services Sector (ESS), seeks to engage a sole supplier for the provision of a Web Content Management System (WCMS) and associated cloud infrastructure to support the various CFS, MFS, SES and SAFECOM websites, with support and maintenance for each.The primary objectives for this engagement include:	Delivery of public and private websites for the ESS, including but not limited to: 			SAFECOM;		SAFECOM Staff Intranet;		CFS;		CFS Volunteer Portal;		SES;		SES Volunteer Portal; and		MFS Staff Portal.			Migration of existing ESS websites into the new WCMS;	Provision of software support services for the WCMS; and	Provide cloud platform support for the WCMS.SAFECOM proposes a potential five (5) year contract term, consisting of:	Initial Term: Three (3) years	Extension Options: Two (2) x one (1) year.It is anticipated the Agreement will commence in July 2021.

They have prepared drawings and technical specification detailing the works to be undertaken by the Construction Contractor.

title: DHS049184 Linen and Laundry Services
blurb: The Department of Human Services, Disability Services division require a supplier for the provision of linen items and laundry services to the Northgate supported residential facility which houses approximately 30 high dependency residents. The Kurlana Tapa Youth Justice Centre also requires linen and laundry services for the Goldsborough Road campus. The Jonal Drive campus is currently closed, however the site representative may negotiate with the supplier on requirements for the campus upon request. A single supplier will be contracted to provide linen and laundry services to satisfy the requirements of both Disability Services and Kurlana Tapa. The Department of Human Services is seeking a quote based on the services outlined in the Specifications, included as Appendix 3.In addition to quality and value for money, this contract has been identified as an opportunity to deliver social outcomes and minimize environmental impact through the use of sustainable practices.

title: Regulatory Uniform and Corporate Attire for Agriculture Victoria
description: Agriculture Victoria wishes to engage a suitably skilled, experienced, qualified and reputable supplier of uniforms for the supply and delivery of:	Regulatory uniforms and/or	Corporate attireAgriculture Victoria has approximately 1200 staff located throughout Victoria who undertake regulatory, corporate and/or field-based tasks. The regulatory uniform is mandatory for the approximately 239 Authorised Officers in Agriculture Victoria. The wearing of corporate attire is voluntary, with approximately 316 current users. This procurement is being undertaken in accordance with the ‘Guide to procuring uniforms and personal protective equipment’ that requires government organisations to procure locally manufactured goods where available, accepting some items may need to be sourced off-shore.Suppliers must:	Meet or exceed the minimum expectations set out in the Victorian Government’s Supplier Code of Conduct.	Be listed on the Ethical Supplier Register (the register) prior to executing a contract to supply. To be on the register, suppliers of textiles, clothing and footwear sector uniforms and personal protective equipment manufactured in Australia must be accredited or in the process of seeking accreditation with Ethical Clothing Australia. Please refer to the Buying for Victoria website for more information. Those currently not on the register are encouraged to apply.                        Items currently include (but are not limited to): polo shirts, long and short sleeve patrol shirts, work shirts, shorts, trousers, pullovers, jackets and hats.Services and special requirements include:	Efficient and effective online ordering and approval, distribution and returns processes. 	Fittings provided for staff in regional locations.   	Distribution to office locations in metro and regional areas of Victoria.                    	Fit options for all genders.	Breathable fabrics.	Provide transparent maximum lead times and customer service plans.

title: Market sounding: Next generation ticketing system for Transport Canberra
description: Please do not submit an electronic response via Tenders ACT. Information on how to participate in the market sounding can be found below.Market sounding: Next generation ticketing system for Transport Canberra Thank you for your interest in the market sounding for the ACT’s next generation public transport ticketing system.  We are seeking advice from ticketing and real time passenger information system venders to inform the procurement planning for transitioning to a future transport fare collection system to replace the existing Canberra MyWay (ticketing) and NXTBUS (RTPI) systems.This is an exciting opportunity for interested industry wanting to deliver a ticketing system that is flexible, innovative, and able to meet the needs of Canberra’s growing public transport network.This market sounding will inform the design of the final procurement approach due out to market in mid-2021.Market sounding will be open until close of business 14 May 2021. Project OverviewThe Australian Capital Territory (ACT) is a self-governed territory in the south east of Australia. The only city in the ACT is Canberra, the capital of Australia with an estimated population of 445,000 as at 2021.The ACT Government, through Transport Canberra, is seeking advice from ticketing and real time passenger information system venders to inform its procurement planning for transitioning to a future transport fare collection system to replace the existing Canberra MyWay (ticketing) and Nxtbus (RTPI) systems. Transport Canberra is planning an open tender process commencing Mid 2021 with the view to have an operational system for 2023. Any information that you supply will help to inform procurement planning. Current systemThe current Canberra MyWay ticketing system is a contactless card-based system deployed on approximately 450 Canberra buses and 13 Light rail stations (soon to be 14 stations). There are no gated stations in the Canberra public transport system. MyWay processes approximately 15.6 million paid transactions each year. The system provides contactless card-based smartcard system and paper tickets. MyWay cards have a high rate of market penetration with over 93 percent of adult trips paid for using a MyWay card.Characteristics of possible new systemNext generation ticketing is being delivered in many cities across the world and includes the use of easy to use, account-based technology that allows users to manage and pay for their travel from their mobile device or credit card. COVID-19 has provided Transport Canberra with a unique opportunity to accelerate a cashless ticketing system.  Given the forced implementation under the current pandemic environment we have revised the scope to remove the requirement for providers to accommodate cash transactions, allowing the Territory to move to 100% cashless public transport system as well as a future focussed cost effective state of the art ticketing solution.The envisioned system will support Transport Canberra’s multi modal transport network that includes bus and light rail. It is also planned to leverage MaaS (Mobility as a Service) opportunities to enhance connectivity and accessibility to a broad range of users included disadvantaged groups through platforms which enable integration with a range of other services, integrated and simpler journey planning, and more targeted service provision in the future.The procurement project will include replacement of the current back office with an account based, open architecture system and real time communications that facilitates open loop payments such as mobile ticketing and the use of credit / debit cards. The vendor will be required to provide core operational ticketing services over the service term and to supply tokens in an appropriate format. In addition to ticketing, Transport Canberra is seeking to incorporate a real time passenger information system into any future ticketing system to enable commuters to plan and pay for their journey within the same platform. Transport Canberra foresee innovation in RTPI system technology that enables greater flexibility to manage its operational networks with data rich network performance reporting tools.Transport Canberra provide a broad range of customer concessions and free travel. It is intended that the new solution will facilitate the concessionary needs of our vulnerable Canberran’s whilst providing opportunities to improve the accessibility of public transport to those who most need it. How can I get involved?To participate in the market sounding you are invited to complete the survey questions provided below.This will allow us to test assumptions of the market prior to commencing the formal procurement process.  On completion of the survey you will be invited to provide your business contact details. Transport Canberra will contact you if there is a need to clarify any of the answers you have provided.You can complete the survey here https://www.transport.act.gov.au/tickets-and-myway/register-your-interestUSEFUL LINKS 	2020 ACT Transport Strategy	2020-21 ACT Budget Papers	More information about Transport Canberra	Zero Emission Transition Plan for Transport Canberra

These processes will be specified in the documentation released through the RFT stage.The evaluation criteria to be used for the RFT will be provided at the time of release of the RFT together with the form of contract proposed for the subsequent contract. title: School Dental Program Mobile Diagnostic Imaging - Digital Modality
description: To support the acquisition, display, transmission, storage and management of dental X-ray images, there are two procurements, one for the management, and storage of the images Tender 179 Mobile Diagnostic Imaging – VNA Solution and this one for the acquisition, display and forwarding of dental images to the Vendor Neutral Archive.The acquisition of the image via phosphor plate technology is the preferred radiography system for the School Dental Program in the short term, however in the longer term a transition to digital sensor technology and/or combination of both technologies may occur.  DHSV is seeking to identify preferred suppliers of phosphor plate and digital sensor technology and a bill of materials inclusive of hardware, software, consumables, system integration, training and support. DHSV intends to procure the digital imaging acquisition technology from a preferred supplier/s within a six to nine month timeframe.Respondents are invited to submit solutions for both phosphor plate and digital sensor technology based on the requirements outlined in Attachment 2 Tender specifications.  The respondent is required to complete and submit this excel spreadsheet as part of their submission. Note: The initial roll out will be with phosphor plate and phosphor plate reader technology. The following options for image acquisition and display of the image will be considered:	X-ray scanning unit	Image display software	X-ray acquisition (phosphor plates and digital sensors) and image display software	X-ray scanning unit and X-ray acquisition and image display software

title: KDC049185 T3/2021 Septic Tank Desludging and Disposal Services
blurb: The Kingston District Council invites tenders for the provision of septic tank desludging and disposal services, as well as additional support/ad hoc works.The tender comprises of two (2) parts, which may be awarded as one (1) contract or in part to separate tenderers:Section 1:  Desludging of Septic Tanks and Disposal of Associated Sludge/Bio-SolidsThe services comprise of the labour, plant, tools, equipment, mobilization and all associated requirements (including the disposal of associated sludge) for the desludging of septic tanks at approximately 900 properties on the Community Wastewater Management System (CWMS) in the township of Kingston, on a 4-year rotating cycle.Section 2:  Ongoing Support Services for Ad-hoc and Emergency WorksThe services comprise of the labour, plant, tools, equipment, mobilization and all associated requirements (including the disposal of associated sludge) for ad-hoc and emergency pump-outs of Council owned or managed septic tanks, effluent pump stations, flushing of lines or any other works as required, including outside specified working hours. Tender closes at 2.00pm Friday 14 May 2021.

title: DIT049211 21C006 Beachport Jetty Stimulus Project and 21C007 Kingscote Main Jetty Stimulus Project
blurb: The Department for Infrastructure and Transport (the Department) invites suitably experienced organisations to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) to deliver the following projects:	Contract No. 21C006 Beachport Jetty – Stimulus Project; and	Contract No. 21C007 Kingscote Main Jetty – Stimulus Project.This EOI is the first phase of a two-phase procurement process to shortlist one tenderer for each site who will enter the Early Contractor Involvement (ECI) stage for each Contract.The Beachport Jetty and the Kingscote Main Jetty are both owned and maintained by the State. The purpose for this project is to carry out maintenance works necessary on the Beachport Jetty and the Kingscote Main Jetty to reinstate the assets to provide a 30-year design life, in accordance with the priority list of works in the Design Reports for each site. TENDER RESPONSE UPLOADShould you require assistance in uploading your tender submission electronically please contact the Tenders SA helpdesk on 8462 1401. It is recommended that you allow at least two hours prior to tender closing time to ensure that you upload your tender. A receipt number will be issued to confirm that your submission has been completed successfully.Multiple files may be permitted - please ensure individual files do not exceed 20MB per file.

title: Racism. It Stops With Me campaign
blurb: The Australian Human Rights Commission (Commission) is currently refreshing its National Anti-Racism Strategy to update and build upon the Racism. It Stops With Me (RISWM) campaign. This campaign is a key activity under the strategy.
description: This project provides an opportunity to update the RISWM campaign in light of recent discussions about anti-racism, and to help campaign supporters, workplaces, and the Australian public to engage productively in these discussions. While the RISWM campaign will continue to focus on interpersonal racism, the project will have an additional focus on forms of structural/systemic and institutional racism. It will consider the effects that racism can have on the lives of people living in Australia and on social cohesion. The campaign aims to increase understanding of these concepts within mainstream Australian society and to assist supporters, and potential supporters, in addressing them.

title: DCP048717 P267 - Psychological Assessment Services
blurb: Under sections 107 and 110A of the Children and Young People (Safety) Act 2017, any person employed in a Children’s residential facility established or licensed by DCP must undergo a psychological assessment of a kind determined by the department. No individual will be employed in a DCP residential care facility without being deemed to be ‘Suitable’ following a psychological assessment process.Psychological (Suitability) Assessments are a standard part of the recruitment process for Residential Care and relate directly to recommendation 138 of the Nyland Royal Commission.The department is seeking to establish agreements with one or more approved providers of psychological assessment services for:	assessment of potential new recruits to ‘in scope’ roles	assessment of existing DCP staff who have not been through the psychological assessment process	psychological re-assessment.
description: Under sections 107 and 110A of the Children and Young People (Safety) Act 2017, any person employed in a Children’s residential facility established or licensed by DCP must undergo a psychological assessment of a kind determined by the department. title: Human Capital Management Solution
blurb: Human Capital Management System Solution
description: The Bank is seeking a new HCM Solution that would need to be a comprehensive product that at a minimum had the following attributes:•Cloud software as a service (SaaS) based platform•Supports all of the Bank’s key human resource (HR) processes, including workforce planning, remuneration and benefits management, performance management, talent management and succession planning, career planning and development, position management, time and attendance, administration of staff data, and  employee/manager self-service.•Provides all of the key HR functionality in a single and/or integrated system.•Can be accessed via an application (Apple or android) on mobile devices (tablets and mobile phones) for most commonly used self-service tasks, including (at a minimum):(i) Viewing leave balances and submitting leave requests; and(ii) Actioning/viewing workflow notifications and approvals.•Can integrate with the Bank’s current on premise payroll system (PeopleSoft HCM) to facilitate payroll processing, by providing input data into the core Human Resource (HR), global payroll (GP), absence management (AM) and time and labour (TL) modules as required. •Supports Single Sign-on (SSO) user authentication via Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML 2.0).•Has Service and Organisation Control 2 (SOC2) Type II or Information Security Registered Assessors Program (IRAP) certification or ISO 27001.•Provides the capability to ensure that the Bank data (all content, metadata and user information) is encrypted in-transit and at-rest (on disk/backup & offline storage). Data transmissions including all server-to-server transmissions, within, between and outside data centres.•Has the capability to send emails as part of the business process workflowsj. Has the capability to provide audit information of system and data transactions regularly and on request
