title: GC049152 Design Services – Greater Adelaide Cycleway
blurb: The Town of Gawler (Council) is undertaking the construction of new cycling connections to deliver a continuous cycle connection from Adelaide to the Barossa Valley.  The Greater Adelaide Cycle Way will connect two regional cycle paths, the Barossa Trail and the Stuart O’Grady trail, and the existing shared path network capitalising on both the ToG and the Barossa Council’s significant investment in cycling infrastructure.Council is seeking the services of a suitably qualified organisation to develop a detailed design for this project that incorporates:	Design and locations of wayfinding signage, water fountains, bicycle rails, street furniture, shelters, and landscaping;	Design and locations of shared use path ramps;	Design and locations of “sharrow” linemarking symbols;	Design and locations of shared path linemarked lines;	Design and locations of street lighting (replacing existing luminaires to LED);	Design of passive maze: asphalt track crossing, concrete slabs, maze safety fencing, tactile ground surface indicators, paving and signage at Warren Street, Gawler East;	Design and locations shared use path: path including excavation of soil, installation of pavement and fencing; and	Potential design upgrade at Reid Reserve.
description: The Town of Gawler (Council) is undertaking the construction of new cycling connections to deliver a continuous cycle connection from Adelaide to the Barossa Valley.  The Greater Adelaide Cycle Way will connect two regional cycle paths, the Barossa Trail and the Stuart O’Grady trail, and the existing shared path network capitalising on both the ToG and the Barossa Council’s significant investment in cycling infrastructure.Council is seeking the services of a suitably qualified organisation to develop a detailed design for this project that incorporates:	Design and locations of wayfinding signage, water fountains, bicycle rails, street furniture, shelters, and landscaping;	Design and locations of shared use path ramps;	Design and locations of “sharrow” linemarking symbols;	Design and locations of shared path linemarked lines;	Design and locations of street lighting (replacing existing luminaires to LED);	Design of passive maze: asphalt track crossing, concrete slabs, maze safety fencing, tactile ground surface indicators, paving and signage at Warren Street, Gawler East;	Design and locations shared use path: path including excavation of soil, installation of pavement and fencing; and	Potential design upgrade at Reid Reserve.

title: Maintenance of the Large Mock Up Unit, Melbourne
blurb: Request for Tender for provision of maintenance services of the B767/A380 Large Mock Up (LMU) at the ARFFS Training School in Melbourne
description: Airservices provides Aviation Rescue Firefighting seivces (ARFFS) at 28 locations around AUstralia under the Civil Aviation Safety Authority (CASA), of Australia, Regulation 139h.The B767/A380 Large Mock Up (LMU) is a critical piece of infrastructure utilised in the initial training of ARFFS recruits and the ongoing competency training of operational members. The LMU is a complex structure involving a number of interlined systems and subsystems, including intelligent control systems, that require specialist engineering skills to maintain.THis RFT has been issued with the objective to identify a suitably qualified and experienced organisation to provide Maintenance Services for the B767/A380 Large Mock UP (LMU) located in Melbourne.The Scope of the RFT includes:Preventative Maintenance Services; andUnscheduled Services

title: RFP - Flight Information Management System Prototype
blurb: Airservices Australia Request for Proposal (RFP) 394884709  - Flight Information Management System Prototype
description: For Airservices to prepare to fulfil its legislative requirements as an Air Navigation Service Provider, the Flight Information Management System (FIMS) Prototype procurement will simultaneously seek to select a Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) Traffic Management (UTM) strategic partner, advance the UTM ecosystem within Australia, further inform the Australian Government’s policy with respect to UTM, and provide opportunities for commercialisation of developed technology between UTM companies and Airservices. Building on a Request For Information released in August of 2020, this procurement will provide Airservices with an ability to better understand potential partner capability to deliver a future operational FIMS solution.

title: Hovercraft
blurb: Hovercraft for Overwater Recovery and Intercept Capability
description: Joint Proof & Experimental Unit (JPEU) Port Wakefield (PW) requires to lease a hovercraft for 5 years, (with possible 5 x 1 year extensions), including ongoing maintenance, spares support & training to be provided at PW.The hovercraft is to provide a capability to retrieve fired or deployed projectiles and test items within the designated Defence Prohibited Area (DPA) at PW.Additionally, JPEU PW require a capability to patrol the DPA to intercept any personnel - fishers or crabbers - or boats that have entered the DPA whilst a Defence Practice is scheduled to occur.

title: DIT049138 21C177 Demolition of Properties for the Fullarton Road Intersections Upgrade
blurb: PROJECT DESCRIPTIONThe Federal and South Australian Governments have announced $96 million in funding towards the upgrade of the intersections of Cross Road and Fullarton Road and Glen Osmond Road and Fullarton Road. The State Government’s ‘Keeping Metro Traffic Moving’ report identifies these intersections for funding as a priority location for treatments addressing road congestion, so as to keep traffic flowing. Fullarton Road, Cross Road and Glen Osmond Road are major arterial roads with the intersections being used by more than 50,000 motorists every day to commute to the CBD and other parts of the city. This project proposes to increase intersection capacity through the construction of additional through and dedicated turning lanes and associated works.To facilitate the upgrade of these intersections and Department has acquired a number of properties adjoining the intersections. An experienced demolition contractor is required to demolish and clear the sites prior to the main construction works commencing. PREQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTSCompanies must be prequalified with the Department for Infrastructure and Transport in the following prequalification categories:	Demolition: D2	Asbestos Removal: AR2	 TENDER RESPONSE UPLOADShould you require assistance in uploading your tender submission electronically please contact the Tenders SA helpdesk on 8462 1401. It is recommended that you allow at least two hours prior to tender closing time to ensure that you upload your tender. A receipt number will be issued to confirm that your submission has been completed successfully.Multiple files may be permitted - please ensure individual files do not exceed 20MB per file.

title: COO049102 Internal Audit Service
blurb: The City of Onkaparinga is seeking to engage a suitably qualified and experienced service provider to assist the Council deliver a robust and comprehensive risk based internal audit program. The Council is proposing to use an outsourced model for the next three (3) financial years which will be coordinated and administered by the Corporate Governance team.

title: Replacement of Roughing Vacuum Pumps
blurb: Supply fully assembled large capacity roughing vacuum pumps
description: Initial tender is for 5 units with an option to purchase an additional 1-2 pumps.  These pumps are used to evacuate both the Detactor and collimation tanks at a pressure of up to 5E-4mbar and volumes of up to 82m3.

title: Replacement of X-Ray Reflectometer Instrument
blurb: A state of the art XREF instrument to be supplied.
description: The requirement is for an X Ray instrument that best meets the requirements as outlined in the specification document.

title: Holsworthy Building Refurbishments, NSW
blurb: Holsworthy Building Refurbishments, NSW
description: This project involves a collection of works at various sites around the Holsworthy base, which includes proposal for a hard standing storage area, alterations and additions to existing shower and toilet blocks and toilets and laundries in demountable buildings, integration of an enclosed secure location, refurbishment and upgrade to a classroom and refurbishing windows.
